original: rjes mi byed cing /
analyzed: rjes mi byed cing /
translated: not following,

original: phyir smra bar bya'o snyam du sems shing smod par byed /
analyzed: phyir smra bar bya'o snyam du sems shing smod par byed /
translated: thinking, ‘I will speak out against them,’

original: phyar ka gtong bar byed /
analyzed: phyar ka gtong bar byed /
translated: and disparage,🔽and gossip?

original: kha zer bar byed pa'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //
analyzed: kha zer bar byed pa'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //
translated: The monks reported this matter to the Blessed One.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byung ba 'di dang / gleng gzhi 'di dang / skabs 'di la dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdu ba mdzad de /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byung ba 'di dang / gleng gzhi 'di dang / skabs 'di la dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdu ba mdzad de /
translated: Then the Blessed One, with this incident and with this cause and with this occasion, gathered the saṅgha of monks.

original: dge slong nag pa la smad nas /
analyzed: dge slong nag pa la smad nas /
translated: He scolded the monk Kāla,

original: dge sbyong gi tshul ma yin pa /🔽rjes su mthun pa ma yin pa /
analyzed: dge sbyong gi tshul ma yin pa / rjes su mthun pa ma yin pa /
translated: saying, “This is not the way of a śramaṇa,🔽this is not the way of a good person,

original: rung ba ma yin pa /
analyzed: rung ba ma yin pa /
translated: this is not the way of our doctrine,🔽this is not the way it ought to be done.

original: tshul dang mthun pa ma yin pa de ni rab tu byung bas bya ba ma yin no zhes rnam grangs du mar smad de /
analyzed: tshul dang mthun pa ma yin pa de ni rab tu byung bas bya ba ma yin no zhes rnam grangs du mar smad de /
translated: This is not something a renunciant should do.”

original: bslab pa bca' ba'i phan yon bcu yang dag par gzigs pas nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul bal bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /
analyzed: bslab pa bca' ba'i phan yon bcu yang dag par gzigs pas nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul bal bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /
translated: Having seen the ten benefits of establishing training rules, he established this training rule for my disciples:

original: gus par mi byed na ltung byed do zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
analyzed: gus par mi byed na ltung byed do zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
translated: ‘If a monk does not respect the saṅgha, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”

original: yul ni rgyal po'i khab /
analyzed: yul ni rgyal po'i khab /
translated: The place was Rājagṛha.

original: gang zag ni dge slong nag pa glang chen las /
analyzed: gang zag ni dge slong nag pa glang chen las /
translated: The person was the monk Kāla.

original: nyon mongs pa ni nga rgyal gyi kun du sbyor ba /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ni nga rgyal gyi kun du sbyor ba /
translated: The affliction was the fetter of pride.

original: nyes pa ni dge 'dun dang gang zag la ma gus pa'o //
analyzed: nyes pa ni dge 'dun dang gang zag la ma gus pa'o //
translated: The offense was disrespect for the saṅgha and for individuals.

original: de la gus par mi byed na zhes bya ba ni gnyis la gus par mi byed na ste /
analyzed: de la gus par mi byed na zhes bya ba ni gnyis la gus par mi byed na ste /
translated: If he does not respect them, means if he does not respect the two.

original: dge 'dun la dang / gang zag la'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun la dang / gang zag la'o //
translated: The two are the community and the individual.

original: de la dge 'dun ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyan thos kyi dge 'dun dang / dge 'dun gyi tha snyad do ;
analyzed: de la dge 'dun ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyan thos kyi dge 'dun dang / dge 'dun gyi tha snyad do ;
translated: The community is the community of disciples of the Tathagata, and the term community is used for it.

original: / gang zag ni mkhan po dang slob dpon dag go //
analyzed: / gang zag ni mkhan po dang slob dpon dag go //
translated: The individual is the preceptor and the teacher.

original: ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: A downfall is as previously explained.

original: de lta ltung bar ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de lta ltung bar ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How does a downfall occur?

original: 'dir yang dngos gzhi dang / sbyor ba dang / sbyor ba'i sbyor ba ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa dang / ltung ba med pa dang bslab par bya ba dang / phyir bcos pa rnams kyis 'di'i mtshan nyid shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang dngos gzhi dang / sbyor ba dang / sbyor ba'i sbyor ba ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa dang / ltung ba med pa dang bslab par bya ba dang / phyir bcos pa rnams kyis 'di'i mtshan nyid shes par bya'o //
translated: Here, the characteristics of this downfall should be understood by means of the basic transgression, the preparatory stage, the preparatory stage of the preparatory stage, the determination of the downfall, the absence of a downfall, the training precept, and the restoration of the vow.

original: de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni dge slong sangs rgyas kyi bka' dang dge 'dun gyi tha snyad pa'i tshig las 'gal bar byed pa dang / dge slong gi dge 'dun gyi 'dug pa dang / 'gro ba dang / gnas mal len pa dang ;
analyzed: de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni dge slong sangs rgyas kyi bka' dang dge 'dun gyi tha snyad pa'i tshig las 'gal bar byed pa dang / dge slong gi dge 'dun gyi 'dug pa dang / 'gro ba dang / gnas mal len pa dang ;
translated: Here, the fundamental transgressions are defined as follows: A monk who acts in contradiction to the word of the Buddha or to the words of the Saṅgha that are in accord with the Dharma, and who,🔽through disrespect for the meaning of the injunctions that are in accord with the Dharma, such as sitting, walking, receiving bedding,

original: gtsug lag khang len pa dang / smra ba la sogs pa chos dang ldan pa nyid kyis bsgo ba'i don la ma gus par chos dang ldan par shad kyis sbyangs pa med par de las bzlog ste 'gal bar byed pa dang / gzhan dag chos dang ldan pa'i gtam rnam par gtan la 'bebs pa'i bar du glo bur du gtam zer @7b na ma gus pa'i tshul gyis ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gtsug lag khang len pa dang / smra ba la sogs pa chos dang ldan pa nyid kyis bsgo ba'i don la ma gus par chos dang ldan par shad kyis sbyangs pa med par de las bzlog ste 'gal bar byed pa dang / gzhan dag chos dang ldan pa'i gtam rnam par gtan la 'bebs pa'i bar du glo bur du gtam zer @7b na ma gus pa'i tshul gyis ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
translated: receiving a temple, speaking, and so on, acts in contradiction to them without purifying himself through confession in accord with the Dharma, and who suddenly interrupts the Dharma talk of others with a talk of disrespect, commits a fundamental transgression.

original: sangs rgyas kyi bka' las 'gal bar byed pa la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi bka' las 'gal bar byed pa la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no blame for acting in contradiction to the word of the Buddha.

original: dge 'dun gyi tha snyad pa ni dge 'dun gyi kha yin pas de'i phyir dge 'dun gyi tha snyad byed pa gnas brtan dang / dge skos la sogs pa gang zag gi las bcu gnyis su bskos pa rnams kyi tshig las 'gal bar byed ba la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi tha snyad pa ni dge 'dun gyi kha yin pas de'i phyir dge 'dun gyi tha snyad byed pa gnas brtan dang / dge skos la sogs pa gang zag gi las bcu gnyis su bskos pa rnams kyi tshig las 'gal bar byed ba la na smad pa med do //
translated: The term “Saṅgha” refers to the mouth of the Saṅgha. Therefore, there is no fault in contradicting the words of those who are appointed to the twelve types of Saṅgha duties, such as the elder and the disciplinarian, who are appointed to perform the Saṅgha’s business.

original: dge slong gi dge 'dun gyi tshig las 'gal bar byed pa la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: dge slong gi dge 'dun gyi tshig las 'gal bar byed pa la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no fault in contradicting the words of the Saṅgha of monks.

original: dge 'dun gyi 'dug pa dang / 'gro ba dang gnas mal len pa dang / gtsug lag khang len pa dang / smra ba la sogs pa'i don bsgo ba lam gus pas chos dang ldan par shad kyis sbyang ba med par phyir bzlog cing 'gal bar byed pa la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi 'dug pa dang / 'gro ba dang gnas mal len pa dang / gtsug lag khang len pa dang / smra ba la sogs pa'i don bsgo ba lam gus pas chos dang ldan par shad kyis sbyang ba med par phyir bzlog cing 'gal bar byed pa la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no fault in contradicting the words of the Saṅgha when it is appointing a place for the Saṅgha to stay, when it is appointing a bed and seat, when it is appointing a temple, when it is appointing a messenger, and so on.

original: dge 'dun gyi chos dang ldan pa nyid du bsgo ba las bzlog cing 'gal bar byed do cog la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi chos dang ldan pa nyid du bsgo ba las bzlog cing 'gal bar byed do cog la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no fault in contradicting the Saṅgha’s appointment of someone as a monk who is in accordance with the Dharma.

original: gzhan dag chos dang ldan pa'i gtam rnam par gtan la 'bebs pa'i bar du glo bur du gtam zer ba la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: gzhan dag chos dang ldan pa'i gtam rnam par gtan la 'bebs pa'i bar du glo bur du gtam zer ba la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no fault in interrupting the speech of others when it is a Dharma discourse.

original: 'di'i byed pa po ni sangs rgyas kyi bka' dang / dge 'dun gyi tha snyad pa'i tshig dang / dge slong gi dge 'dun gyis chos dang ldan pa nyid du bsgo ba'i don dang / gzhan dag chos dang ldan pa'i gtam rnam par gtan la 'bebs pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'di'i byed pa po ni sangs rgyas kyi bka' dang / dge 'dun gyi tha snyad pa'i tshig dang / dge slong gi dge 'dun gyis chos dang ldan pa nyid du bsgo ba'i don dang / gzhan dag chos dang ldan pa'i gtam rnam par gtan la 'bebs pa nyid do //
translated: The agent of this is the Buddha’s word, the words of the Saṅgha’s conventions, the meaning of the Saṅgha of monks’ Dharma pronouncements, and the Dharma discourses of others.

original: 'di la yan lag lngas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di la yan lag lngas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
translated: Here, the basis is fivefold:

original: sangs rgyas kyi bka' 'am /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi bka' 'am /
translated: the Buddha’s word,

original: dge 'dun gyi tha snyad pa'i tshig gam dge slong gi dge 'dun gyis bsgo ba'i don nam /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi tha snyad pa'i tshig gam dge slong gi dge 'dun gyis bsgo ba'i don nam /
translated: the words of the Saṅgha’s conventions, the meaning of the Saṅgha of monks’ pronouncements,

original: gzhan gyi chos dang ldan pa'i gtam dag las gang yang rung ba nyid dang / chos dang ldan pa nyid dang / ma gus pas chos dang ldan par shad kyis sbyang ba med pa nyid dang / log thabs kyi bsam pa nyid dang / 'gal bar byed pa nyid do //
analyzed: gzhan gyi chos dang ldan pa'i gtam dag las gang yang rung ba nyid dang / chos dang ldan pa nyid dang / ma gus pas chos dang ldan par shad kyis sbyang ba med pa nyid dang / log thabs kyi bsam pa nyid dang / 'gal bar byed pa nyid do //
translated: The other are: any of the above, being endowed with Dharma, being without the purification of the Dharma through disrespect, having the intention to deceive, and being in opposition.

original: de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad do //
analyzed: de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad do //
translated: If any of these are incomplete, one is censured as appropriate.

original: sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas te /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas te /
translated: The downfall through transgression is a minor offense.

original: ji srid du ma gus pa'i tshul gyis ltung ba'i sbyor ba brtsams nas /
analyzed: ji srid du ma gus pa'i tshul gyis ltung ba'i sbyor ba brtsams nas /
translated: As long as one has begun the transgression of the downfall through disrespect,

original: dngos gzhi la ma thug gi bar du nyes byas so //
analyzed: dngos gzhi la ma thug gi bar du nyes byas so //
translated: but has not yet reached the actual basis, it is a minor offense.

original: dngos gzhi la sbyor ba tha dad pa ji snyed brtsams pa re re la nyes byas re re'o //
analyzed: dngos gzhi la sbyor ba tha dad pa ji snyed brtsams pa re re la nyes byas re re'o //
translated: For each of the various preparations for the actual basis, there is a minor offense.

original: mkhan po dang slob dpon dag gis bsgo ba'i don las 'gal bar byed pa la nyes byas so //
analyzed: mkhan po dang slob dpon dag gis bsgo ba'i don las 'gal bar byed pa la nyes byas so //
translated: To oppose the meaning of the instructions of the preceptor and the master is a minor offense.

original: dge slong gi dge 'dun gyi ltung ba'i sbyor ba chos dang ldan pa nyid ma yin pa 'gal bar byed na nyes byas so //🔽rgyal po dang / dgra bcom pa dang / dge 'dun @8a * //🔽gyi gnas brtan gyi chig las 'gal bar byed pa la nyes byas so //
analyzed: dge slong gi dge 'dun gyi ltung ba'i sbyor ba chos dang ldan pa nyid ma yin pa 'gal bar byed na nyes byas so // rgyal po dang / dgra bcom pa dang / dge 'dun @8a * // gyi gnas brtan gyi chig las 'gal bar byed pa la nyes byas so //
translated: If one causes a schism in the Saṅgha of fully ordained monks by means of a Dharma-based accusation of a minor infraction, it is an offense of wrong conduct.🔽If one causes a schism in the Saṅgha of fully ordained monks by means of a non-Dharma-based accusation of a minor infraction, it is a serious violation.

original: sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas phra mo ste /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas phra mo ste /
translated: If one causes a schism in the Saṅgha of fully ordained monks by means of a Dharma-based accusation of a preparatory act, it is a minor offense.

original: sbyor ba ji snyed pa la sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'ang de snyed de /
analyzed: sbyor ba ji snyed pa la sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'ang de snyed de /
translated: As many preparatory acts as there are, there are also that many preparatory acts of preparatory acts.

original: sbyor ba nyes byas kyi sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang nyes byas te /
analyzed: sbyor ba nyes byas kyi sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang nyes byas te /
translated: As many offenses of wrong conduct as there are, there are also that many offenses of wrong conduct of offenses of wrong conduct.

original: nyes byas phra mo'o //
analyzed: nyes byas phra mo'o //
translated: They are minor offenses.🔽There is no offense if one is speaking to a māra, a tīrthika, or an ordinary person, and their words are not Dharma-based.

original: ltung ba med pa ni bdud dang / mu stegs can dang / gang zag phal pa'i tshig chos dang ldan pa ma yin pa la ltung ba med do //🔽chos dang ldan par shad kyis sbyar ba sbyin par byed na ltung ba med do //
analyzed: ltung ba med pa ni bdud dang / mu stegs can dang / gang zag phal pa'i tshig chos dang ldan pa ma yin pa la ltung ba med do //🔽chos dang ldan par shad kyis sbyar ba sbyin par byed na ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if one is speaking to someone who is explaining the Dharma, and one is speaking in a Dharma-based way.

original: las dang po ba dang / smyos pa dang / sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor bdag gis nyen pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: las dang po ba dang / smyos pa dang / sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor bdag gis nyen pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if one is a beginner, if one is insane, if one is deranged, if one is overwhelmed by pain, if one is the first offender.

original: bslab par bya ba ni dge slong gis yul thams cad la gnas skabs thams cad du ma gus pa'i tshul gyis ltung byed du 'gyur ba rnam pa thams cad mi bsten par bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: bslab par bya ba ni dge slong gis yul thams cad la gnas skabs thams cad du ma gus pa'i tshul gyis ltung byed du 'gyur ba rnam pa thams cad mi bsten par bslab par bya'o //
translated: The training rule is that a monk should train by not relying on any of the ways of disrespecting the entire country in any situation.

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi bka' dang / dge slong dgra bcom pa zag pa zad pa'i tshig dang / rgyal po rgyal rigs spyi bo nas dbang bskur ba'i tshig dang dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan gyi tshig dang / dge skos kyi tshig rnam par dkrug par mi bya'o //
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi bka' dang / dge slong dgra bcom pa zag pa zad pa'i tshig dang / rgyal po rgyal rigs spyi bo nas dbang bskur ba'i tshig dang dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan gyi tshig dang / dge skos kyi tshig rnam par dkrug par mi bya'o //
translated: One should not distort the words of the Perfectly Awakened One, the words of a monk who is an arhat whose defilements are exhausted, the words of a king who is a member of the warrior class and has been consecrated, the words of the elder of the saṅgha, or the words of the disciplinarian.

original: phyir bcos pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: phyir bcos pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The amendment is the same as before.

original: ma gus pa'i tshul gyi ltung byed de bdun cu brgyad pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: ma gus pa'i tshul gyi ltung byed de bdun cu brgyad pa bshad zin to /
translated: This concludes the explanation of the seventy-eighth downfall: disrespect.

original: // / myos par 'gyur ba 'thung ba'i ltung byed kyi gleng gzhi ni ;
analyzed: // / myos par 'gyur ba 'thung ba'i ltung byed kyi gleng gzhi ni ;
translated: The introduction to the downfall of drinking alcohol.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' rab na bzhugs so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' rab na bzhugs so //
translated: The Blessed Buddha was staying in Śrāvastī, in Jeta’s Grove, in Anāthapiṇḍada’s park.

original: yul ngan spong gi bu zhes bya ba na chu srin byis pa gsod kyi ril khyim bdag rtogs ldan zhes bya ba phyug pa /
analyzed: yul ngan spong gi bu zhes bya ba na chu srin byis pa gsod kyi ril khyim bdag rtogs ldan zhes bya ba phyug pa /
translated: In the country called Kapilavastu, there was a householder named Gṛdhapāda, who was rich,

original: nor mang ba longs spyod che ba /
analyzed: nor mang ba longs spyod che ba /
translated: had great wealth,

original: yongs su bzung ba yangs shing rgya che ba /🔽rnam thos kyi bu'i nor dang ldan pa /
analyzed: yongs su bzung ba yangs shing rgya che ba / rnam thos kyi bu'i nor dang ldan pa /
translated: had extensive and vast possessions,🔽and was equal in wealth to Vaiśravaṇa.

original: rnam thos kyi bu'i nor gyis 'gran pa zhig 'dug pa des rigs mnyam pa las chung ma blangs nas des de dang lhan cig rtse bar byed /
analyzed: rnam thos kyi bu'i nor gyis 'gran pa zhig 'dug pa des rigs mnyam pa las chung ma blangs nas des de dang lhan cig rtse bar byed /
translated: He took a wife from a family of equal rank, and he played with her,

original: dga' bar byed dga' mgur spyod par byed do //
analyzed: dga' bar byed dga' mgur spyod par byed do //
translated: had fun with her, and made love to her.

original: de la bu mo gzugs bzang ba blta na sdug pa mdzas pa zhig btsas nas de bsring skyed de chen por gyur nas khyim bdag mgon med zas sbyin gyis dpal gyi 'byor pas bu'i chung mar blangs so //
analyzed: de la bu mo gzugs bzang ba blta na sdug pa mdzas pa zhig btsas nas de bsring skyed de chen por gyur nas khyim bdag mgon med zas sbyin gyis dpal gyi 'byor pas bu'i chung mar blangs so //
translated: A daughter was born to him, who was well proportioned, pleasing to the eye, and beautiful. She was raised and grew up, and the householder Anāthapiṇḍada took her as his son’s wife, with all the splendor of wealth.

original: khyim bdag rtogs ldan de dang rtse bar byed /
analyzed: khyim bdag rtogs ldan de dang rtse bar byed /
translated: He played with her, took pleasure in her, and enjoyed himself with her.

original: dga' bar byed dga' mgur spyod par byed pa'i chung ma la sems can srid pa tha ma zhig zhugs nas /
analyzed: dga' bar byed dga' mgur spyod par byed pa'i chung ma la sems can srid pa tha ma zhig zhugs nas /
translated: A being who was in his final existence entered her womb.

original: de btsas pa las khye'u zhig byung nas @8b de'i ming legs 'ongs zhes bya bar btags so //
analyzed: de btsas pa las khye'u zhig byung nas @8b de'i ming legs 'ongs zhes bya bar btags so //
translated: When she gave birth, a boy was born, and he was named Sumukha.

original: khye'u legs 'ongs des khad kyis mnyan yod du bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar song nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la rab tu byung zhing bsnyen par rdzogs par mdzad nas /
analyzed: khye'u legs 'ongs des khad kyis mnyan yod du bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar song nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la rab tu byung zhing bsnyen par rdzogs par mdzad nas /
translated: The boy Sumukha gradually went to Śrāvastī in the presence of the Blessed One. The Blessed One allowed him to go forth and receive full ordination in the well-spoken Dharma and Vinaya.

original: de la gdams ngag stsal te /
analyzed: de la gdams ngag stsal te /
translated: He gave him instructions.

original: des gcig pu dben par bag yod pa brtun pa dang ldan pa bdag nyid gtang bar gnas pa na dgra bcom pa nyid mngon sum du byas so //
analyzed: des gcig pu dben par bag yod pa brtun pa dang ldan pa bdag nyid gtang bar gnas pa na dgra bcom pa nyid mngon sum du byas so //
translated: He dwelled alone in seclusion, heedful, ardent, and resolute, and realized the state of an arhat.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das dge slong gi dge 'dun 'khor dang bcas pa yul ngan spong gi bu dag tu ljongs rgyu zhing gshegs pa na chu srin byis pa gsod gyi ri la byon nas /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das dge slong gi dge 'dun 'khor dang bcas pa yul ngan spong gi bu dag tu ljongs rgyu zhing gshegs pa na chu srin byis pa gsod gyi ri la byon nas /
translated: Then the Blessed One, together with the community of monks and their retinue, went to the country of Kapilavastu on a journey through the countryside.🔽When they arrived at the mountain of the sea monster called Devadanta,🔽the Blessed One stayed in a terrifying forest, a place where deer lived.🔽At that time, the venerable Subhadra was living in a place called the bank of the pond of the sea monster Devadanta.

original: chu srin byis pa gsod kyi ril 'jigs su rung ba'i tshal ri dags kyi gnas na bzhugs pa'i tshe tshe dang ldan pa legs 'ongs kyis klu aa mra'i chu dogs pa zhes bya ba 'dug pa yun ring po nas chu srin byis pa gsod kyi ril gnas pa'i
analyzed: chu srin byis pa gsod kyi ril 'jigs su rung ba'i tshal ri dags kyi gnas na bzhugs pa'i tshe tshe dang ldan pa legs 'ongs kyis klu aa mra'i chu dogs pa zhes bya ba 'dug pa yun ring po nas chu srin byis pa gsod kyi ril gnas pa'i
translated: He had been there for a long time, and he was a sea monster who had been living on the mountain of the sea monster Devadanta.

original: skye bo khon med pa rnams la khon du 'dzin pa /🔽mi 'gran pa rnams nas 'gran tshol ba /
analyzed: skye bo khon med pa rnams la khon du 'dzin pa / mi 'gran pa rnams nas 'gran tshol ba /
translated: He was someone who held grudges against those who had no grudges against him.🔽He was someone who sought out rivals with those who were not rivals.

original: mi 'khu ba rnams la 'khu bar byed cing /
analyzed: mi 'khu ba rnams la 'khu bar byed cing /
translated: He was someone who was hostile to those who were not hostile.🔽He made all the crops that were growing there unfit to eat.

original: lo tog skyes so cog ma rung bar byed ba de btul nas bcom ldan 'das dge slong gi dge 'dun 'khor dang bcas pa slar kos la dag tu ljongs rgyu zhing gshegs pa na /
analyzed: lo tog skyes so cog ma rung bar byed ba de btul nas bcom ldan 'das dge slong gi dge 'dun 'khor dang bcas pa slar kos la dag tu ljongs rgyu zhing gshegs pa na /
translated: After Subhadra was subdued, the Blessed One, together with the community of monks and their retinue, returned to the country of Kosala on a journey through the countryside.

original: mthar gyis mnyan yod du byon nas /
analyzed: mthar gyis mnyan yod du byon nas /
translated: Finally, he arrived at Śrāvastī.

original: mnyan yod na rgyal byad kyi tshal mgon med thas sbyin gyi kun dga' rab na bzhugs so //
analyzed: mnyan yod na rgyal byad kyi tshal mgon med thas sbyin gyi kun dga' rab na bzhugs so //
translated: In Śrāvastī, he stayed in the Jeta Grove, in the park of Anāthapiṇḍada.

original: de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das dge slong gi dge 'dun 'khor dang bcas pa ni khyim bdag mgon med zas sbyin gyis gdugs tshod la spyan drangs nas der gshegs so //🔽tshe dang ldan pa legs 'ongs ni chu srin byis pa gsod kyi ril khyim bdag rtogs ldan gyi chung po grogs bram ze sbrul khas sdigs pa zhig 'dug pa de klu aa mra'i chu dogs pa'i 'jigs pas bros te mnyan yod na song ba na ko sa la'i
analyzed: de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das dge slong gi dge 'dun 'khor dang bcas pa ni khyim bdag mgon med zas sbyin gyis gdugs tshod la spyan drangs nas der gshegs so // tshe dang ldan pa legs 'ongs ni chu srin byis pa gsod kyi ril khyim bdag rtogs ldan gyi chung po grogs bram ze sbrul khas sdigs pa zhig 'dug pa de klu aa mra'i chu dogs pa'i 'jigs pas bros te mnyan yod na song ba na ko sa la'i
translated: At that time, the Blessed One, together with the assembly of monks, was invited to the midday meal by the householder Anāthapiṇḍada. He went there.🔽The venerable Svāgata was in the belly of a makara. A young brahmin friend of the householder Śreṇiya, who was threatened by a snake, fled in fear to the bank of the mango pond of the nāga. He went to Śrāvastī.

original: rgyal po gsal rgyal gyis glang po che'i chang pa'i blar bskos pa des tshe dang ldan pa legs 'ongs kyis klu de btul ba thos nas dga' ba'i dbang du byas pa'i zan la de'i khyim gzhan du bos so //
analyzed: rgyal po gsal rgyal gyis glang po che'i chang pa'i blar bskos pa des tshe dang ldan pa legs 'ongs kyis klu de btul ba thos nas dga' ba'i dbang du byas pa'i zan la de'i khyim gzhan du bos so //
translated: There, he was appointed as the chief elephant trainer by King Prasenajit of Kośala. Having heard that the venerable Svāgata had subdued that nāga, he was overjoyed. He invited him to his house for a meal.

original: de nas bram ze des tshe dang ldan pa legs 'ongs bde bar 'dug par rig nas kha zas bsod bas tshim par byas so //
analyzed: de nas bram ze des tshe dang ldan pa legs 'ongs bde bar 'dug par rig nas kha zas bsod bas tshim par byas so //
translated: The brahman knew that the venerable Supuṣpacandra was comfortable, and he satisfied him with delicious food.

original: bram ze des bsams pa /
analyzed: bram ze des bsams pa /
translated: The brahman thought,

original: legs 'ongs kyis kha zas bsod pa zos bas 'ju bar mi nus so snyam du rig nas /
analyzed: legs 'ongs kyis kha zas bsod pa zos bas 'ju bar mi nus so snyam du rig nas /
translated: “Since Supuṣpacandra ate delicious food, he won’t be able to digest it.”🔽Knowing this,

original: @9a * // tshe dang ldan pa legs 'ongs la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: @9a * // tshe dang ldan pa legs 'ongs la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: he said to the venerable Supuṣpacandra,

original: btsun pa legs 'ongs bstsang nan gsol lam /
analyzed: btsun pa legs 'ongs bstsang nan gsol lam /
translated: “Noble Supuṣpacandra, have you finished eating?”

original: des smras pa 'bud do //
analyzed: des smras pa 'bud do //
translated: “I have finished,” he said.

original: bram ze des glang po che'i char gnang du mdzub mo btsugs te skom gyi nang du krog krog dkrugs nas tshe dang ldan pa legs 'ongs la phul lo //
analyzed: bram ze des glang po che'i char gnang du mdzub mo btsugs te skom gyi nang du krog krog dkrugs nas tshe dang ldan pa legs 'ongs la phul lo //
translated: The brahman pointed to the elephant’s tusk and stirred the water in the drinking vessel. He offered it to the venerable Supuṣpacandra.

original: dgra bcom pa rnams ni ma bsams par shes pa dang mthong ba mi 'jug pas tshe dang ldan pa legs 'ongs kyis de 'thungs te /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa rnams ni ma bsams par shes pa dang mthong ba mi 'jug pas tshe dang ldan pa legs 'ongs kyis de 'thungs te /
translated: Since arhats do not engage in knowing and seeing without reflection, the venerable Supuṣpacandra drank it.

original: yon bshad pa byas nas stan las langs te song ngo //
analyzed: yon bshad pa byas nas stan las langs te song ngo //
translated: After he had given the gift, he rose from his seat and left.

original: de mnyan yod kyi srad re ldes g-yogs pa las thal nas nyi ma'i 'od zer dag gis lus la phog pa dang / ra ro nas chang gis myos pa'i shugs kyis sa la 'gyel lo //
analyzed: de mnyan yod kyi srad re ldes g-yogs pa las thal nas nyi ma'i 'od zer dag gis lus la phog pa dang / ra ro nas chang gis myos pa'i shugs kyis sa la 'gyel lo //
translated: He was covered with a thin cloth in Śrāvastī, and when the sun’s rays struck his body, he fell to the ground in a drunken stupor.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni bsnyel ba mi mnga' ba'i chos nyid mnga' ba yin pas /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni bsnyel ba mi mnga' ba'i chos nyid mnga' ba yin pas /
translated: The Blessed Buddhas are endowed with the nature of non-forgetfulness.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis der lo ma ma yin pa'i sbyil bu zhig sbrul pa mdzad de bkab po //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis der lo ma ma yin pa'i sbyil bu zhig sbrul pa mdzad de bkab po //
translated: The Blessed One created a leafless hut to cover him.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das dge slong gi dge 'dun 'khor dang bcas pa khyim bdag mgon med zas sbyin gyi khyim du gdugs tshod gsol nas yon bshad pa mdzad de gdan las bzhengs nas gshegs te phyogs der byon no //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das dge slong gi dge 'dun 'khor dang bcas pa khyim bdag mgon med zas sbyin gyi khyim du gdugs tshod gsol nas yon bshad pa mdzad de gdan las bzhengs nas gshegs te phyogs der byon no //
translated: Then the Blessed One, together with the Saṅgha of monks and retinue, took his meal at the home of the householder Anāthapiṇḍada. After the Blessed One had given the teaching on generosity, he rose from his seat and departed. He arrived at that place.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis rdzu 'phrul mngon par 'du mdzad pa de brtul nas dge slong rnams la bka' stsal ba dge slong dag 'di ni gang gis klu aa mra'i chu ngogs pa btul ba'i dge slong legs 'ongs zhes bya ba de yin na dge slong dag
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis rdzu 'phrul mngon par 'du mdzad pa de brtul nas dge slong rnams la bka' stsal ba dge slong dag 'di ni gang gis klu aa mra'i chu ngogs pa btul ba'i dge slong legs 'ongs zhes bya ba de yin na dge slong dag
translated: Then the Blessed One withdrew his miraculous power, and said to the monks, “Monks, this is the monk Svāgata, who subdued the nāga Aḍakavati.

original: ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: ji snyam du sems /
translated: Monks, what do you think?

original: dge slong legs 'ongs 'di da ltar sbrul phrug kyang thub par nus sam /
analyzed: dge slong legs 'ongs 'di da ltar sbrul phrug kyang thub par nus sam /
translated: Is this monk Svāgata now able to subdue even a baby nāga?”

original: btsun pa rdo mi thogs so //
analyzed: btsun pa rdo mi thogs so //
translated: “No, Venerable One, he is not.”

original: dge slong dag de ltar na nyes dmigs 'di dang gzhan dag kyang myos par 'gyur ba 'thungs pa las 'byung bas dge slong dag nga la ston pa'o zhes zer ba dag gis myos par 'gyur ba tha na rtsva'i rtse mos kyang btung bar mi bya zhing blud par
analyzed: dge slong dag de ltar na nyes dmigs 'di dang gzhan dag kyang myos par 'gyur ba 'thungs pa las 'byung bas dge slong dag nga la ston pa'o zhes zer ba dag gis myos par 'gyur ba tha na rtsva'i rtse mos kyang btung bar mi bya zhing blud par
translated: “Monks, since these and other problems arise from drinking intoxicants, those who say ‘I am a teacher of the Blessed One’ should not drink intoxicants, not even as much as is contained in the tip of a blade of grass, and should not cause others to drink them.

original: yang mi bya'o //
analyzed: yang mi bya'o //
translated: They should not drink them and should not cause others to drink them.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa legs 'ongs sad par mdzad nas bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa legs 'ongs sad par mdzad nas bka' stsal pa /
translated: Then the Blessed One woke up the venerable Svāgata and said,

original: legs 'ongs ci'i phyir 'di ltar gyur /
analyzed: legs 'ongs ci'i phyir 'di ltar gyur /
translated: “Svāgata, why did this happen?”

original: bcom ldan 'das ma bsams so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ma bsams so //
translated: “Blessed One, I did not think.”

original: bde bar gshegs pa ma bsams so //
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa ma bsams so //
translated: “Sugata, I did not think.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das gtsug lag khang du gshegs te byon nas dge slong gi dge 'dun gyi gung la gdan bshams pa nyid la bzhugs nas @9b dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das gtsug lag khang du gshegs te byon nas dge slong gi dge 'dun gyi gung la gdan bshams pa nyid la bzhugs nas @9b dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /
translated: Then the Blessed One went to the monastery and, having arrived, sat on the seat prepared for him in front of the community of monks and said to the monks,

original: dge slong dag de lta bas na phan yon bcu yang dag par gzigs pas nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /
analyzed: dge slong dag de lta bas na phan yon bcu yang dag par gzigs pas nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /
translated: “Monks, for that reason my disciples should recite this basis of training in the Teaching for the benefit of ten things:

original: 'bru'i chang dad bcos pa'i chang myos par 'gyur ba 'thungs na ltung byed do zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
analyzed: 'bru'i chang dad bcos pa'i chang myos par 'gyur ba 'thungs na ltung byed do zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
translated: ‘If one drinks alcohol or a fermented liquor, one commits a sthūlātyaya offense.’”

original: yul ni mnyan yod /
analyzed: yul ni mnyan yod /
translated: The place was Śrāvastī.

original: gang zag ni tshe dang ldan pa legs 'ongs /
analyzed: gang zag ni tshe dang ldan pa legs 'ongs /
translated: The person was the venerable Svāgata.

original: nyon mongs pa ni bag chags ma byang bas ma bsams pa /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ni bag chags ma byang bas ma bsams pa /
translated: The affliction was not purifying his latent tendencies.

original: nyes pa ni myos par 'gyur ba 'thungs pa'o //
analyzed: nyes pa ni myos par 'gyur ba 'thungs pa'o //
translated: The offense was drinking alcohol.

original: de la 'bru'i chang zhes bya ba ni chan gyi btud ba dang / phyi'i btung ba dang / phabs kyi btud ba'o //
analyzed: de la 'bru'i chang zhes bya ba ni chan gyi btud ba dang / phyi'i btung ba dang / phabs kyi btud ba'o //
translated: “Grain beer” means beer made from grain, or from a fruit, or from a root.

original: bcos pa'i chang zhes bya ba ni rtsa ba'i btung ba dang / sdong bu'i btung ba dang / 'dab ma'i btung ba dang / me tog dang 'bras bu'i btung ba'o //
analyzed: bcos pa'i chang zhes bya ba ni rtsa ba'i btung ba dang / sdong bu'i btung ba dang / 'dab ma'i btung ba dang / me tog dang 'bras bu'i btung ba'o //
translated: “Medicinal beer” means beer made from a root, a stem, a leaf, a flower, or a fruit.

original: de gnyis bsres pa ni 'bru'i chang dang bcos pa'i chang zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de gnyis bsres pa ni 'bru'i chang dang bcos pa'i chang zhes bya'o //
translated: A mixture of the two is called “grain beer and medicinal beer.”

original: myos par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni 'thungs na myos par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: myos par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni 'thungs na myos par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: “Intoxicating” means that if one drinks it, one becomes intoxicated.

original: 'thungs na zhes bya ba ni mgul du mid na'o //
analyzed: 'thungs na zhes bya ba ni mgul du mid na'o //
translated: “If one drinks” means if one swallows it.

original: ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //🔽de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no // de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: “Offense” means as before.

original: 'dir yang dngos gzhi dang / sbyor ba dang / sbyor ba'i sbyor bas ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa dang / ltung ba med pa dang / phyir bcos pa rnams kyi 'di'i mtshan nyid shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang dngos gzhi dang / sbyor ba dang / sbyor ba'i sbyor bas ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa dang / ltung ba med pa dang / phyir bcos pa rnams kyi 'di'i mtshan nyid shes par bya'o //
translated: Here, one should understand the characteristics of the basic offense, the preparatory action, the subsequent action, the classification of the offense, the absence of an offense, and the amendment of the offense.

original: de la 'dir yang dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam bar gzhag na ni dge slong 'bru'i chang dang / bcos pa'i chang myos par 'gyur ba ma bskol ba dang / 'bru'i chang gi sbang ma dang / bcos pa'i chang gi tshigs ma myos par 'gyur ba mgul du mid na myos par 'gyur ba 'thung ba'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: de la 'dir yang dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam bar gzhag na ni dge slong 'bru'i chang dang / bcos pa'i chang myos par 'gyur ba ma bskol ba dang / 'bru'i chang gi sbang ma dang / bcos pa'i chang gi tshigs ma myos par 'gyur ba mgul du mid na myos par 'gyur ba 'thung ba'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro ;
translated: If the actual basis of a downfall is defined in this context, then drinking alcohol that is intoxicating, such as beer made from grains or from molasses, or drinking alcohol that is intoxicating when swallowed, such as the dregs of beer made from grains or the dregs of molasses beer, constitutes the actual basis of the downfall of drinking alcohol.

original: / chan dang phye ma dang phabs kyi ltung ba myos par 'gyur ba bag med pa'i gnas lan smad pa med do //
analyzed: / chan dang phye ma dang phabs kyi ltung ba myos par 'gyur ba bag med pa'i gnas lan smad pa med do //
translated: However, there is no downfall if the alcohol is not intoxicating, such as a fermented grain mash or flour, or a fermented fruit mash.

original: rtsa ba dang / sdong bu dang / 'dab ma dang / me tog dang / 'bras bu'i btung ba myos par 'gyur ba bag med pa'i gnas la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: rtsa ba dang / sdong bu dang / 'dab ma dang / me tog dang / 'bras bu'i btung ba myos par 'gyur ba bag med pa'i gnas la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no downfall if the alcohol is not intoxicating, such as a drink made from roots, a drink made from tree bark, a drink made from leaves, a drink made from flowers, or a drink made from fruits.

original: 'bru'i chang dang bcos pa'i chang myos par 'gyur ba bag med pa'i gnas la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: 'bru'i chang dang bcos pa'i chang myos par 'gyur ba bag med pa'i gnas la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no downfall if the alcohol is not intoxicating, such as beer made from grains or molasses.

original: 'bru'i chang gi sbang ma dang / bcos pa'i chang gi tshigs ma myos par 'gyur ba bag med pa'i gnas la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: 'bru'i chang gi sbang ma dang / bcos pa'i chang gi tshigs ma myos par 'gyur ba bag med pa'i gnas la na smad pa med do //
translated: It is not a downfall to drink the dregs of grain beer or the dregs of homemade beer if they no longer intoxicate.

original: myos par 'gyur ba'i kha dog dang / dri dang ro dang ldan pa dag na smad pa med do //
analyzed: myos par 'gyur ba'i kha dog dang / dri dang ro dang ldan pa dag na smad pa med do //
translated: It is not a downfall to drink beer that has lost its color, smell, or taste due to aging.

original: @10a * // 'di'i byed pa po ni myos par 'gyur ba 'thung ba nyid do //
analyzed: @10a * // 'di'i byed pa po ni myos par 'gyur ba 'thung ba nyid do //
translated: The agent of the downfall is drinking alcohol.

original: de la yan lag bzhis dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la yan lag bzhis dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
translated: The actual downfall is accrued by four factors:

original: myos par 'gyur ba nyid dang / de nyams par byas pa nyid dang / 'thungs ba nyid dang / myos par 'gyur ba nyid do //
analyzed: myos par 'gyur ba nyid dang / de nyams par byas pa nyid dang / 'thungs ba nyid dang / myos par 'gyur ba nyid do //
translated: the alcohol itself, the intention to drink it, the drinking, and the intoxication.

original: de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad do //🔽sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas te /
analyzed: de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad do // sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas te /
translated: If any of these factors is missing, it is a minor infraction.🔽The preparatory stage of this downfall is a minor infraction.

original: ji srid du myos par 'gyur ba 'thung ba'i ltung byed kyi sbyor ba brtsams nas dngos gzhi la ma thug gi bar du nyes byas so //
analyzed: ji srid du myos par 'gyur ba 'thung ba'i ltung byed kyi sbyor ba brtsams nas dngos gzhi la ma thug gi bar du nyes byas so //
translated: As long as one is in the process of drinking alcohol but has not yet drunk the amount that would cause intoxication, one has a minor infraction.

original: dngos gzhi la sbyor ba tha dad pa ji snyed brtsams pa la nyes byas re re'o //
analyzed: dngos gzhi la sbyor ba tha dad pa ji snyed brtsams pa la nyes byas re re'o //
translated: For each of the many different preparations of the main part, there is one minor infraction.

original: phabs kyi chang bu dang / rtsa ba dang ; sdong bu dang / 'dab ma dang / me tog dang 'bras bu myos par 'gyur ba rnams dang / myos par 'gyur ba'i dri dang ro bro ba'i thug pa myos par mi byed pa rnams ni phyed nyid de nyes byas so //
analyzed: phabs kyi chang bu dang / rtsa ba dang ; sdong bu dang / 'dab ma dang / me tog dang 'bras bu myos par 'gyur ba rnams dang / myos par 'gyur ba'i dri dang ro bro ba'i thug pa myos par mi byed pa rnams ni phyed nyid de nyes byas so //
translated: The minor infractions of drinking alcohol are: a lump of yeast, roots, stems, leaves, flowers, fruits that cause intoxication, and a non-intoxicating soup that has the smell and taste of an intoxicating substance.

original: sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas phra mo ste /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas phra mo ste /
translated: The downfall of preparation for preparation is a minor infraction.

original: sbyor ba ji snyed pa la sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang de snyed de /
analyzed: sbyor ba ji snyed pa la sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang de snyed de /
translated: As many preparations as there are, there are that many preparations for preparation.

original: sbyor ba nyes byas kyi sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang nyes byas te nyes byas phra mo'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba nyes byas kyi sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang nyes byas te nyes byas phra mo'o //
translated: The preparation for a minor infraction is also a minor infraction, a minor infraction of a minor infraction.

original: ltung ba med pa ni bskol ba 'thungs ba dang / kha'i nang yod pa la sman pa'i lung gis mkhur bar bsrel ba dang / lus dag skud pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: ltung ba med pa ni bskol ba 'thungs ba dang / kha'i nang yod pa la sman pa'i lung gis mkhur bar bsrel ba dang / lus dag skud pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no downfall if one drinks a boiled beverage, if one moistens the mouth with medicine by the advice of a physician, or if one moistens the body with it.

original: mdog tsam myos par 'gyur ba dang 'dra ba la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: mdog tsam myos par 'gyur ba dang 'dra ba la ltung ba med do //

analyzed: las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor ba dag gis nyen pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if one is a beginner, or if one is insane, deranged, or in pain.

original: bslab par bya ba ni dge slong gis yul thams cad la gnas skabs thams cad la gnas skabs thams cad du myos bar 'gyur ba 'thung ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur ba rnam pa thams cad mi bstan par bslab par bya'o //

translated: Venerable Udayi, knowing that woman was lustful,

translated: She thought, “The noble Udayana knows the minds of others. If I don’t kill him, he will certainly harm my husband.”🔽She said to the general of the thieves, “Kill him.”

translated: The venerable Ananda told the householder.
