analyzed: 'phags ba nye dga' mchi ba'i bar du yud tsam zhig gzhes su gsol /
translated: The householder said, Noble one, please wait a moment while I go to Upasena.

original: tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bos bcom ldan 'das la de skad ces gsol ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo la khyim bdag de la nye dga' 'ongs par ma gyur na zas sbyin par mi byed dam zhes smras pa dang /🔽@15b khyim bdag des smras pa /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bos bcom ldan 'das la de skad ces gsol ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo la khyim bdag de la nye dga' 'ongs par ma gyur na zas sbyin par mi byed dam zhes smras pa dang / @15b khyim bdag des smras pa /
translated: The venerable Ananda told the Blessed One what had happened, and the Blessed One said to the venerable Ananda, Will the householder not give the food if Upasena does not come?

original: 'phags pa mi gsol lo //
analyzed: 'phags pa mi gsol lo //
translated: The householder said, Noble one, he will not eat.

original: tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bos bcom ldan 'das la de skad ces gsol ba dang / de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bos bcom ldan 'das la de skad ces gsol ba dang / de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa bka' stsal pa /
translated: The venerable Ānanda made a request to the Blessed One, and then the Blessed One spoke this verse:

original: gzhan dbang thams cad sdug bsngal te //
analyzed: gzhan dbang thams cad sdug bsngal te //
translated: All that is dependent is suffering.

original: bdag dbang thams cad bde ba yin /🔽thun mong dag gis gnod byed de //
analyzed: bdag dbang thams cad bde ba yin / thun mong dag gis gnod byed de //
translated: All that is independent is happiness.🔽The shared is harmful,

original: 'brel pa shin tu 'da' bar dka' //
analyzed: 'brel pa shin tu 'da' bar dka' //
translated: and connection is very difficult to transcend.

original: ci tsam na gdugs tshod kyi mtha' la bab pa na nye dga' 'ongs nas des smras pa /
analyzed: ci tsam na gdugs tshod kyi mtha' la bab pa na nye dga' 'ongs nas des smras pa /
translated: When it was almost time for the midday meal, Upacelā came and said,

original: khyim bdag mi 'brim par ci sdod /
analyzed: khyim bdag mi 'brim par ci sdod /
translated: Householder, why do you not distribute?

original: des smras pa /
analyzed: des smras pa /
translated: He said,

original: 'phags pa khyod kyi zhal nas kho bo ma 'ongs kyi bar du re zhig brim par mi bya'o zhes byung la 'di skad ces gsung ngam /
analyzed: 'phags pa khyod kyi zhal nas kho bo ma 'ongs kyi bar du re zhig brim par mi bya'o zhes byung la 'di skad ces gsung ngam /
translated: Noble one, did you say from your mouth that I should not distribute until I come?

original: nye dga' shags med na cang mi smra bar 'dug go //
analyzed: nye dga' shags med na cang mi smra bar 'dug go //
translated: Upacelā, not wanting to argue, remained silent.

original: de nas khyim bdag des brim par brtsams pa dang / ji tsam na gdugs tshod yol nas dge slong kha cig gis zas thob nas zan bcad pa byas /
analyzed: de nas khyim bdag des brim par brtsams pa dang / ji tsam na gdugs tshod yol nas dge slong kha cig gis zas thob nas zan bcad pa byas /
translated: Then the householder began to serve the food, but by the time the meal was over, some of the monks had not received any food and had to fast.

original: kha cig gis zan ma thob pa kho nar zan bcad ba byas nas /
analyzed: kha cig gis zan ma thob pa kho nar zan bcad ba byas nas /
translated: Then the householder began to serve the food, but by the time he had served the meal, it was past noon. Some of the monks had already eaten, and some had not.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis yon bshad pa mdzad nas gshegs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis yon bshad pa mdzad nas gshegs so //
translated: The Blessed One gave the householder a discourse on generosity and then left.

original: nye dga' bo ngo tsha bar gyur ba'i snying gis de nyid du 'dug go //
analyzed: nye dga' bo ngo tsha bar gyur ba'i snying gis de nyid du 'dug go //
translated: Upasena sat there with a guilty conscience.

original: de'i nyin mo gso sbyong gi zhal ta ba rgan pa'i mtha' logs su 'dug ste dge slong rnams la yang dag par bsgo zhing smras pa /
analyzed: de'i nyin mo gso sbyong gi zhal ta ba rgan pa'i mtha' logs su 'dug ste dge slong rnams la yang dag par bsgo zhing smras pa /
translated: On that day, the monk who was the most senior in years was sitting at the end of the row, overseeing the purification ceremony and addressing the monks:

original: btsun pa nye dga' ma mchis sam /
analyzed: btsun pa nye dga' ma mchis sam /
translated: “Venerable Upasena, are you not here?

original: 'ga' zhig gis de'i 'dun pa blangs sam /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig gis de'i 'dun pa blangs sam /
translated: Has anyone taken your turn?”

original: dge slong rnams kyis smras pa /
analyzed: dge slong rnams kyis smras pa /
translated: The monks said,

original: de ma 'ongs te sus kyang de'i 'dun pa ma blangs so //
analyzed: de ma 'ongs te sus kyang de'i 'dun pa ma blangs so //
translated: “He hasn’t come. No one has taken his turn.”🔽Other monks said,

original: dge slong gzhan dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: dge slong gzhan dag gis smras pa /
translated: Other monks said,🔽

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag nye dgas bdag cag snga dro ni zang zing gi ched la tho 'tshams nas /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag nye dgas bdag cag snga dro ni zang zing gi ched la tho 'tshams nas /
translated: “Venerables, Upasena is harassing us in the morning for the sake of material things,🔽and now he is harassing us for the sake of the Dharma.”

original: de ni chos kyi ched la tho 'tshams par byed do zhes zer nas dge slong don nyung du dag ci'i phyir dge slong dag zas bcad pa'i khyim du mgron du bos nas snga dro dang phyi dro khyim dag tu rgyu bar byed ces smod par byed /
analyzed: de ni chos kyi ched la tho 'tshams par byed do zhes zer nas dge slong don nyung du dag ci'i phyir dge slong dag zas bcad pa'i khyim du mgron du bos nas snga dro dang phyi dro khyim dag tu rgyu bar byed ces smod par byed /
translated: “Why do monks who have been invited to a house where food has been stopped go from house to house in the morning and afternoon?”

original: phyar ka gtong bar byed /
analyzed: phyar ka gtong bar byed /
translated: They criticized and complained and spread it about.🔽The monks heard the criticism of those people,

original: kha zer bar byed pa'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //
analyzed: kha zer bar byed pa'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //
translated: and the monks told the Blessed One about it.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byung ba 'di dang / gleng gzhi 'di dang / skabs 'di la dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdu ba mdzad de /🔽nye dga' la smad nas dge sbyong gi tshul ma yin pa /🔽rjes su mthun pa ma yin pa /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byung ba 'di dang / gleng gzhi 'di dang / skabs 'di la dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdu ba mdzad de / nye dga' la smad nas dge sbyong gi tshul ma yin pa / rjes su mthun pa ma yin pa /
translated: Then the Blessed One, having understood the situation, gathered the saṅgha of monks and said to them,🔽“Monks, Upasena has been censured.

original: rung ba ma yin pa /🔽tshul @16a * //
analyzed: rung ba ma yin pa / tshul @16a * //
translated: This is not in accordance with the Dharma,🔽this is not in accordance with the monastic code,

original: dang mthun pa ma yin pa /
analyzed: dang mthun pa ma yin pa /
translated: this is not in accordance with training,🔽this is not in accordance with the Teacher’s instructions.

original: de ni rab tu byung bas bya ba ma yin no zhes rnam grangs du mar rnam par smad de bslab pa bca' ba'i phan yon bcu yang dag par gzigs pas nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /
analyzed: de ni rab tu byung bas bya ba ma yin no zhes rnam grangs du mar rnam par smad de bslab pa bca' ba'i phan yon bcu yang dag par gzigs pas nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /
translated: He said, Therefore, my disciples, this rule should be set forth in the Vinaya:

original: yang dge slong gang zas dang bcas pa'i khyim du mgron du bos nas snga dro dang phyi dro khyim dag tu rgyun ltung byed do zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
analyzed: yang dge slong gang zas dang bcas pa'i khyim du mgron du bos nas snga dro dang phyi dro khyim dag tu rgyun ltung byed do zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
translated: If a monk, having been invited to a house with food, goes to other houses in the morning and evening, he commits a downfall.

original: yul ni mnyan yod /
analyzed: yul ni mnyan yod /
translated: The place was Śrāvastī.

original: gang zag ni nye dga'/
analyzed: gang zag ni nye dga'/
translated: The person was Upasena.

original: nyon mongs pa ni rang nyams kyis kun du spyod pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ni rang nyams kyis kun du spyod pa'o //
translated: The affliction was his own desire.

original: nyes pa ni zas dang bcas pa'i khyim du mgron du bos nas snga dro khyim dag tu rgyu bas dge 'dun gyi zang zing gi bar chad byas pa dang / phyi dro khyim dag tu rgyu bas dge 'dun gyi chos kyi bar chad byas pa'o //
analyzed: nyes pa ni zas dang bcas pa'i khyim du mgron du bos nas snga dro khyim dag tu rgyu bas dge 'dun gyi zang zing gi bar chad byas pa dang / phyi dro khyim dag tu rgyu bas dge 'dun gyi chos kyi bar chad byas pa'o //
translated: The fault was that by going to other houses in the morning after being invited to a house with food, he created an obstacle to the Saṅgha's material needs, and by going to other houses in the evening, he created an obstacle to the Saṅgha's Dharma activities.

original: gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
analyzed: gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
translated: The introduction is this: The Buddha, the Blessed One, was staying in Śrāvastī, in Jeta’s Grove, in Anāthapiṇḍada’s park.

original: dge slong nad ngan can dag 'khod pa dag gis yun ring du 'dug mi nus nas dge slong nad g-yog rnams kyis kyang na ba'i bya ba nyams par byed cing /
analyzed: dge slong nad ngan can dag 'khod pa dag gis yun ring du 'dug mi nus nas dge slong nad g-yog rnams kyis kyang na ba'i bya ba nyams par byed cing /
translated: The monks who were sick were unable to stay for a long time, and the monks who were nursing the sick neglected their duties to the sick.

original: dge slong zhal ta byed pa dag gis kyang dge 'dun gyi bya ba nyams par byed nas /
analyzed: dge slong zhal ta byed pa dag gis kyang dge 'dun gyi bya ba nyams par byed nas /
translated: The monks who were in charge of the affairs of the saṅgha also neglected their duties to the saṅgha.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: khyim pa 'dug pa la bsgo bar bya'o //
analyzed: khyim pa 'dug pa la bsgo bar bya'o //
translated: “You should tell the laypeople who are present.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis khyim pa 'dug pa la bsgo bar bya'o zhes bka' stsal nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis khyim pa 'dug pa la bsgo bar bya'o zhes bka' stsal nas /
translated: The Blessed One said, “You should tell the laypeople who are present.”

original: dge slong zhig gis khyim gzhan du lhung bzed dang chos gos gzhag pa der me shor nas dge slong des der 'gro bar brtsams te de lam gyi phyed du son pa dang / bdag gis khyim pa 'dug pa la ma bsgo'o snyam pa'i dran pa skyes nas de phyir log ste /
analyzed: dge slong zhig gis khyim gzhan du lhung bzed dang chos gos gzhag pa der me shor nas dge slong des der 'gro bar brtsams te de lam gyi phyed du son pa dang / bdag gis khyim pa 'dug pa la ma bsgo'o snyam pa'i dran pa skyes nas de phyir log ste /
translated: he thought, I will not tell the householder who is there. He turned back.

original: ji srid khyim pa 'dug pa la bsgo bar byed pa de srid du lhung bzed dang chos gos tshig nas de der song pa dang / khyim bdag gis smras pa /
analyzed: ji srid khyim pa 'dug pa la bsgo bar byed pa de srid du lhung bzed dang chos gos tshig nas de der song pa dang / khyim bdag gis smras pa /
translated: As long as he did not tell the householder who was there, his begging bowl and robes burned. When he got there, the householder said,

original: 'phags pa khyod ci'i slad du 'phyis te byon /
analyzed: 'phags pa khyod ci'i slad du 'phyis te byon /
translated: Noble one, why are you late?

original: des na khyod kyi lhung bzed dang chos gos tshig gis /
analyzed: des na khyod kyi lhung bzed dang chos gos tshig gis /
translated: Your begging bowl and robes burned.

original: gal te khyod myur du byon par gyur na khyod kyi lhung bzed dang chos gos tshig par mi 'gyur ro zhes zer zhing /
analyzed: gal te khyod myur du byon par gyur na khyod kyi lhung bzed dang chos gos tshig par mi 'gyur ro zhes zer zhing /
translated: If you had come quickly, your begging bowl and robes would not have burned.

original: dge slong de yang phongs par gyur pa'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: dge slong de yang phongs par gyur pa'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: and the Blessed One said,

original: de lta bas na de 'dra ba'i rkyen ma gtogs so //
analyzed: de lta bas na de 'dra ba'i rkyen ma gtogs so //
translated: “Monks, I allow you to use a water strainer in such circumstances.

original: de @16b nas bcom ldan 'das kyis bslab pa 'dod pa dang / bslab pa la gus pa dang / bslab pa la yo byad bsnyungs pa'i bsngags pa brjod nas dge slong rnams la de dang mthun pa dang / de'i shas che ba dang / de dang 'tsham pa'i chos dang ldan pa'i bka' mchid mdzad nas dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de @16b nas bcom ldan 'das kyis bslab pa 'dod pa dang / bslab pa la gus pa dang / bslab pa la yo byad bsnyungs pa'i bsngags pa brjod nas dge slong rnams la de dang mthun pa dang / de'i shas che ba dang / de dang 'tsham pa'i chos dang ldan pa'i bka' mchid mdzad nas dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /
translated: Then the Blessed One, having praised those who delight in the training, those who have respect for the training, and those who are ascetic with regard to possessions, and having spoken in praise of the training, gave a teaching connected with the training, with the ascetic practices, and with the ascetic attitude, and then said to the monks,

original: dge slong dag de lta bas na snga ma ni bcas pa yin la /
analyzed: dge slong dag de lta bas na snga ma ni bcas pa yin la /
translated: “Monks, therefore, the previous allowance was a concession,

original: 'di ni gnang ba yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni gnang ba yin te /
translated: but this is the rule.

original: nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /
analyzed: nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /
translated: My disciples should recite this training rule like this:🔽‘If a monk is staying alone in a remote dwelling, he should not use a water strainer.

original: dge slong gang zas dang bcas pa'i khyim du mgron du bos nas snga dro dang phyi dro khyim dag tu rgyu zhing /
analyzed: dge slong gang zas dang bcas pa'i khyim du mgron du bos nas snga dro dang phyi dro khyim dag tu rgyu zhing /
translated: A monk who has been invited to a home with food, and who then goes to other homes in the morning and afternoon,

original: khyim pa 'dug pa la mi bsgo na de 'dra ba'i rkyen ma gtogs te ltung byed do zhes gnang ba mdzad de /
analyzed: khyim pa 'dug pa la mi bsgo na de 'dra ba'i rkyen ma gtogs te ltung byed do zhes gnang ba mdzad de /
translated: unless there are special circumstances, commits an offense entailing confession if he does not inform the laypeople.

original: yul ni mnyan yod /
analyzed: yul ni mnyan yod /
translated: The place was Śrāvastī.

original: gang zag ni dge slong don nyung du dag / nyon mongs pa dang nyes pa ni med do //
analyzed: gang zag ni dge slong don nyung du dag / nyon mongs pa dang nyes pa ni med do //
translated: The person was a monk who had few duties. There was no affliction or offense.

original: de la yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni sh'a kya'i bu nye dga' 'am /
analyzed: de la yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni sh'a kya'i bu nye dga' 'am /
translated: In this case, “a monk” means the Śākya monk Upananda,

original: gzhan yang de lta bu gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang de lta bu gang yin pa'o //
translated: or anyone like him.

original: zas dang bcas pa'i zhes bya ba ni mgron du bos ba dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: zas dang bcas pa'i zhes bya ba ni mgron du bos ba dang bcas pa'o //
translated: “With food” means with an invitation.

original: khyim du zhes bya ba ni bram ze dang khyim bdag gi khyim du'o //
analyzed: khyim du zhes bya ba ni bram ze dang khyim bdag gi khyim du'o //
translated: “To a home” means to the home of a brahmin or a householder.

original: mgron du bos nas zhes bya ba ni bsod snyoms kyi phyir gshegs so //
analyzed: mgron du bos nas zhes bya ba ni bsod snyoms kyi phyir gshegs so //
translated: “Having been invited” means having been invited to go for alms.

original: snga dro zhes bya ba ni snga dro nyid de khyim gnyis pas lhag par rgyu na'o //
analyzed: snga dro zhes bya ba ni snga dro nyid de khyim gnyis pas lhag par rgyu na'o //
translated: “In the morning” means in the morning itself. “If he goes to more than two homes” means if he goes to more than two homes.

original: phyi dro zhes bya ba ni phyi dro nyid do //
analyzed: phyi dro zhes bya ba ni phyi dro nyid do //
translated: In the afternoon means in the afternoon.

original: khyim gsum las lhag par rgyu na'o //
analyzed: khyim gsum las lhag par rgyu na'o //
translated: If he goes beyond three houses means if he goes beyond three houses.

original: khyim dag tu zhes bya ba ni bram ze dang khyim bdag gi khyim dag tu'o //
analyzed: khyim dag tu zhes bya ba ni bram ze dang khyim bdag gi khyim dag tu'o //
translated: In houses means in the houses of brahmins and householders.

original: rgyu zhing zhes bya ba ni 'gro zhing ngo //🔽khyim pa 'dug pa la mi bsgo na zhes bya ba ni de na khyim pa gang 'dug pa la'o //
analyzed: rgyu zhing zhes bya ba ni 'gro zhing ngo // khyim pa 'dug pa la mi bsgo na zhes bya ba ni de na khyim pa gang 'dug pa la'o //
translated: Going for alms means going.🔽If he does not ask permission of the laypeople who are there means of the laypeople who are there.

original: de 'dra ba'i rkyen ma gtogs so zhes bya ba ni gleng gzhi las khyim pa 'dug pa la bsgo bar byed pa de srid du de'i lhung bzed dang chos gos tshig par gyur pa de 'dra ba'i rkyen ma gtogs so /
analyzed: de 'dra ba'i rkyen ma gtogs so zhes bya ba ni gleng gzhi las khyim pa 'dug pa la bsgo bar byed pa de srid du de'i lhung bzed dang chos gos tshig par gyur pa de 'dra ba'i rkyen ma gtogs so /
translated: Except in the case of a special necessity means except in the case of the special necessity described in the nidana.

original: ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni sems can dmyal ba dang / dud 'gro dang / yi dags ngan song dang / ngan 'gro log par ltung ba dag tu sreg par byed /🔽'tshod par byed /
analyzed: ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni sems can dmyal ba dang / dud 'gro dang / yi dags ngan song dang / ngan 'gro log par ltung ba dag tu sreg par byed / 'tshod par byed /
translated: One commits an offense entailing confession means one is confessed in the hells, as hungry ghosts, as animals, and in other unfortunate states of existence.🔽One is burned.

original: ltung bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: ltung bar byed pa'o //
translated: One is cooked.🔽One is confessed.

original: gzhan yang de srid du ltung ba de ma bshags shing so sor ma bshags na dge ba'i chos rnams la sgrib par byed pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang de srid du ltung ba de ma bshags shing so sor ma bshags na dge ba'i chos rnams la sgrib par byed pa ste /
translated: Moreover, as long as that downfall is not confessed and disclosed, it obscures virtuous dharmas.

original: des na ltung byed do zhes gsungs so //🔽de la ltung bar ji ltar 'gyur zhe na 'dir yang dngos gzhi dang / sbyor ba dang / sbyor ba'i sbyor bas ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa dang / ltung ba med pa @17a * //
analyzed: des na ltung byed do zhes gsungs so // de la ltung bar ji ltar 'gyur zhe na 'dir yang dngos gzhi dang / sbyor ba dang / sbyor ba'i sbyor bas ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa dang / ltung ba med pa @17a * //
translated: Therefore, it is called a downfall.🔽Here, one should understand the characteristics of this downfall through the main part, the preparation, the preparation for the preparation, the presentation of downfalls,

original: dang ; bslab par bya ba dang / phyir bcos pa rnams kyis 'di'i mtshan nyid shes par bya'o //
analyzed: dang ; bslab par bya ba dang / phyir bcos pa rnams kyis 'di'i mtshan nyid shes par bya'o //
translated: the absence of downfalls, the training, and the amendment.🔽Here, the presentation of the main part of a downfall is as follows: If a monk invites the Saṅgha to a house with food by his words, but does not tell the benefactor, “Do not distribute the food because I will come later,”

original: de la 'dir yang dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni dge slong de'i tshig gis dge 'dun zas dang bcas pa'i khyim du spyan drangs na sbyin bdag la kho bo ma 'ongs pa'i dbang gis brim par yol bar ma byas shig ces ma bsgo ba dang
analyzed: de la 'dir yang dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni dge slong de'i tshig gis dge 'dun zas dang bcas pa'i khyim du spyan drangs na sbyin bdag la kho bo ma 'ongs pa'i dbang gis brim par yol bar ma byas shig ces ma bsgo ba dang
translated: and

original: / brtad pa'i dbang ma gtogs par khyim gsum pa la sogs par rgyu ba dang / gung tshigs las yol ba'i dus ma yin par dge slong 'khod pa la smras su zin kyang brtad pa'i bya ba ma byas pa ma byung bar khyim bzhi pa la sogs par 'gro na khyim gsum pa dang bzhi pa dang lnga pa dang /
analyzed: / brtad pa'i dbang ma gtogs par khyim gsum pa la sogs par rgyu ba dang / gung tshigs las yol ba'i dus ma yin par dge slong 'khod pa la smras su zin kyang brtad pa'i bya ba ma byas pa ma byung bar khyim bzhi pa la sogs par 'gro na khyim gsum pa dang bzhi pa dang lnga pa dang /
translated: If, except in the case of an emergency, a monk goes to a third house, etc., after having been invited to a second house, and if he does not perform the action of the invitation ceremony before the mealtime has passed, and if he then goes to a fourth house, etc., he commits a basic defeat for each house, the third, fourth, fifth,

original: khyim bzhi pa dang lnga pa dang drug pa la sogs pa re rer phyin pa na grong rgyu ba'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khyim bzhi pa dang lnga pa dang drug pa la sogs pa re rer phyin pa na grong rgyu ba'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
translated: the fourth, fifth, sixth, etc.

original: dge slong de'i tshig gis dge 'dun zad dang bcas pa'i khyim du spyan drangs pa lan smad pa med do //
analyzed: dge slong de'i tshig gis dge 'dun zad dang bcas pa'i khyim du spyan drangs pa lan smad pa med do //
translated: If the invitation of the Saṅgha to a house with leftovers is done by that monk, there is no fault.

original: sbyin bdag la kho bo ma 'ongs pa'i dbang gis brim pa yol bar ma bya zhig ces ma bsgo ba la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: sbyin bdag la kho bo ma 'ongs pa'i dbang gis brim pa yol bar ma bya zhig ces ma bsgo ba la na smad pa med do //
translated: If the monk does not tell the benefactor, “Do not distribute the food until I return,” there is no fault.

original: brtad pa'i dbang ma gtogs pa la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: brtad pa'i dbang ma gtogs pa la na smad pa med do //
translated: If it is not an emergency, there is no fault.

original: dge slong 'khod pa dag la smras su zin kyang phyi dro khyim gsum las lhag par rgyu ba la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: dge slong 'khod pa dag la smras su zin kyang phyi dro khyim gsum las lhag par rgyu ba la na smad pa med do //
translated: Even if he tells the resident monks, there is no offense if he goes to more than three houses in the afternoon.

original: snga dro khyim gnyis las lhag par rgyu ba la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: snga dro khyim gnyis las lhag par rgyu ba la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if he goes to more than two houses in the morning.

original: 'di'i byed pa po ni snga dro la khyim gsum pa la sogs pa nyid dang / khyim pa 'khod pa la ma bsgo ba dang / brtad pa'i bya ba ma byung ba nyid do //
analyzed: 'di'i byed pa po ni snga dro la khyim gsum pa la sogs pa nyid dang / khyim pa 'khod pa la ma bsgo ba dang / brtad pa'i bya ba ma byung ba nyid do //
translated: The factors that make this a downfall are going to a third house in the morning, and so on; not informing the lay person who is hosting the meal; and not having done the announcement.

original: phyi dro la ni khyim bzhi pa la sogs pa nyid dang / brtad pa'i bya ba ma byung ba nyid do //
analyzed: phyi dro la ni khyim bzhi pa la sogs pa nyid dang / brtad pa'i bya ba ma byung ba nyid do //
translated: In the afternoon, the factors are going to a fourth house, and so on; and not having done the announcement.

original: 'di la yan lag ni snga dro la ni lngas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di la yan lag ni snga dro la ni lngas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
translated: In this rule, there are five factors that make it a serious offense in the morning:

original: snga dro nyid dang / de'i tshig gis dge 'dun spyan drangs pa nyid dang / sbyin bdag la kho bo ma 'ongs pa'i dbang gis brim pa yol bar ma bya zhig ces ma bsgo ba nyid dang / brtad pa'i bya ba ma byung ba nyid dang /
analyzed: snga dro nyid dang / de'i tshig gis dge 'dun spyan drangs pa nyid dang / sbyin bdag la kho bo ma 'ongs pa'i dbang gis brim pa yol bar ma bya zhig ces ma bsgo ba nyid dang / brtad pa'i bya ba ma byung ba nyid dang /
translated: it is the morning; the invitation was extended by the words “in the morning”; the monk has not informed the host, “Do not let the distribution of food be delayed because of me”; he has not done the announcement; and

original: khyim gsum pa la sogs par ston pa nyid do //
analyzed: khyim gsum pa la sogs par ston pa nyid do //
translated: The actual basis is the third house, and so on.

original: phyi dro la ni yan lag gsum gyis dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te phyi dro nyid dang / brtad pa'i bya ba ma byung ba nyid dang / khyim bzhi pa la sogs par son pa nyid dang / de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad do //
analyzed: phyi dro la ni yan lag gsum gyis dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te phyi dro nyid dang / brtad pa'i bya ba ma byung ba nyid dang / khyim bzhi pa la sogs par son pa nyid dang / de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad do //
translated: In the afternoon, there is a downfall of the actual basis by three limbs: the afternoon itself, the absence of the activity of a summons, and the arrival at the fourth house, and so on.

original: sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas te /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas te /
translated: The preparation is a minor offense.

original: ji srid du grong rgyu ba'i ltung byed kyi sbyor ba brtsams nas dngos gzhi la @17b ma thug gi bar du nyes byas so //
analyzed: ji srid du grong rgyu ba'i ltung byed kyi sbyor ba brtsams nas dngos gzhi la @17b ma thug gi bar du nyes byas so //
translated: As long as one has begun the preparation for the offense of wandering in the village, but has not reached the actual basis, it is a minor offense.

original: dngos gzhi la sbyor ba tha dad pa ji snyed brtsams pa re re la nyes byas re re'o //
analyzed: dngos gzhi la sbyor ba tha dad pa ji snyed brtsams pa re re la nyes byas re re'o //
translated: For each of the preparations for the actual basis that one begins, there is a minor offense.

original: sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas phra mo ste /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas phra mo ste /
translated: The preparation for the preparation is a very minor offense.

original: sbyor ba ji snyed pa la sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang de snyed de /
analyzed: sbyor ba ji snyed pa la sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang de snyed de /
translated: For as many preparations as there are, there are also that many preparations for the preparation.

original: sbyor ba nyes byas kyi sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'ang nyes byas te nyes byas phra mo'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba nyes byas kyi sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'ang nyes byas te nyes byas phra mo'o //
translated: The preparation is a minor offense, and the application is also a minor offense.

original: ltung ba med pa ni brtad pa'i bya ba ma byung ba la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: ltung ba med pa ni brtad pa'i bya ba ma byung ba la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if the invitation is not for a specific purpose.

original: de'i ngor mgron du bos pa ma yin na ltung ba med do //
analyzed: de'i ngor mgron du bos pa ma yin na ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if one is not invited for that purpose.

original: las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang / sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor ba dag gis nyen pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang / sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor ba dag gis nyen pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if one is a beginner, or if one is insane, disturbed, or in pain.

original: bslab par bya ba ni dge slong gis yul thams cad la gnas skabs thams cad du grong rgyu ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur ba rnam pa thams cad du mi bsten par bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: bslab par bya ba ni dge slong gis yul thams cad la gnas skabs thams cad du grong rgyu ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur ba rnam pa thams cad du mi bsten par bslab par bya'o //
translated: The training rule is that a monk should train by not relying on any of the ways of going to a village.

original: dge sbyong gi tshul dang srog la sogs pa'i bar chad kyi brtad pa byung na 'gro bar bya'o //
analyzed: dge sbyong gi tshul dang srog la sogs pa'i bar chad kyi brtad pa byung na 'gro bar bya'o //
translated: If there is a threat to the life of a monk or to the life of the monastic discipline, he should go.

original: khyim pa 'dug pa la bsgo bar bya'o //
analyzed: khyim pa 'dug pa la bsgo bar bya'o //
translated: He should tell a layperson who is staying there.

original: phyir bcos pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: phyir bcos pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The amendment is the same as before.

original: grong rgyu ba'i ltung byed de brgyad cu gcig pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: grong rgyu ba'i ltung byed de brgyad cu gcig pa bshad zin to /
translated: This was the explanation of the eighty-first downfall: visiting towns.

original: // / rgyal po'i pho brang du nub mo 'gro ba'i ltung byed kyi gleng gzhi ni /
analyzed: // / rgyal po'i pho brang du nub mo 'gro ba'i ltung byed kyi gleng gzhi ni /
translated: The introduction to the downfall of going to the king’s palace at night.

original: bcas pa dang gnang ba'i dbang gis rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: bcas pa dang gnang ba'i dbang gis rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two types of downfalls: those that are proscribed and those that are permitted.

original: bcas pa'i gleng gzhi ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshul mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' rab na bzhugs so //
analyzed: bcas pa'i gleng gzhi ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshul mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' rab na bzhugs so //
translated: The introduction to the proscribed downfall is as follows. The Bhagavān Buddha was staying in Śrāvastī, in the Jeta Grove, in the park of Anāthapiṇḍada.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa mood gal gyi bu chen po la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa mood gal gyi bu chen po la bka' stsal pa /
translated: Then the Bhagavān said to the venerable Mahā­maudgalyāyana:

original: klu'i rgyal po dga' bo dang / nye dga' gnyis btul nas ko sa la'i rgyal po gsal rgyal gyis de la brten nas bcom ldan 'das dge slong gi dge 'dun dang bcas pa rgyal po'i pho brang du zhag bdun gyi bar du gdugs tshod gsol to //
analyzed: klu'i rgyal po dga' bo dang / nye dga' gnyis btul nas ko sa la'i rgyal po gsal rgyal gyis de la brten nas bcom ldan 'das dge slong gi dge 'dun dang bcas pa rgyal po'i pho brang du zhag bdun gyi bar du gdugs tshod gsol to //
translated: “Subdue the two nāga kings Nanda and Upananda, and then King Prasenajit of Kośala will invite the Bhagavān and the saṅgha of monks to the king’s palace for a meal for seven days.”

original: de'i tshe na mnyan yod na khyim bdag ngan pa bzang sbyin dang / khyim bdag sdum byed dang / khyim bdag tshul khrims tshong dpon dang / rgyal bu nag po rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la chos mngon pa dang / 'dul ba mngon pa'i zhu ba zhus nas /
analyzed: de'i tshe na mnyan yod na khyim bdag ngan pa bzang sbyin dang / khyim bdag sdum byed dang / khyim bdag tshul khrims tshong dpon dang / rgyal bu nag po rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la chos mngon pa dang / 'dul ba mngon pa'i zhu ba zhus nas /
translated: At that time, in Śrāvastī, the evil householder Bhadradatta, the householder Saṃgharakṣita, the householder Śīla, the merchant, and the prince Kṛṣṇa requested the Blessed One to teach the Abhidharma and the Abhidharma-vibhāṣā.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis de dag la gong nas gong du bka' stsal pa dang / ko sa la'i rgyal po gsal rgyal yang de dag gi gdong du lta zhing 'dug ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis de dag la gong nas gong du bka' stsal pa dang / ko sa la'i rgyal po gsal rgyal yang de dag gi gdong du lta zhing 'dug ste /
translated: The Blessed One spoke to them in an increasingly profound way, and King Prasenajit of Kośala sat there looking at them.

original: des yud tsam zhig chos dang ldan pa'i gtam mnyan nas bcom ldan 'das kyis zhabs gnyis la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te stan las langs nas @18a * //
analyzed: des yud tsam zhig chos dang ldan pa'i gtam mnyan nas bcom ldan 'das kyis zhabs gnyis la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te stan las langs nas @18a * //
translated: After listening to Dharma-related conversation for a while, he bowed his head at the Blessed One's two feet, rose from his seat,

original: song ste / btsun mo'i 'khor gyi nang du zhugs nas btsun mo phreng ldan ma la smras pa /
analyzed: song ste / btsun mo'i 'khor gyi nang du zhugs nas btsun mo phreng ldan ma la smras pa /
translated: and left. He entered the harem and said to Queen Mālikā,

original: phreng ldan ma deng khyim bdag ngan pa bzang sbyin dang / khyim bdag sdum byed dang / khyim bdag tshul khrims tshong dpon dang / rgyal bu nag po rnams kyis /
analyzed: phreng ldan ma deng khyim bdag ngan pa bzang sbyin dang / khyim bdag sdum byed dang / khyim bdag tshul khrims tshong dpon dang / rgyal bu nag po rnams kyis /
translated: Now, Mallika, the wicked householder Bhadradatta, the householder Samthakara, the householder Sīla, the merchant, and the prince Kalabha,

original: bcom ldan 'das la chos mngon pa dang / 'dul ba mngon pa'i zhu ba zhus nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la chos mngon pa dang / 'dul ba mngon pa'i zhu ba zhus nas /
translated: having asked the Blessed One about Abhidharma and the Vinaya,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang de dag la gong nas gong du bka' stsal pa dang / nga yang de dag gi gdong du lta zhing /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang de dag la gong nas gong du bka' stsal pa dang / nga yang de dag gi gdong du lta zhing /
translated: and the Blessed One having spoken to them in an increasingly profound manner, I stood before them,

original: kha rog par 'dug 'dug nas langs te song ngo //
analyzed: kha rog par 'dug 'dug nas langs te song ngo //
translated: and having sat silently, I rose and left.

original: phreng ldan mas smras pa /
analyzed: phreng ldan mas smras pa /
translated: Mallika said,

original: lha khyod kyis ci'i slad du bcom ldan 'das la ma zhus /
analyzed: lha khyod kyis ci'i slad du bcom ldan 'das la ma zhus /
translated: Why didn't you ask the Blessed One, Deva?

original: phreng ldan mang ni thos pa nyung ba yin la /
analyzed: phreng ldan mang ni thos pa nyung ba yin la /
translated: Mallika has little learning,

original: de dag ni thos pa mang ba yin pas ngas ni ci zhig zhur yod /
analyzed: de dag ni thos pa mang ba yin pas ngas ni ci zhig zhur yod /
translated: while they have much learning, so what could I have asked?

original: lha khyod ci'i slad du sangs rgyas kyi bka' klog par mi mdzad /
analyzed: lha khyod ci'i slad du sangs rgyas kyi bka' klog par mi mdzad /
translated: Deva, why don't you read the Buddha's words?🔽

original: phreng ldan ma nga rgyal po'i bya ba dang / rgyal po'i byed pa dag la rtag tu brel bas ji ltar bklag / gal te khyod 'ga' zhig las sangs rgyas kyis bka' klog nas ngas mtshan mo khyod las bklag par bya'o //
analyzed: phreng ldan ma nga rgyal po'i bya ba dang / rgyal po'i byed pa dag la rtag tu brel bas ji ltar bklag / gal te khyod 'ga' zhig las sangs rgyas kyis bka' klog nas ngas mtshan mo khyod las bklag par bya'o //
translated: “If you read the Buddha’s words to someone, I will read to you at night.”

original: lha de ltar bgyi'o //
analyzed: lha de ltar bgyi'o //
translated: “Your Majesty, I will do that.”

original: rgyal pos btsun mo rgyal rigs dbyar tshul ma'i slob dpon du ni tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu gnyer /
analyzed: rgyal pos btsun mo rgyal rigs dbyar tshul ma'i slob dpon du ni tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu gnyer /
translated: The king appointed Venerable Śāriputra as the preceptor for Queen Hemantakusumā.

original: btsun mo phreng ldan ma'i slob dpon du ni tshe dang ldan pa 'char ka gnyer te /
analyzed: btsun mo phreng ldan ma'i slob dpon du ni tshe dang ldan pa 'char ka gnyer te /
translated: He appointed Venerable Udayin as the preceptor for Queen Māgandikā.

original: de gnyis kyis de dag klog tu 'jug pa na tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu ni dus shes pa dang / dus rig pa yin pas des dus su song nas rgyal rigs dbyar tshul ma klog du 'jug gi dus ma yin par mi 'gro'o //
analyzed: de gnyis kyis de dag klog tu 'jug pa na tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu ni dus shes pa dang / dus rig pa yin pas des dus su song nas rgyal rigs dbyar tshul ma klog du 'jug gi dus ma yin par mi 'gro'o //
translated: Venerable Śāriputra, knowing the time and being aware of the time, went to read to Hemantakusumā at the appropriate time and did not go at the inappropriate time.

original: tshe dang ldan pa 'char ka ni dus mi shes pa dang / dus mi rig pa yin pas /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa 'char ka ni dus mi shes pa dang / dus mi rig pa yin pas /
translated: Venerable Udayin did not know the time and was not aware of the time.

original: dus su yang song ste phreng ldan ma klog tu 'jug pa la /
analyzed: dus su yang song ste phreng ldan ma klog tu 'jug pa la /
translated: He went to Mallikā at the right time to have her read,

original: dus ma yin par yang 'gro'o //
analyzed: dus ma yin par yang 'gro'o //
translated: but he also went at the wrong time.

original: ji tsam na dus gzhan zhig na ko sa la'i rgyal po gsal rgyal ri brags gzhan zhig tu bya ba cung zhig byung nas de mtshan mo nyid du langs te der 'phags pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa 'char ka glang po che'i sgra dang rta'i sgra dang dung gi sgra dag gis sad nas /
analyzed: ji tsam na dus gzhan zhig na ko sa la'i rgyal po gsal rgyal ri brags gzhan zhig tu bya ba cung zhig byung nas de mtshan mo nyid du langs te der 'phags pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa 'char ka glang po che'i sgra dang rta'i sgra dang dung gi sgra dag gis sad nas /
translated: At one point King Prasenajit of Kosala had some business in another village. He got up in the middle of the night and left, and Venerable Udayin was awakened by the sounds of elephants, horses, and conches.

original: des bsams pa /
analyzed: des bsams pa /
translated: He thought,

original: btsun mo phreng ldan ma la bzlas pa sbyin du 'gro'o snyam nas rgyal po'i pho brang sgor song ste nang du zhugs pa na /
analyzed: btsun mo phreng ldan ma la bzlas pa sbyin du 'gro'o snyam nas rgyal po'i pho brang sgor song ste nang du zhugs pa na /
translated: “I’ll go to Mallikā to recite the scriptures.” He went to the king’s palace and entered.🔽Mallikā was asleep, so he woke her with a snap of his fingers. She bowed down at his feet,🔽and he said,🔽“Mallikā, I’ll recite the scriptures.”🔽“Venerable, I’m tired. I’ll listen tomorrow.”

original: btsun mo phreng ldan ma gnyid log cing 'dug nas des se gol gyi sgras de bslang ba dang / des @18b de'i rkang pa la phyag 'tshal te /
analyzed: btsun mo phreng ldan ma gnyid log cing 'dug nas des se gol gyi sgras de bslang ba dang / des @18b de'i rkang pa la phyag 'tshal te /

translated: The phrase except in such circumstances refers to the following story from the nidana: The venerable Śāriputra thought, Although the Blessed One has not allowed this, there may be a situation in which he would allow it, making this very [circumstance] the occasion.

original: de 'dul ba la ltos pas de nyid du 'dug go zhes bya ba de 'dra ba'i rkyen gzhag go //
analyzed: de 'dul ba la ltos pas de nyid du 'dug go zhes bya ba de 'dra ba'i rkyen gzhag go //
translated: Thus, he thought, Since this depends on the Vinaya, I will remain here. He thus set forth such an occasion.

original: ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The phrase a downfall is as above.

original: de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How does one commit a downfall here?

original: 'dir yang dngos gzhi dang / sbyor ba dang / sbyor ba'i sbyor bas ltung ba rnam par bzhag pa dang / ltung ba med pa dang / bslab par bya ba dang / phyir bcos pa rnams kyis 'di'i mtshan nyid shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang dngos gzhi dang / sbyor ba dang / sbyor ba'i sbyor bas ltung ba rnam par bzhag pa dang / ltung ba med pa dang / bslab par bya ba dang / phyir bcos pa rnams kyis 'di'i mtshan nyid shes par bya'o //
translated: Here, one should understand the characteristics of the downfalls, the non-downfalls, the trainings, and the restorations through the main practice, the preparatory acts, and the preparatory acts of the preparatory acts.

original: de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni dge slong rgyal po dang / btsun mo dang / gzhon nu dang / zhang blon dang / bar chad dang / gdul ba'i dbang ma gtogs par btsun mo'i 'khor 'dug pa'i gnas sam /
analyzed: de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni dge slong rgyal po dang / btsun mo dang / gzhon nu dang / zhang blon dang / bar chad dang / gdul ba'i dbang ma gtogs par btsun mo'i 'khor 'dug pa'i gnas sam /
translated: Except for the case of a king, a queen, a prince, a minister, an obstacle, or a disciple, if a monk goes to the place of the queen’s quarters,

original: rgyal po'i pho brang gi gnas sam bdag nyid 'gro bar 'grel ba'i gnas skabs der skye rengs tha ma ma shar cing nam ma langs par shes bzhin du mtshan mo'i sgo bcad pa la ni phyi rol gyi nye 'khor 'obs la sogs pa'i nang rol gyi ngos las
analyzed: rgyal po'i pho brang gi gnas sam bdag nyid 'gro bar 'grel ba'i gnas skabs der skye rengs tha ma ma shar cing nam ma langs par shes bzhin du mtshan mo'i sgo bcad pa la ni phyi rol gyi nye 'khor 'obs la sogs pa'i nang rol gyi ngos las
translated: to the king’s palace, or to a place where he is invited, and if he knows that the last part of the night has not passed and that it is not dawn, then if he opens the door of the queen’s quarters or if he crosses beyond the outer perimeter of the moat,

original: 'da' ba dang sgom bcad pa la ni sgo 'phar nas nang rol du sgo gtan gyi srid kyi nyes 'gyur las 'das na sbyor ba tha dad pas mtshan mo re re la mtshan mo'i skya rengs shar ba'i mtha' la bsdad mi dgos par nam son pa'i mod nyid
analyzed: 'da' ba dang sgom bcad pa la ni sgo 'phar nas nang rol du sgo gtan gyi srid kyi nyes 'gyur las 'das na sbyor ba tha dad pas mtshan mo re re la mtshan mo'i skya rengs shar ba'i mtha' la bsdad mi dgos par nam son pa'i mod nyid
translated: or if he crosses beyond the inner perimeter of the door’s threshold, he commits an offense. If he does not rise at the end of the night, but stays there until dawn, he commits an offense.

original: la rgyal po'i pho brang du nub mo 'gro ba'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //🔽'dir mtshan mo'i dang po ni nyi ma nub pa'i 'og tu 'od dmar po chags par gyur pa gang yin pa de 'das par gyur pa yin la /
analyzed: la rgyal po'i pho brang du nub mo 'gro ba'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro // 'dir mtshan mo'i dang po ni nyi ma nub pa'i 'og tu 'od dmar po chags par gyur pa gang yin pa de 'das par gyur pa yin la /
translated: If a monk enters the royal palace at night, he commits an actual downfall.🔽Here, the first part of the night is the time after sunset when the reddish glow in the sky fades.🔽The first part of the day is the time when the last part of the night, called “the red dawn,” is over and the sky is not yet clearly light.

original: nyin mo'i dang po ni skya rengs tha ma dmar rengs zhes bya ba shar ba yin pas mtshan mo'i dang po nas nyin mo'i dang po la ma thug gi bar ni nam ma nangs skya rengs ma shar ba nyid yin pas dus de dag la na smad @21b🔽pa med do //
analyzed: nyin mo'i dang po ni skya rengs tha ma dmar rengs zhes bya ba shar ba yin pas mtshan mo'i dang po nas nyin mo'i dang po la ma thug gi bar ni nam ma nangs skya rengs ma shar ba nyid yin pas dus de dag la na smad @21b pa med do //
translated: The time between the first part of the night and the first part of the day is called “before dawn.”

original: nam ma langs skya rengs ma shar ba'i dus de dag la de ltar 'du shes pa nyid la na smad pa med do //🔽btsun mo'i 'khor 'dug pa'i gnas sam /
analyzed: nam ma langs skya rengs ma shar ba'i dus de dag la de ltar 'du shes pa nyid la na smad pa med do // btsun mo'i 'khor 'dug pa'i gnas sam /
translated: There is no offense if the monk perceives it as being before dawn.

original: rgyal po'i pho brang 'khor gyi gnas gang yang rung ba la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: rgyal po'i pho brang 'khor gyi gnas gang yang rung ba la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if the monk enters the queen’s quarters or the king’s palace for a brief period.

original: gnas de dag tu dus der bdag nyid 'gro ba 'du shes pa la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: gnas de dag tu dus der bdag nyid 'gro ba 'du shes pa la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no fault in going to those places at those times, thinking that they are the right places.

original: gnas de dag tu dus der song ba'i mtshan mo'i cha gang yang rung ba la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: gnas de dag tu dus der song ba'i mtshan mo'i cha gang yang rung ba la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no fault in going to those places at those times, during any part of the night.

original: mtshan mo'i cha gang yang rung ba de la sbyor ba tha dad pas yang dang yang du song na sbyor ba re re la dngos gzhi re rer 'gyur ba la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: mtshan mo'i cha gang yang rung ba de la sbyor ba tha dad pas yang dang yang du song na sbyor ba re re la dngos gzhi re rer 'gyur ba la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no fault in going to those places at those times, during any part of the night, if one goes again and again with a different preparation each time.

original: sbyor ba gcig gis mtshan thog thag 'byung 'jug med par 'dug pa la ni dngos gzhi yang gcig tu 'gyur ba la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: sbyor ba gcig gis mtshan thog thag 'byung 'jug med par 'dug pa la ni dngos gzhi yang gcig tu 'gyur ba la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no fault in going to those places at those times, during the whole night, if one stays without rising or entering for the whole night with a single preparation.

original: gnas de dag gi sgo bcad pa la phyi rol gyi nyen 'khor 'obs la sogs pa'i nang rol gyi ngos las 'das pa dang / sgom bcad pa la sgo 'phar nas nang rol du sgo gtan gyi srid kyi nyis 'gyur las 'das pa la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: gnas de dag gi sgo bcad pa la phyi rol gyi nyen 'khor 'obs la sogs pa'i nang rol gyi ngos las 'das pa dang / sgom bcad pa la sgo 'phar nas nang rol du sgo gtan gyi srid kyi nyis 'gyur las 'das pa la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no fault in going to those places at those times, if one goes beyond the outer wall of the monastery, or beyond the double thickness of the door of the cell, if the door is closed.

original: ltung ba 'byin pa po bdag nyid gcig pu dang grogs gang yang rung ba dang bcas pa lan smad pa med do //
analyzed: ltung ba 'byin pa po bdag nyid gcig pu dang grogs gang yang rung ba dang bcas pa lan smad pa med do //
translated: The one who commits the downfall, whether alone or with a companion, is not to be reproached.

original: nam sros nas skye rengs ma shar ba la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: nam sros nas skye rengs ma shar ba la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no fault if it is after dusk and before dawn, but before dawn has broken.

original: rgyal po dang btsun mo dang / gzhon nu dang / zhang blon dang / bar chad dang / gdul ba'i dbang ma gtogs pa la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: rgyal po dang btsun mo dang / gzhon nu dang / zhang blon dang / bar chad dang / gdul ba'i dbang ma gtogs pa la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no fault if it is not to be reproached, except for the king, queen, prince, minister, obstacle, or disciple.

original: 'di'i byed pa po ni dge slong rgyal po dang / btsun mo dang / gzhon nu dang / zhang blon dang / bar chad dang / gdul ba'i dbang gis 'gro ba ma gtogs pa nyid dang / btsun mo'i 'khor 'dug pa'i gnas sam /
analyzed: 'di'i byed pa po ni dge slong rgyal po dang / btsun mo dang / gzhon nu dang / zhang blon dang / bar chad dang / gdul ba'i dbang gis 'gro ba ma gtogs pa nyid dang / btsun mo'i 'khor 'dug pa'i gnas sam /
translated: The agent of this is the monk, except for the king, queen, prince, minister, obstacle, or disciple, who goes to the place of the retinue of the queen,

original: rgyal po'i pho brang gi gnas dang / bdag nyid 'gro bar 'brel ba nyid kyi gnas skabs der nam ma nangs pa nyid la 'du shes gtso cher byed pa po nyid yin no //
analyzed: rgyal po'i pho brang gi gnas dang / bdag nyid 'gro bar 'brel ba nyid kyi gnas skabs der nam ma nangs pa nyid la 'du shes gtso cher byed pa po nyid yin no //
translated: or to the place of the king's palace, or to the place connected with his own going, in that situation, before dawn, the one who makes the perception of dawn predominant.

original: 'di la yan lag lngas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te dge slong rgyal po dang / btsun mo dang / gzhon nu dang / zhang blon dang / bar chad dang / gdul ba'i dbang gis 'gro ba ma gtogs pa nyid dang / btsun mo'i 'khor 'dug pa'i gnas sam /🔽rgyal po'i pho brang gi gnas gang yang rung bar bdag nyid 'brel bar 'gro ba nyid dang / de'i gnas skabs na skye rengs tha ma ma shar cing nam ma langs pa nyid dang / der 'du shes pa nyid dang / de'i sgo bcad @22a * //
analyzed: 'di la yan lag lngas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te dge slong rgyal po dang / btsun mo dang / gzhon nu dang / zhang blon dang / bar chad dang / gdul ba'i dbang gis 'gro ba ma gtogs pa nyid dang / btsun mo'i 'khor 'dug pa'i gnas sam / rgyal po'i pho brang gi gnas gang yang rung bar bdag nyid 'brel bar 'gro ba nyid dang / de'i gnas skabs na skye rengs tha ma ma shar cing nam ma langs pa nyid dang / der 'du shes pa nyid dang / de'i sgo bcad @22a * //
translated: He goes to the king’s palace or to the queen’s quarters,🔽and he stays there when the sun has set and before it has risen.🔽He is aware that he is staying there,🔽and he stays in a place that is within the range of sight of the palace gate,

original: pa'am ma bcad pa'i gtan pa'i nye 'khor phyir lta ba'am /🔽nang du lta ba gang yang rung ba la 'das pa nyid do //
analyzed: pa'am ma bcad pa'i gtan pa'i nye 'khor phyir lta ba'am / nang du lta ba gang yang rung ba la 'das pa nyid do //

original: de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad do //
analyzed: de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad do //
translated: If any of these factors is missing, the downfall is a serious transgression.🔽The downfall is accrued by the act of staying there.

original: sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas te /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas te /
translated: The downfall of preparation is a minor offense.

original: ji srid du rgyal po'i pho brang du nub mo 'gro ba'i ltung byed kyis sbyor ba brtsams nas dngos gzhi la ma thug gi bar du nyes byas so //
analyzed: ji srid du rgyal po'i pho brang du nub mo 'gro ba'i ltung byed kyis sbyor ba brtsams nas dngos gzhi la ma thug gi bar du nyes byas so //
translated: As long as one has not yet reached the actual basis of the offense of spending the night in a royal palace, one has committed a minor offense.

original: dngos gzhi la sbyor ba tha dad pa ji snyed brtsams pa re re la nyes byas re re'o //
analyzed: dngos gzhi la sbyor ba tha dad pa ji snyed brtsams pa re re la nyes byas re re'o //
translated: For each of the various preparations that one has made for the actual basis, one has committed a minor offense.

original: gal te de'i don nyid kyi phyir grong khyer gyi gnas dang 'brel ba nyid la nyes byas so //
analyzed: gal te de'i don nyid kyi phyir grong khyer gyi gnas dang 'brel ba nyid la nyes byas so //
translated: If one has committed a minor offense in connection with a town because of the very purpose of that,

analyzed: khyim gzhan du skya rengs ma shar bar 'jug na nyes byas so //
translated: if one enters another’s house before dawn, one has committed a minor offense.

original: sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas phra mo ste /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas phra mo ste /
translated: The offense of preparation for preparation is a minor offense.

original: sbyor ba ji snyed pa la sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang de snyed de /
analyzed: sbyor ba ji snyed pa la sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang de snyed de /
translated: For as many preparations as there are, there are also that many preparations for preparation.

original: sbyor ba nyes byas kyi sbyor ba yang nyes byas te nyes byas phra mo'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba nyes byas kyi sbyor ba yang nyes byas te nyes byas phra mo'o //
translated: The preparation for a minor offense is also a minor offense, a minor offense.

original: ltung ba med pa ni der 'du shes med pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: ltung ba med pa ni der 'du shes med pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if one is not aware of it.

original: nyin mo 'jug pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: nyin mo 'jug pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if one enters during the day.

original: dgos pa gzhan gyi phyir 'jug pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: dgos pa gzhan gyi phyir 'jug pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if one goes for another purpose.

original: rgyal po dang btsun mo dang / gzhon nu dang / zhang blon dang / bar chad dang / 'dul ba'i dbang gis 'gro ba la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: rgyal po dang btsun mo dang / gzhon nu dang / zhang blon dang / bar chad dang / 'dul ba'i dbang gis 'gro ba la ltung ba med do //

analyzed: las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang / sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor ba dag gis nyen pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if one is a beginner, insane, or deranged; if one is in pain; or if one is the first two types of postulants.

original: bslab bar bya ba ni dge slong gis yul thams cad la gnas skabs thams cad du rgyal po'i pho brang du nub mo 'gro ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur ba rnam pa thams cad mi bsten par bslab par bya'o //

translated: The training is to be learned by a fully ordained monk not to rely on any of the circumstances for going to the king’s palace at night in any country.

analyzed: rgyal po'i pho brang du nub mo 'gro ba'i ltung byed de brgyad cu gnyis pa bshad zin to /

translated: Here, the basic downfall is as follows: When the community of monks recites the Sūtra of Individual Liberation during the confession ceremony that takes place every half month, a monk who has previously experienced the two stages of the ceremony and is not confused about them laughs loudly and without reason.

analyzed: bzhad gad tsam yan chad la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no fault if one disparages the bases of training in the confession ceremony that occurs every half month when the Sūtra of Individual Liberation is being recited.

original: so sor thar pa'i mdo gdon pa 'di la bslab pa'i gzhi'i chos 'di yod par bdag gis da gzod shes so zhes zer ba gang yang rung ba la na smad pa med do //

translated: There is no fault in saying to anyone, “I have just now come to know that this training precept exists in this recitation of the Sūtra of Individual Liberation.”

translated: The agent of this is the actual training precept, except for a monk who has previously experienced two poṣadhas and is not confused, and one who possesses the sūtra.

analyzed: 'di la yan lag lngas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /

translated: The monk who has already experienced the poṣadha twice, who is not confused, at the time of reciting the poṣadha, who is the basis of the training that belongs to the Vinaya, and who directly or indirectly despises.

original: de la yang yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad do //
analyzed: de la yang yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad do //

analyzed: sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas te ji srid du bslab pa'i gzhi'i dngos po la khyad du gsod pa'i ltung byed kyi sbyor ba brtsams nas dngos gzhi la ma thug gi bar du nyes byas so //
translated: The downfall of preparation is a minor infraction. As long as one has begun the preparation for the downfall of despising the basis of the training, but has not yet reached the actual basis, it is a minor infraction.

original: dngos gzhi la sbyor ba tha dad pa ji snyed brtsams pa re re la nyes byas re re'o //
analyzed: dngos gzhi la sbyor ba tha dad pa ji snyed brtsams pa re re la nyes byas re re'o //
translated: For each of the preparations that are different from the actual basis, there is a minor infraction.

analyzed: sngar gso sbyong lan gnyis ma myong ba la nyes byas so //
translated: For one who has not previously experienced the poṣadha twice, it is a minor infraction.

analyzed: gso sbyong 'don pa'i dus ma yin pa'i tshe nyes byas so //

translated: When the nuns recite the Poṣadha ceremony, there is an offense of wrong conduct for the common basis of training.

original: mdo sde dang ldan pa la nyes byas so //
analyzed: mdo sde dang ldan pa la nyes byas so //
translated: There is an offense of wrong conduct for those who possess the sūtras.

original: sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas phra mo ste sbyor ba ji snyed pa la sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang de snyed de sbyor ba nyes byas kyi sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang nyes byas te nyes byas phra mo'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas phra mo ste sbyor ba ji snyed pa la sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang de snyed de sbyor ba nyes byas kyi sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang nyes byas te nyes byas phra mo'o //
translated: The offense of the application of an application is a minor offense. As many as there are applications, there are that many applications of the application. The application of an application is also a minor offense. The application of an offense of wrong conduct is also a minor offense.

original: ltung ba med pa ni yid rmongs pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: ltung ba med pa ni yid rmongs pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense for one who is confused.

original: dge slong ma rnams kyis gso sbyong 'don pa'i tshe bslab pa'i gzhi'i dngos po thun mong ma yin pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: dge slong ma rnams kyis gso sbyong 'don pa'i tshe bslab pa'i gzhi'i dngos po thun mong ma yin pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: When the nuns recite the Poṣadha ceremony, there is no offense for the uncommon basis of training.

original: las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang / sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor ba dag gis nyen pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang / sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor ba dag gis nyen pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense for a beginner, for one who is insane, for one whose mind is disturbed, and for one who is overwhelmed by pain.

original: bslab par bya ba ni dge slong gis yul thams cad la gnas skabs @24b thams cad du bslab pa'i gzhi'i dngos po la khyad du gsod pa'i ltung byed du 'gyur ba rnam pa thams cad mi bsten par bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: bslab par bya ba ni dge slong gis yul thams cad la gnas skabs @24b thams cad du bslab pa'i gzhi'i dngos po la khyad du gsod pa'i ltung byed du 'gyur ba rnam pa thams cad mi bsten par bslab par bya'o //
translated: The training is that a monk should train in not relying on any of the aspects of the bases of training that are disregarded in any place or at any time.

analyzed: so sor thar pa'i mdo 'don pa'i tshe ma gus par nyan pa nye bar sgrub pa la 'gyod du gzhug go //
translated: When the Sūtra on the Foundation of Training is recited, he should make the others regret their lack of respect for it.

original: phyir bcos pa rnams ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: phyir bcos pa rnams ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The means of remediation are the same as before.

original: bslab pa'i gzhi'i dngos po la khyad du gsod pa'i ltung byed de brgyad cu gsum pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: bslab pa'i gzhi'i dngos po la khyad du gsod pa'i ltung byed de brgyad cu gsum pa bshad zin to /

translated: The Buddha, the Blessed One, was staying at Jetavana, Anāthapiṇḍada’s Park near Śrāvastī,

analyzed: mnyan yod na gcer bu pa'i nyan thos chos zhes bya ba ba so mkhan zhig 'dug pa de gcer bu pa dag la shin tu mngon par dad de de dus gzhan zhig na dge slong bsod snyams pa zhig gis chos bstan pas btul nas des kyang de la
translated: In Śrāvastī there was a naked ascetic named Dharma who was a potter. He had great faith in the naked ascetics.

analyzed: skyabs su 'gro ba dang / bslab pa'i gzhi dag blangs so //
translated: At one time a monk who went for alms taught him the Dharma. He was subdued and took refuge and the precepts.

original: yang bsod snyams pa des de la rdzas las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i gzhi bdun gyi bsngags pa rgya cher brjod pa dang / de mngon par dad par gyur nas smras pa /
analyzed: yang bsod snyams pa des de la rdzas las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i gzhi bdun gyi bsngags pa rgya cher brjod pa dang / de mngon par dad par gyur nas smras pa /
translated: Again that monk extensively praised the seven bases of meritorious action that arise from material generosity, and he became faithful and said,

original: 'phags pa bdag gis kyang rdzas las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i gzhi cung zad cig yang dag par blangs te 'jug par bgyi /
analyzed: 'phags pa bdag gis kyang rdzas las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i gzhi cung zad cig yang dag par blangs te 'jug par bgyi /

analyzed: bdag gis dge slong gi dge 'dun la rang gis bzos bsnyen bkur bgyi'o //

original: bsod snyoms pa de gtsug lag khang du song ste dge slong rnams la smras pa /
analyzed: bsod snyoms pa de gtsug lag khang du song ste dge slong rnams la smras pa /
translated: The alms-begging monk went to the monastery and said to the monks,

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag bdag gis gcer bu ba'i nyan thos chos zhes bya ba bso mkhan de skyabs su 'gro ba dang / bslab pa'i gzhi dag la bzhag nas de dge slong gi dge 'dun la bzos bsnyen bkur byed kyis /

translated: “Venerable sirs, I have made the naked ascetic’s disciple named Dharma an alms-giver. I have established him in the refuges and the fundamental precepts. He is serving and honoring the community of monks.🔽So let anyone who wants anything have him do it.”

original: su ci 'dod pa des de byed du chug cig / ci tsam na dge slong zhig la khab ral med nas de de'i gan du song ste smras pa /
analyzed: su ci 'dod pa des de byed du chug cig / ci tsam na dge slong zhig la khab ral med nas de de'i gan du song ste smras pa /
translated: Then a monk who did not have a needle case went to him and said,🔽“Good man, I don’t have a needle case. Make me one.”

original: bzhin bzangs kho bo la khab ra la med kyis de gyis shig /'phags pa ji lta bu zhig bgyi /🔽gang bzang ba'o /
analyzed: bzhin bzangs kho bo la khab ra la med kyis de gyis shig /'phags pa ji lta bu zhig bgyi / gang bzang ba'o /
translated: “Noble one, what kind should I make?”🔽“Make a good one.”

original: 'phags pa bso las bgyis pa bzang ba'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa bso las bgyis pa bzang ba'o //
translated: “Noble one, make an alms-made one.”

original: bzhin bzangs ba so las byas pa gyis shig /
analyzed: bzhin bzangs ba so las byas pa gyis shig /
translated: “Good man, make an alms-made one.”

original: des de'i khab ral ba so las byas pa byas te byin no //
analyzed: des de'i khab ral ba so las byas pa byas te byin no //
translated: He made a needle case out of ivory and gave it to him.

original: dge slong des de dge slong rnams la bstan pa dang / dge slong gzhan gyis kyang de lta bu byed du bcug cing /
analyzed: dge slong des de dge slong rnams la bstan pa dang / dge slong gzhan gyis kyang de lta bu byed du bcug cing /
translated: The monk showed it to the other monks, and the other monks also had him make them.

original: gzhan gyis kyang byed du bcug / gzhan gyis kyang byed du bcug pas de'i ba so zad par gyur to //🔽dge slong gzhan zhig @25a * //
analyzed: gzhan gyis kyang byed du bcug / gzhan gyis kyang byed du bcug pas de'i ba so zad par gyur to // dge slong gzhan zhig @25a * //
translated: The other monks also had him make them, and so he exhausted his ivory.

original: kyang 'ongs te smras pa /
analyzed: kyang 'ongs te smras pa /
translated: Another monk came and said,🔽“Sir, make me one.”🔽“Noble one, what kind of one?”

original: bzhin bzangs kho bo'i khab ral gyis shig /'phags pa ji lta bu zhig bgyi /🔽gang bzang ba'o //
analyzed: bzhin bzangs kho bo'i khab ral gyis shig /'phags pa ji lta bu zhig bgyi / gang bzang ba'o //
translated: “Make me a good one.”

original: 'phags pa ba so las bgyis pa bzang na ba so ni bas so //
analyzed: 'phags pa ba so las bgyis pa bzang na ba so ni bas so //
translated: “Noble one, if a good one made from ivory is good, then ivory is expensive.”

original: gal te bzhed na rus pa las bgyis pa bgyi'o //
analyzed: gal te bzhed na rus pa las bgyis pa bgyi'o //
translated: “If you want, make me one from bone.”🔽“Sir, don’t say that. Make me one.”

original: bzhin bzangs ma nyes kyis gyis shig / des de'i khab ral rus pa las byas pa byas te byin no //
analyzed: bzhin bzangs ma nyes kyis gyis shig / des de'i khab ral rus pa las byas pa byas te byin no //
translated: He made one from bone and gave it to him.

original: dge slong des de dge slong rnams la bstan pa dang / dge slong gzhan gyis kyang de lta bu byed du bcug cing /
analyzed: dge slong des de dge slong rnams la bstan pa dang / dge slong gzhan gyis kyang de lta bu byed du bcug cing /
translated: The monk showed it to the other monks, and the other monks also had him make them.

original: gzhan gyis kyang byed du bcug / gzhan gyis kyang byed du bcug pas de'i rus pa yang zad par gyur to //
analyzed: gzhan gyis kyang byed du bcug / gzhan gyis kyang byed du bcug pas de'i rus pa yang zad par gyur to //
translated: He had others do it, and he had others do it for him.

original: dge slong gzhan zhig gis kyang 'ongs te smras pa /
analyzed: dge slong gzhan zhig gis kyang 'ongs te smras pa /
translated: Another monk came and said,

original: bzhin bzangs kho bo'i khab ral gyis shig /'phags pa ji lta bu zhig bgyi /🔽gang bzang ba'o //
analyzed: bzhin bzangs kho bo'i khab ral gyis shig /'phags pa ji lta bu zhig bgyi / gang bzang ba'o //
translated: “Sir, please make a needle case for me.”🔽“Noble one, make it good.”

original: 'phags pa ba so las bgyis pa bzang na ba so de ni bas so //🔽bzhin bzangs gal te de ltar na rus pa las byas pa gyis shig /'phags pa rus pa ya rabs so //
analyzed: 'phags pa ba so las bgyis pa bzang na ba so de ni bas so // bzhin bzangs gal te de ltar na rus pa las byas pa gyis shig /'phags pa rus pa ya rabs so //
translated: “Noble one, if it’s good, it will be made of ivory.”🔽“Sir, if it’s like that, make it of bone.”

original: gal te bzhed na rva las bgyis pa bgyi'o //
analyzed: gal te bzhed na rva las bgyis pa bgyi'o //
translated: “Noble one, if you like, make it of horn.”🔽“Sir, don’t do it wrong. Make it well.”

original: bzhin bzangs ma nyes kyis gyis shig / des de'i khab ral rva las byas pa byas te byin no //
analyzed: bzhin bzangs ma nyes kyis gyis shig / des de'i khab ral rva las byas pa byas te byin no //
translated: He made a needle case of horn and gave it to him.

original: dge slong des de dge slong rnams la bstan pa dang / dge slong gzhan zhig kyang de lta bu byed du bcug cing /
analyzed: dge slong des de dge slong rnams la bstan pa dang / dge slong gzhan zhig kyang de lta bu byed du bcug cing /
translated: That monk showed it to the monks, and another monk had him make one like it.

original: gzhan gyis kyang de lta bu byed du bcug / gzhan gyis kyang de lta bu byed du bcug pas de'i rva yang zad par gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan gyis kyang de lta bu byed du bcug / gzhan gyis kyang de lta bu byed du bcug pas de'i rva yang zad par gyur te /
translated: He made others do the same.

original: des rang gi zan dang rang gi yo byad dag gis dge slong rnams kyis las byed pa na dbul por gyur to //
analyzed: des rang gi zan dang rang gi yo byad dag gis dge slong rnams kyis las byed pa na dbul por gyur to //
translated: He became poor because he had to use his own food and his own possessions to pay the monks for their work.

original: gcer bu bdag chos 'di gang gi tshe kho bo cag la mngon par dad par gyur pa de'i tshe na 'di thams cad phun sum tshogs par gyur nad 'di da ltar sh'akya'i bu'i dge slong rnams la mngon par dad pas zin yang slong bar byed do zhes 'phya
analyzed: gcer bu bdag chos 'di gang gi tshe kho bo cag la mngon par dad par gyur pa de'i tshe na 'di thams cad phun sum tshogs par gyur nad 'di da ltar sh'akya'i bu'i dge slong rnams la mngon par dad pas zin yang slong bar byed do zhes 'phya
translated: “When this doctrine was first taught, he had faith in us and everything was fine. But now he has faith in the monks of the Śākya sage, and he is still begging.”

original: ba la zhugs pa'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //
analyzed: ba la zhugs pa'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //
translated: The monks reported this matter to the Blessed One.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byung ba 'di dang / gleng gzhi 'di dang / skabs 'di la dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdu ba mdzad de /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byung ba 'di dang / gleng gzhi 'di dang / skabs 'di la dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdu ba mdzad de /
translated: Then the Blessed One, in this very situation, in this very connection, and on this very occasion, assembled the community of monks and asked them,

original: dge slong rnams la rmas nas /
analyzed: dge slong rnams la rmas nas /
translated: “Monks, is it true that the naked ascetic Pāṭikāputra is saying this?”🔽“It is true, Blessed One.”

original: dge sbyong gi tshul ma yin pa /🔽rjes su mthun pa ma yin pa /
analyzed: dge sbyong gi tshul ma yin pa / rjes su mthun pa ma yin pa /
translated: It is not the way of a spiritual practitioner.🔽It is not suitable.

original: rung ba ma yin pa /
analyzed: rung ba ma yin pa /
translated: It is not proper.🔽It is not in accord with the Dharma.

original: tshul dang mthun pa ma yin pa de ni rab tu byung bas bya ba ma yin no zhes rnam grangs du mar rnam par smad de /
analyzed: tshul dang mthun pa ma yin pa de ni rab tu byung bas bya ba ma yin no zhes rnam grangs du mar rnam par smad de /
translated: It is not something that one who has gone forth should do.”

original: bslab pa bca' ba'i phan yon bcu yang dag par gzigs pas /
analyzed: bslab pa bca' ba'i phan yon bcu yang dag par gzigs pas /
translated: He saw ten benefits of establishing the training rules

original: nga'i nyan @25b thos rnams kyis 'dul bal bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /🔽yang dge slong gang bso 'am /
analyzed: nga'i nyan @25b thos rnams kyis 'dul bal bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste / yang dge slong gang bso 'am /
translated: and said, “My disciples, you should recite this rule for training:

original: rus pa'am / rva'i khab ral byed du 'jug na bcag nas ltung byed do zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
analyzed: rus pa'am / rva'i khab ral byed du 'jug na bcag nas ltung byed do zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
translated: ‘If a monk makes a needle case out of bone, ivory, or horn, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.’”

original: yul ni mnyan yod /
analyzed: yul ni mnyan yod /
translated: The location is in Śrāvastī.

original: gang zag ni chos 'di pa'i dge slong rab tu mang bo /
analyzed: gang zag ni chos 'di pa'i dge slong rab tu mang bo /
translated: The persons are many monks who follow the Dharma.

original: nyon mongs pa ni 'dod zhe na /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ni 'dod zhe na /
translated: The root of the offense is desire.

original: nyes pa ni khab ral 'chos pa'o //
analyzed: nyes pa ni khab ral 'chos pa'o //
translated: The action is making a needle case.

original: de la yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni chos 'di pa'o //
analyzed: de la yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni chos 'di pa'o //
translated: “A monk” means a monk of this teaching.

original: bso 'am zhes bya ba ni ba so nyid do //
analyzed: bso 'am zhes bya ba ni ba so nyid do //
translated: “Bone” means the bone of humans or animals.

original: rus pa'am zhes bya ba yang rus pa nyid do //
analyzed: rus pa'am zhes bya ba yang rus pa nyid do //
translated: “Bone” means bone itself.

original: rva'i zhes bya ba yang rva nyid kyi'o //
analyzed: rva'i zhes bya ba yang rva nyid kyi'o //
translated: “Horn” means of a horn.

original: khab ral zhes bya ba ni khab ral gnyis te /
analyzed: khab ral zhes bya ba ni khab ral gnyis te /
translated: “Needle and awl” means two things:

original: sbu gu can dang ; chang pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: sbu gu can dang ; chang pa lta bu'o //
translated: a tube and a container.

original: don 'dir ni gnyi ga yin par dgongs so //
analyzed: don 'dir ni gnyi ga yin par dgongs so //
translated: In this context, both are intended.

original: byed du 'jug pa zhes bya ba ni rang gis sam gzhan no //
analyzed: byed du 'jug pa zhes bya ba ni rang gis sam gzhan no //
translated: “Causes to make” means by oneself or by another.

original: bcag nas zhes bya ba ni dngos po de bcag nas ltung byed kyi ltung ba bshags par bya ba'o //
analyzed: bcag nas zhes bya ba ni dngos po de bcag nas ltung byed kyi ltung ba bshags par bya ba'o //
translated: “Having broken” means having broken that thing, one confesses the offense of a pāyattika.

original: ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: “Pāyattika” is as above.

original: de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na ;
analyzed: de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na ;
translated: What is the offense here?

original: 'dir yang dngos gzhi dang / sbyor ba dang / sbyor ba'i sbyor bas ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa dang / ltung ba med pa dang / bslab par bya ba dang / phyir bcos pa rnams kyis 'di'i mtshan nyid shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang dngos gzhi dang / sbyor ba dang / sbyor ba'i sbyor bas ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa dang / ltung ba med pa dang / bslab par bya ba dang / phyir bcos pa rnams kyis 'di'i mtshan nyid shes par bya'o //
translated: Here, the characteristics of this should be understood by the basic situation, the preparation, the preparation for the preparation, the presentation of the offense, the absence of an offense, the training, and the amendment.

original: de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni dge slong gis rin po che ma gtogs pa bso'am rus pa'am rva 'am lcags la sogs pa'i khab ral byed dam byed du bcug na khab ral 'chos pa'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni dge slong gis rin po che ma gtogs pa bso'am rus pa'am rva 'am lcags la sogs pa'i khab ral byed dam byed du bcug na khab ral 'chos pa'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
translated: Here, the basic downfall is defined as follows: If a fully ordained monk makes a needle case out of bone, horn, ivory, or metal, except for precious substances, or has it made, he commits the basic downfall of making a needle case.

original: bso dang rus pa dang rva gang yang rung ba lan smad pa med do //
analyzed: bso dang rus pa dang rva gang yang rung ba lan smad pa med do //
translated: It is not a downfall if the bone, horn, or ivory is not polished.

original: lcags la sogs pa lan smad pa med do //
analyzed: lcags la sogs pa lan smad pa med do //
translated: It is not a downfall if the metal is not polished.

original: khab ral sbu can dang chang ba lta bu gang yang rung ba lan smad pa med do //
analyzed: khab ral sbu can dang chang ba lta bu gang yang rung ba lan smad pa med do //
translated: It is not a downfall if the needle case is made of hair or is shaped like a wine jar.

original: rang byed dam gzhan byed du bcug pa lan smad pa med do //
analyzed: rang byed dam gzhan byed du bcug pa lan smad pa med do //
translated: It is not a downfall if he makes it himself or has someone else make it.

original: 'di'i byed pa po ni 'dod zhen gyi bsam pa dang / rin po che ma gtogs pa'i khab ral nyid do //
analyzed: 'di'i byed pa po ni 'dod zhen gyi bsam pa dang / rin po che ma gtogs pa'i khab ral nyid do //
translated: The agent of this downfall is a monk who is motivated by attachment and makes a needle case out of a precious substance or a needle case that is not made of bone, horn, or ivory.

original: 'di la yan lag lngas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di la yan lag lngas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
translated: This downfall is completed by five factors.

original: 'dod zhen gyi bsam pa nyid dang / rin po che dang gnang ba nyid ma gtogs pa dang / bso 'am rus pa'am rva 'am lcags la sogs pa'i khab ral nyid dang / byas zin pa la rnyed pa dang / byas zin pa la spyod pa ma gtogs pa nyid dang /
analyzed: 'dod zhen gyi bsam pa nyid dang / rin po che dang gnang ba nyid ma gtogs pa dang / bso 'am rus pa'am rva 'am lcags la sogs pa'i khab ral nyid dang / byas zin pa la rnyed pa dang / byas zin pa la spyod pa ma gtogs pa nyid dang /
translated: except for needles and awls made of bone, horn, or iron, etc., and except for those already made, and except for using those already made,

original: rang gis byed dam gzhan byed du bcug pa nyid do //
analyzed: rang gis byed dam gzhan byed du bcug pa nyid do //
translated: and except for making them oneself or having someone else make them.

original: de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad pa @26a * //
analyzed: de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad pa @26a * //
translated: If any of these conditions are incomplete, there is no offense.

original: med do ; / sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas so //
analyzed: med do ; / sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas so //
translated: The downfall of preparation is a minor infraction.

original: ji srid du khab ral 'chos pa'i ltung byed kyi sbyor ba brtsams nas dngos gzhi la mthug gi bar du nyes byas so //
analyzed: ji srid du khab ral 'chos pa'i ltung byed kyi sbyor ba brtsams nas dngos gzhi la mthug gi bar du nyes byas so //
