translated: As long as one has begun the preparation for the downfall of making a needle or awl but has not yet completed the main part, it is a minor infraction.

original: dngos gzhi la sbyor ba tha dad pa ji snyed brtsams pa re re la nyes byas re re'o //
analyzed: dngos gzhi la sbyor ba tha dad pa ji snyed brtsams pa re re la nyes byas re re'o //
translated: For each main part of the preparation that one has begun, there is a minor infraction.

original: rin po che las byas pa ni rung ba ma yin pas nyes byas so //
analyzed: rin po che las byas pa ni rung ba ma yin pas nyes byas so //
translated: If one makes it from precious substances, it is a minor infraction because it is not suitable.

original: bcag gam zhes ma dris par ltung ba 'chags pa dang du len na nyes byas so //
analyzed: bcag gam zhes ma dris par ltung ba 'chags pa dang du len na nyes byas so //
translated: If you agree to confess a downfall without asking whether it is a partial defeat, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.

original: sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas phra mo ste /🔽sbyor ba ji snyed pa la sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'ang de snyed de /🔽sbyor ba nyes byas kyi sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'ang nyes byas te nyes byas phra mo'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas phra mo ste / sbyor ba ji snyed pa la sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'ang de snyed de / sbyor ba nyes byas kyi sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'ang nyes byas te nyes byas phra mo'o //
translated: The downfall of preparation is a minor offense.🔽There are as many downfalls of preparation as there are preparations, and the downfall of preparation is also a minor offense.

original: ltung ba med pa ni byas zin pa rnyed pa dang / byas zin pa la spyod pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: ltung ba med pa ni byas zin pa rnyed pa dang / byas zin pa la spyod pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: The downfall of preparation is a minor offense.

original: las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang / sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor bdag gis nyen pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang / sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor bdag gis nyen pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no downfall if you are insane or deranged, or if you are in pain.

original: bslab par bya ba ni dge slong gis yul thams cad la gnas skabs thams cad du khab ral 'chos pa'i ltung byed du 'gyur ba rnam pa thams cad mi bsten par bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: bslab par bya ba ni dge slong gis yul thams cad la gnas skabs thams cad du khab ral 'chos pa'i ltung byed du 'gyur ba rnam pa thams cad mi bsten par bslab par bya'o //
translated: The training rule is that a monk should not use a needle case made of ivory, bone, or horn.

original: gang gi mdun du 'chags par byed pa des khyod kyis dngos po de bcag gam zhes dri bar bya'o //🔽bcag pa bya ba na nyid ma dris par 'chags par blang par mi bya'o //
analyzed: gang gi mdun du 'chags par byed pa des khyod kyis dngos po de bcag gam zhes dri bar bya'o // bcag pa bya ba na nyid ma dris par 'chags par blang par mi bya'o //
translated: The one in front of whom one confesses should ask, “Did you break that thing?”🔽If one breaks it, one should not confess without asking.

original: ma bcag par 'chags na ltung bde bshags pa ma yin pas bshags par bya'o //
analyzed: ma bcag par 'chags na ltung bde bshags pa ma yin pas bshags par bya'o //
translated: If one confesses without breaking it, it is not a confession of a downfall.

original: phyir bcos pa rnams ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: phyir bcos pa rnams ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The amendment is the same as before.🔽This is the explanation of the eighty-fourth downfall.

original: khab ral 'chos pa'i ltung byed de brgyad cu bzhi pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: khab ral 'chos pa'i ltung byed de brgyad cu bzhi pa bshad zin to /
translated: The Vinaya Verses:

original: // / so sor thar pa'i mdo rgya cher 'grel pa 'dul ba kun las btus pa /🔽bam po bzhi bcu gcig pa /
analyzed: // / so sor thar pa'i mdo rgya cher 'grel pa 'dul ba kun las btus pa / bam po bzhi bcu gcig pa /
translated: The Vinaya Verses, a commentary on the Prātimokṣa Sūtra,🔽is the Compendium of Monastic Training.

original: khri rkang 'chos pa'i ltung byed kyi gleng gzhi ni /
analyzed: khri rkang 'chos pa'i ltung byed kyi gleng gzhi ni /
translated: The origin story of the downfall on making a bed with legs higher than a cubit:

original: bcas pa dang gnang ba'i dbang gis rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: bcas pa dang gnang ba'i dbang gis rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two types of rules, according to whether they are prohibitions or permissions.

original: bcas pa'i gleng gzhi ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
analyzed: bcas pa'i gleng gzhi ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
translated: The origin story of the prohibition is as follows. The Blessed Buddha was staying in Śrāvastī, in Jeta Grove, in the park of Anāthapiṇḍada.

original: de'i tshe na dge slong zhig ljongs rgyu zhing 'gro ba na mnyan yod du phyin nas lam gyis dub pa'i ngal bso ste sgo khang du khri dma' ba zhig rnyed pa'i mdun du rkang pa gnyis bkrus nas skyil mo krung bcas te 'dug pa gnyid kyis yur ba'i
analyzed: de'i tshe na dge slong zhig ljongs rgyu zhing 'gro ba na mnyan yod du phyin nas lam gyis dub pa'i ngal bso ste sgo khang du khri dma' ba zhig rnyed pa'i mdun du rkang pa gnyis bkrus nas skyil mo krung bcas te 'dug pa gnyid kyis yur ba'i
translated: At that time a monk was traveling through the countryside. He arrived in Śrāvastī and rested from the fatigue of the road. In the doorway he found a low bench. He washed his feet in front of it, sat down cross-legged, and fell asleep.

original: tshe lus 'khyog cing khri sgra tsheg zer ba na 'og nas sbrul dug myur du khyab par byed pa zhig byung bas 'phral bar bzung ste dus la bab nas sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i @26b lha'i drang srong rnams kyi nang du skyes te /
analyzed: tshe lus 'khyog cing khri sgra tsheg zer ba na 'og nas sbrul dug myur du khyab par byed pa zhig byung bas 'phral bar bzung ste dus la bab nas sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i @26b lha'i drang srong rnams kyi nang du skyes te /
translated: When he did, his body twisted and the bench creaked. A snake that was living underneath came out and bit him. He died and was reborn among the ṛṣis of the Heaven of the Thirty-Three.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar 'ongs nas rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob pa'i gzhi las bcom ldan 'das kyis dgongs pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar 'ongs nas rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob pa'i gzhi las bcom ldan 'das kyis dgongs pa /
translated: He came into the presence of the Bhagavān and attained the result of stream enterer. The Bhagavān thought about the basis of his attainment.

original: nyes dmigs gang cung zad ci byung ba thams cad dge slong dag khri dma' ba mal 'cha' zhing de'i mdun du rkang pa gnyis 'khru ba las gyur pa yin no snyam du dgongs nas bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: nyes dmigs gang cung zad ci byung ba thams cad dge slong dag khri dma' ba mal 'cha' zhing de'i mdun du rkang pa gnyis 'khru ba las gyur pa yin no snyam du dgongs nas bka' stsal pa /
translated: Thinking this, he said,

original: de lta bas na dge slong gis khri dma' ba la mal bca' bar mi bya zhing /
analyzed: de lta bas na dge slong gis khri dma' ba la mal bca' bar mi bya zhing /
translated: “Therefore, monks should not make their beds on low platforms.

original: khri'i mdun du rkang pa gnyis bkru bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: khri'i mdun du rkang pa gnyis bkru bar mi bya'o //
translated: They should not wash their feet in front of the platform.”

original: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / dge slong mchil lham mi bdog pa dag la gnod par gyur nas ;
analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / dge slong mchil lham mi bdog pa dag la gnod par gyur nas ;
translated: When this was said, monks who did not have shoes were harmed.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: gang dag la mchil lham mi bdog pa de dag gi mgo logs dang rkang pa logs su rkang pa gnyis bkru bar bya ste /
analyzed: gang dag la mchil lham mi bdog pa de dag gi mgo logs dang rkang pa logs su rkang pa gnyis bkru bar bya ste /
translated: “Those who do not have shoes should wash their feet on the side of their heads and on the side of their feet.

original: 'di la 'gyod par mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'di la 'gyod par mi bya'o //
translated: They should not regret this.”

original: drug sde dag gis dge slong khri dma' ba la nyal ba sbrul dug myur du khyab par byed pas zin te dus la bab nas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong gis khri dma' ba la mal bca' bar mi bya'o zhes bka' stsal pa thos nas /
analyzed: drug sde dag gis dge slong khri dma' ba la nyal ba sbrul dug myur du khyab par byed pas zin te dus la bab nas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong gis khri dma' ba la mal bca' bar mi bya'o zhes bka' stsal pa thos nas /
translated: The group of six heard that the Blessed One had said, “Monks should not sleep on low beds,” and that a monk who had slept on a low bed had been bitten by a snake that spread its venom quickly and had died.

original: de dag gis khri rkang pa bcu gnyis pa btsugs te ya gad mthon po btsugs pa dang / dge slong rnams kyis de dag la smras pa tshe dang ldan pa dag cig khyed cag byar byed dam /
analyzed: de dag gis khri rkang pa bcu gnyis pa btsugs te ya gad mthon po btsugs pa dang / dge slong rnams kyis de dag la smras pa tshe dang ldan pa dag cig khyed cag byar byed dam /
translated: They set up a bed with twelve legs and a high canopy, and the monks said to them, “Venerables, are you going to do this?”

original: de dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: de dag gis smras pa /
translated: They said,🔽🔽

original: su zhig byar byed /
analyzed: su zhig byar byed /
translated: Who is doing what?”

original: khyed kyis dge slong khri dma' ba la nyal ba sbrul dug myur du khyab pas zin te dus la bab pa ma mthong ngam ci drug sde dag kyang sbrul dug myur du khyab par byed pas bzung ste dus la bab cing kho bo cag shi ba'i yo byad
analyzed: khyed kyis dge slong khri dma' ba la nyal ba sbrul dug myur du khyab pas zin te dus la bab pa ma mthong ngam ci drug sde dag kyang sbrul dug myur du khyab par byed pas bzung ste dus la bab cing kho bo cag shi ba'i yo byad
translated: “Haven’t you seen a monk who slept on a low bed bitten by a snake that spread its venom quickly and died? The group of six were also bitten by a snake that spread its venom quickly and died.

original: dag 'god par byed 'dod dam zhes zer nas /
analyzed: dag 'god par byed 'dod dam zhes zer nas /
translated: We want to set out the things we need for our funerals.”

original: dge slong don nyung ngu dag ci'i phyir dge slong dag dge slong rnams kyis bzlog pa na de dang de skad ces zer zhing smod par byed /
analyzed: dge slong don nyung ngu dag ci'i phyir dge slong dag dge slong rnams kyis bzlog pa na de dang de skad ces zer zhing smod par byed /
translated: “They are making a fuss,

original: phyar kha gtong bar byed /🔽kha zer bar byed pa'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa dang / de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byung ba 'di dag gang gzhi 'di dang / skabs 'di la dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdu ba mdzad de /
analyzed: phyar kha gtong bar byed / kha zer bar byed pa'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa dang / de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byung ba 'di dag gang gzhi 'di dang / skabs 'di la dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdu ba mdzad de /
translated: slandering, and talking about us.”🔽The monks reported this matter to the Blessed One, and the Blessed One, on this occasion, in this situation, assembled the saṅgha of monks and questioned the group of six:

original: drug sde dag la rmas nas /
analyzed: drug sde dag la rmas nas /
translated: “Is it true, monks, that you did this?”

original: dge sbyong gi tshul ma yin pa /🔽rjes su mthun pa ma yin pa /
analyzed: dge sbyong gi tshul ma yin pa / rjes su mthun pa ma yin pa /
translated: “It is not suitable for renunciants,

original: rung ba ma yin pa /
analyzed: rung ba ma yin pa /
translated: it is not allowable,🔽it is not to be done.

original: tshul dang mthun pa ma yin pa de ni rab tu byung bas bya ba ma yin @27a * //
analyzed: tshul dang mthun pa ma yin pa de ni rab tu byung bas bya ba ma yin @27a * //
translated: This is not the way of renunciants.”

original: no zhes rnam grangs du mar rnam par smad de /
analyzed: no zhes rnam grangs du mar rnam par smad de /
translated: In this way, he censured them in many ways.

original: bslab pa bca' ba'i phan yon bcu yang dag par gzigs pas /
analyzed: bslab pa bca' ba'i phan yon bcu yang dag par gzigs pas /
translated: Seeing ten benefits, the Blessed One laid down a training rule for his disciples:

original: nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /
analyzed: nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /
translated: My disciples should recite this training precept for the Vinaya:

original: dge slong gi dge 'dun gyi khri'am khri'u byed du 'jud na rtsa ba bde bar gshegs pa'i sor brgyad kyi tshad du byed du gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong gi dge 'dun gyi khri'am khri'u byed du 'jud na rtsa ba bde bar gshegs pa'i sor brgyad kyi tshad du byed du gzhug par bya'o //
translated: “When a monk has a seat or bench made for the saṅgha of monks, the legs should be made eight standard fingerbreadths long.

original: de las lhag par byed du 'jug na bcad nas ltung byed do zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
analyzed: de las lhag par byed du 'jug na bcad nas ltung byed do zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
translated: If he has them made longer than that, then having cut them down, he should confess a pāyattika offense.”

original: yul ni mnyan yod /
analyzed: yul ni mnyan yod /
translated: The place was Śrāvastī.

original: gang zag ni drug sde /
analyzed: gang zag ni drug sde /
translated: The person was the group of six.

original: nyon mongs pa ni lhag pa tshol ba /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ni lhag pa tshol ba /
translated: The affliction was seeking more.

original: nyes pa ni khri rkang mthon por byed pa'o //
analyzed: nyes pa ni khri rkang mthon por byed pa'o //
translated: The offense was making the legs of the seat too high.

original: gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
analyzed: gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
translated: The background story for the allowance is this. The Blessed Buddha was staying in Śrāvastī, in the Jeta Grove, in the park of Anāthapiṇḍada.

original: tshe dang ldan pa 'char ka lus tshad las shin tu 'das pa yin pas de'i pus mo gnyis ko sko la reg pa'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa 'char ka lus tshad las shin tu 'das pa yin pas de'i pus mo gnyis ko sko la reg pa'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: de lta bas na bu gar gzhug pa ma gtogs so //
analyzed: de lta bas na bu gar gzhug pa ma gtogs so //
translated: “Therefore, except for the opening,

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis bslab pa 'dod pa dang / bslab pa la gus pa dang / bslab pa la yo byad bsnyungs pa'i bsngags pa brjod pa mdzad nas dge slong rnams la de dang mthun pa dang / de'i shas che ba dang / de dang 'tsham pa'i chos dang ldan pa'i bka' mchid mdzad nas dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis bslab pa 'dod pa dang / bslab pa la gus pa dang / bslab pa la yo byad bsnyungs pa'i bsngags pa brjod pa mdzad nas dge slong rnams la de dang mthun pa dang / de'i shas che ba dang / de dang 'tsham pa'i chos dang ldan pa'i bka' mchid mdzad nas dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /
translated: Then the Blessed One, having praised the desire for training, respect for training, and the austerity of training, spoke in a way that accorded with, was not contrary to, and was consistent with the Dharma, saying,

original: dge slong dag de lta bas na snga ma ni bcas pa yin la /
analyzed: dge slong dag de lta bas na snga ma ni bcas pa yin la /
translated: “Monks, therefore the previous allowance

original: 'di ni rjes su gnang ba yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni rjes su gnang ba yin te /
translated: is rescinded.

original: nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /
analyzed: nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /
translated: My disciples should recite this training rule:

original: dge slong gi dge 'dun gyi khri'am khri'u byed du 'jug na rtsa ba bu gar gzhug pa ma gtogs pa bde bar gshegs pa'i sor brgyad kyi tshad tsam du byed du 'jug par bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong gi dge 'dun gyi khri'am khri'u byed du 'jug na rtsa ba bu gar gzhug pa ma gtogs pa bde bar gshegs pa'i sor brgyad kyi tshad tsam du byed du 'jug par bya'o //
translated: ‘If a monk has a monk-community bench or stool made, it is to be made the right size, with legs eight standard fingerbreadths long, not counting the tenons, and with crossbars.

original: de las lhag par byed du 'jug na bcad nas ltung byed do zhes gnang ba mdzad de /
analyzed: de las lhag par byed du 'jug na bcad nas ltung byed do zhes gnang ba mdzad de /
translated: If he has one made larger than that, it is to be cut down, and he commits an offense entailing confession.’”

original: yul ni mnyan yod /
analyzed: yul ni mnyan yod /
translated: The location for this was in Śrāvastī.🔽The person was Venerable Udāyī.

original: gang zag ni tshe dang ldan pa 'char ka / nyon mongs pa dang nyes pa ni med do //
analyzed: gang zag ni tshe dang ldan pa 'char ka / nyon mongs pa dang nyes pa ni med do //
translated: There was no affliction or offense.

original: de la dge slong gis zhes bya ba ni chos 'di pas so //
analyzed: de la dge slong gis zhes bya ba ni chos 'di pas so //
translated: As for ‘a monk’: one who is a monk in this doctrine.

original: dge 'dun gyi zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyan thos kyi dge 'dun gyi'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyan thos kyi dge 'dun gyi'o //
translated: As for ‘the Sangha’s’: of the Sangha of disciples of the Buddha.

original: khri'am zhes bya ba ni khri nyid do //
analyzed: khri'am zhes bya ba ni khri nyid do //
translated: As for ‘a bench’: a bench.

original: khri'u @27b zhes bya ba yang khri'u nyid do //
analyzed: khri'u @27b zhes bya ba yang khri'u nyid do //
translated: As for ‘a stool’: a stool.

original: byed du 'jug na zhes bya ba bdag nyid kyis sam gzhan no //
analyzed: byed du 'jug na zhes bya ba bdag nyid kyis sam gzhan no //
translated: ‘Has made’: if he does it himself or he has it done.

original: rtsa ba bu gar gzhug pa ma gtogs par zhes bya ba ni gleng gzhi las cha dang ldan pa 'char ka'i lus tshang las shin tu 'das pa yin pas de'i pus mo gnyis ko sko la reg nas /
analyzed: rtsa ba bu gar gzhug pa ma gtogs par zhes bya ba ni gleng gzhi las cha dang ldan pa 'char ka'i lus tshang las shin tu 'das pa yin pas de'i pus mo gnyis ko sko la reg nas /
translated: Except for inserting the root into the hole means that in the nidāna, the body of Udayin, who had a share, was more than a full body.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: de lta bas na rtsa ba bu gar gzhug pa ma gtogs so zhes gsungs pa de lta bu gzhag ste'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na rtsa ba bu gar gzhug pa ma gtogs so zhes gsungs pa de lta bu gzhag ste'o //
translated: “Therefore, except for inserting the root into the hole.”

original: bde bar gshegs pa'i sor brgyad kyi tshad du byed du gzhug par bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa'i sor brgyad kyi tshad du byed du gzhug par bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: One should have it made to the measure of eight of the Sugata’s finger lengths.

original: bde bar gshegs pa zhes bya ba ni ston pa'o //
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa zhes bya ba ni ston pa'o //
translated: The Sugata is the Teacher.

original: de'i sor brgyad gang dag yin pa de dag la ni tshad dang ldan pa'i khru gang ngo //
analyzed: de'i sor brgyad gang dag yin pa de dag la ni tshad dang ldan pa'i khru gang ngo //
translated: Those that are his eight finger lengths are one cubit of a standard measure.

original: de las lhag par byed du 'jug na zhes bya ba ni de las gang ma'o //
analyzed: de las lhag par byed du 'jug na zhes bya ba ni de las gang ma'o //
translated: If one has it made more than that means if one has it made more than that.

original: bcad nas zhes bya ba ni dngos po de bcad nas ltung byed kyi ltung ba bshags par bya'o //
analyzed: bcad nas zhes bya ba ni dngos po de bcad nas ltung byed kyi ltung ba bshags par bya'o //
translated: Having cut it means having cut that thing, one should confess the offense of a pāyantika.

original: ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The rest is as before.

original: de la ltung ba ni ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de la ltung ba ni ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is the offense here?

original: 'dir yang dngos gzhi dang / sbyor ba dang / sbyor ba'i sbyor bas ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa dang / ltung ba med pa dang bslab par bya ba dang / phyir bcos pa rnams kyis 'di'i mtshan nyid shes par bya'o //🔽de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni dge slong gi dge 'dun gyi khri'am khri'u rkang pa bzhi pa la sogs pa gang yang rung ba'i rkang pa gang yang rung ba bu gar gzhug pa'i phyogs ma gtogs par tshad dang ldan pa'i khru gang
analyzed: 'dir yang dngos gzhi dang / sbyor ba dang / sbyor ba'i sbyor bas ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa dang / ltung ba med pa dang bslab par bya ba dang / phyir bcos pa rnams kyis 'di'i mtshan nyid shes par bya'o // de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni dge slong gi dge 'dun gyi khri'am khri'u rkang pa bzhi pa la sogs pa gang yang rung ba'i rkang pa gang yang rung ba bu gar gzhug pa'i phyogs ma gtogs par tshad dang ldan pa'i khru gang
translated: Here, the offense should be understood by way of the basic offense, the preparatory action, the completion of the preparatory action, the non-offenses, the training, and the amendment.

original: las lhag par byed dam byed du 'jug na khri rkang bcos pa'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: las lhag par byed dam byed du 'jug na khri rkang bcos pa'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
translated: Here, the basic offense is as follows: If a monk makes or has another make a bed or chair for the Saṅgha of monks that is more than a cubit in size, except for the legs and the part for the legs, it is the actual basis of the offense of making a bed with legs.

original: ba so la sogs pa la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: ba so la sogs pa la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no fault if it is less than a cubit.

original: lcags la sogs pa la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: lcags la sogs pa la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if it is iron and so forth.

original: rkang bzhi pa la sogs pa la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: rkang bzhi pa la sogs pa la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if it is a four-legged animal and so forth.

original: dge 'dun gyi khri'am khri'u gang yang rung ba la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi khri'am khri'u gang yang rung ba la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if it is a seat or a bench belonging to the Saṅgha.

original: rkang pa bu gar gzhug pa'i phyogs ma gtogs pa la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: rkang pa bu gar gzhug pa'i phyogs ma gtogs pa la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if it is a place other than the foot hole.

original: bde bar gshegs pa'i sor brgyad la ni bde bar gshegs pa nyid kyi khru'i sum cha ste /
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa'i sor brgyad la ni bde bar gshegs pa nyid kyi khru'i sum cha ste /
translated: Eight of the Sugata’s fingerbreadths is one-third of a Sugata cubit.

original: mi tshad dang ldan pa'i khru gang yod pas de las lhag pa la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: mi tshad dang ldan pa'i khru gang yod pas de las lhag pa la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if it is more than that, since one cubit is the measure of a human.

original: rang byed dam gzhan byed du bcug pa lan smad pa med do //
analyzed: rang byed dam gzhan byed du bcug pa lan smad pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if one does it oneself or has someone else do it.

original: 'di'i byed pa po ni dge 'dun gyi khri'am khri'u rkang pa'i tshad nyid dang lhag pa tshol ba'i bsam pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'di'i byed pa po ni dge 'dun gyi khri'am khri'u rkang pa'i tshad nyid dang lhag pa tshol ba'i bsam pa nyid do //
translated: The basis of the offense is seeking a seat or bench for the Saṅgha that is the measure of the leg or more.

original: 'di la yan lag lngas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di la yan lag lngas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
translated: Here, the basis of the offense is fivefold:

original: dge 'dun gyi nyid dang / @28a * //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi nyid dang / @28a * //
translated: The Saṅgha’s seat or bench,

original: khri'am khri'u rung ba dag gi rkang pa nyid dang / bu gar gzhug pa'i phyogs nyid gtogs pa nyid dang / de dag gi tshad khru gang las lhag pa nyid dang / rang gir byed dam gzhan byed du bcug pa nyid do //
analyzed: khri'am khri'u rung ba dag gi rkang pa nyid dang / bu gar gzhug pa'i phyogs nyid gtogs pa nyid dang / de dag gi tshad khru gang las lhag pa nyid dang / rang gir byed dam gzhan byed du bcug pa nyid do //
translated: The action is to put the feet on the bed or bench, to put them on the openings, to make them the right size, to make them more than a cubit, to make them for oneself or to have someone else make them.

original: de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad do //
analyzed: de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad do //
translated: If the parts are incomplete, one commits a fault, as appropriate.

original: sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas te /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas te /
translated: The downfall of preparation is a minor offense.

original: ji srid du khri rkang 'chos pa'i ltung byed kyi sbyor ba brtsams nas /
analyzed: ji srid du khri rkang 'chos pa'i ltung byed kyi sbyor ba brtsams nas /
translated: As long as one has begun the preparation for the downfall of making a bed or bench,

original: dngos gzhi la mthug gi bar du nyes byas so //
analyzed: dngos gzhi la mthug gi bar du nyes byas so //
translated: but has not yet completed the main part, one commits a minor offense.

original: dngos gzhi la sbyor ba tha dad pa ji snyed brtsams par re la nyes byas re re'o //
analyzed: dngos gzhi la sbyor ba tha dad pa ji snyed brtsams par re la nyes byas re re'o //
translated: For each time one begins a different part of the main part, one commits a minor offense.

original: gang zag gi la nyes byas so //
analyzed: gang zag gi la nyes byas so //
translated: If one makes it for oneself, one commits a minor offense.

original: rung ba ma yin pa la nyes byas so //
analyzed: rung ba ma yin pa la nyes byas so //
translated: If one makes an unsuitable one, one commits a minor offense.

original: bcad dam zhes ma dris par ltung ba 'chags pa dang du len pa la nyes byas so //
analyzed: bcad dam zhes ma dris par ltung ba 'chags pa dang du len pa la nyes byas so //
translated: If one confesses a downfall without asking whether the bed or bench has been cut, one commits a minor offense.

original: sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas phra mo ste /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas phra mo ste /
translated: The downfall of preparation for the preparation is a very minor offense.

original: sbyor ba ji snyed pa la sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang de snyed de /
analyzed: sbyor ba ji snyed pa la sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang de snyed de /
translated: The application is the same as the number of applications.

original: sbyor ba nyes byas kyi sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang nyes byas te nyes byas phra mo'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba nyes byas kyi sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang nyes byas te nyes byas phra mo'o //
translated: The application of the application of a minor offense is also a minor offense, a subtle offense.

original: ltung ba med pa ni byas zin pa rnyed pa dang byas zin pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: ltung ba med pa ni byas zin pa rnyed pa dang byas zin pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense for one who has already done it, or for one who has already done it and has no offense.

original: las dang po ba dang / smyos pa dang / sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor ba dag gis nyen pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: las dang po ba dang / smyos pa dang / sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor ba dag gis nyen pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense for a beginner, for one who is insane, for one whose mind is disturbed, or for one who is overwhelmed by pain.

original: bslab par bya ba ni dge slong gis yul thams cad la gnas skabs thams cad du khri rkang 'chos pa'i ltung byed du 'gyur ba rnam pa thams cad du mi bsten par bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: bslab par bya ba ni dge slong gis yul thams cad la gnas skabs thams cad du khri rkang 'chos pa'i ltung byed du 'gyur ba rnam pa thams cad du mi bsten par bslab par bya'o //
translated: The training is that a monk should train in not using in any way a bedstead with legs that are the right size in all respects.

original: rkang pa dma' ba dang ldan pa'i khri la nyal bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: rkang pa dma' ba dang ldan pa'i khri la nyal bar mi bya'o //
translated: One should not sleep on a bed with low legs.

original: dge slong mchil lham yod pas mal dang 'brel ba'i khri'i nye 'khor gyi phyogs su rkang pa bkru bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong mchil lham yod pas mal dang 'brel ba'i khri'i nye 'khor gyi phyogs su rkang pa bkru bar mi bya'o //
translated: A monk who has shoes should not wash his feet in the vicinity of a bed connected to a bedstead.

original: mchil lham med pas ni mgo logs dang / rkang pa logs su rkang pa bkru bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: mchil lham med pas ni mgo logs dang / rkang pa logs su rkang pa bkru bar mi bya'o //
translated: Without shoes, one should not wash one’s feet in a place other than the head or the feet.

original: g-yas g-yon gyi phyogs su mi bya'o //🔽mal stan mthon po dang / mal stan chen po la 'dug pa'am /
analyzed: g-yas g-yon gyi phyogs su mi bya'o // mal stan mthon po dang / mal stan chen po la 'dug pa'am /
translated: One should not do it on the right or left side.🔽One should not sit or lie down on a high or large bed.

original: nyal bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: nyal bar mi bya'o //
translated: One should not sit or lie down on a couch with arms or on a multi-colored couch.

original: khyim gzhan du gzhan med na de dag 'dug par mi bya'i nyal bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: khyim gzhan du gzhan med na de dag 'dug par mi bya'i nyal bar mi bya'o //
translated: If there is no other seat in a house, one may sit on such a couch, but not lie down.

original: rkang rten dang bcas pa'i khri la mal bca' bar bya'o //
analyzed: rkang rten dang bcas pa'i khri la mal bca' bar bya'o //
translated: One should make a bed on a couch with legs.

original: khri brtsegs ma'i steng du 'dug par mi bya'o //
analyzed: khri brtsegs ma'i steng du 'dug par mi bya'o //
translated: One should not sit on a couch with a canopy.

original: gang gi mdun du 'chags par byed pa des khyed kyis dngos po de bcad dam zhes dri bar bya'o //
analyzed: gang gi mdun du 'chags par byed pa des khyed kyis dngos po de bcad dam zhes dri bar bya'o //
translated: The person in front of whom one confesses should ask, “Have you given up that thing?”

original: bcad pa nyid ma dris par 'chags pa blang bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: bcad pa nyid ma dris par 'chags pa blang bar mi bya'o //
translated: Without asking whether it has been given up, one should not accept the confession.

original: ma bcad par 'chags na ltung ba de bshags pa ma yin pas yang bshags @28b par bya'o //
analyzed: ma bcad par 'chags na ltung ba de bshags pa ma yin pas yang bshags @28b par bya'o //
translated: If one confesses without having given it up, that downfall is not confessed and must be confessed again.

original: phyir bcos pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: phyir bcos pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The amendment is the same as before.

original: khri rkang 'chos pa'i ltung byed de brgyad cu lnga pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: khri rkang 'chos pa'i ltung byed de brgyad cu lnga pa bshad zin to /
translated: This was the explanation of the eighty-fifth downfall.

original: // / shing bal gyis gos par byas pa'i ltung byed kyi gleng gzhi ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' rab na bzhugs so ;
analyzed: // / shing bal gyis gos par byas pa'i ltung byed kyi gleng gzhi ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' rab na bzhugs so ;
translated: The introduction to the downfall of using cotton wool: The Lord Buddha dwelt in Śrāvastī, in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍada’s park.

original: / nye dga' gsar bu yin pas de'i khri thob po //
analyzed: / nye dga' gsar bu yin pas de'i khri thob po //
translated: Upasena was a young monk and so he received the best seat.

original: khyogs ches rgan pas phrogs shing gnas mal bsgo ba'i dus la yang bab nas des bsams pa /
analyzed: khyogs ches rgan pas phrogs shing gnas mal bsgo ba'i dus la yang bab nas des bsams pa /
translated: The old monk Udayin took it away from him, and the time for the instruction of the sleeping quarters had arrived. He thought,

original: gang gis bdag gi khri mi 'phrogs pa'i thabs de lta bu ci yod snyam pa dang / des bya ba 'ga' zhig gi phyir shing bal dag kyang blangs nas de la blo skyes pa /
analyzed: gang gis bdag gi khri mi 'phrogs pa'i thabs de lta bu ci yod snyam pa dang / des bya ba 'ga' zhig gi phyir shing bal dag kyang blangs nas de la blo skyes pa /
translated: “What is the way to prevent my seat from being taken away?” He took some cotton wool for some purpose and the idea came to him,

original: shing bal gyis bdal te bzhag go snyam nas /
analyzed: shing bal gyis bdal te bzhag go snyam nas /
translated: “I will spread it out and sleep on it.”

original: des khri'i steng du shing bal bdal te bzhag go //
analyzed: des khri'i steng du shing bal bdal te bzhag go //
translated: He spread out the cotton wool on the seat and slept on it.

original: ci tsam na dge slong ches rgan pa zhig 'ongs nas des smras pa tshe dang ldan pa 'di su'i /
analyzed: ci tsam na dge slong ches rgan pa zhig 'ongs nas des smras pa tshe dang ldan pa 'di su'i /
translated: Later, an elder monk came and said, “Venerables, whose cotton is this?”

original: nye dgas smras pa /
analyzed: nye dgas smras pa /
translated: Upasena said,

original: kho bo'i shing bal lo //
analyzed: kho bo'i shing bal lo //
translated: “It’s mine.”

original: de na dge slong zhig 'dug pa des smras pa /
analyzed: de na dge slong zhig 'dug pa des smras pa /
translated: A monk who was there said,

original: nye dga' ji skad zer ba de bzhin te /
analyzed: nye dga' ji skad zer ba de bzhin te /
translated: “Upasena, it’s just as you say.

original: shing bal ni nye dga'i yin no //
analyzed: shing bal ni nye dga'i yin no //
translated: This cotton is yours.

original: 'di ltar khri ni dge 'dun gyi yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar khri ni dge 'dun gyi yin no //
translated: But this bed belongs to the saṅgha.”

original: de skad smras pa dang / nye dga' khos nas des shing bal khyer te khri de'i steng du shing ba la cung zad bdal te bzhag go //
analyzed: de skad smras pa dang / nye dga' khos nas des shing bal khyer te khri de'i steng du shing ba la cung zad bdal te bzhag go //
translated: When he said this, Upasena took the cotton and spread a little of it on the bed.

original: dge slong des so sor ma brtags pa nyid du der nyal nas mtshan mo nam nangs te langs pa dang / gos thams cad shing bal gyis skya bor gyur nas dge slong rnams kyis de la smras pa /
analyzed: dge slong des so sor ma brtags pa nyid du der nyal nas mtshan mo nam nangs te langs pa dang / gos thams cad shing bal gyis skya bor gyur nas dge slong rnams kyis de la smras pa /
translated: The monk lay down without examining the bed, and when morning came, he got up. All his robes were stained with cotton fluff. The monks said to him,

original: ci khyod g-yul gyi gzhir nyal lam /
analyzed: ci khyod g-yul gyi gzhir nyal lam /
translated: “Did you sleep in a battlefield?”

original: des ji ltar gyur pa brjod pa dang / dge slong don nyung ngu dag ci'i phyir dge slong dag dge 'dun gyi khri'am khri'u la shing bal bdal te 'jog par byed ces smod par byed /
analyzed: des ji ltar gyur pa brjod pa dang / dge slong don nyung ngu dag ci'i phyir dge slong dag dge 'dun gyi khri'am khri'u la shing bal bdal te 'jog par byed ces smod par byed /
translated: “Why do the monks leave woolen cloth on the seats and benches of the saṅgha?”

original: phyar kha gtong bar byed /🔽kha zer bar byed pa'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //
analyzed: phyar kha gtong bar byed / kha zer bar byed pa'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //
translated: They spread it about,🔽saying, “How could the monks do such a thing?”🔽The monks reported this matter to the Blessed One.🔽Then the Blessed One, having given an admonition on this topic, gathered the saṅgha of monks and questioned the venerable Upāli:

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byung ba 'di dang / gleng gzhi 'di dang / skabs 'di la dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdu ba mdzad de /🔽nye dga' la rmas nas /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byung ba 'di dang / gleng gzhi 'di dang / skabs 'di la dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdu ba mdzad de / nye dga' la rmas nas /
translated: “Is it true, Upāli, that the monks are doing this?”

original: dge sbyong gi tshul ma yin pa /🔽rjes su mthun pa ma yin pa /🔽rung ba ma yin pa /
analyzed: dge sbyong gi tshul ma yin pa / rjes su mthun pa ma yin pa / rung ba ma yin pa /
translated: “It is not the way of the virtuous.🔽It is not suitable.🔽It is not proper.

original: tshul dang mthun pa ma yin pa /
analyzed: tshul dang mthun pa ma yin pa /
translated: It is not conducive to self-restraint.🔽It is not worthy of a renunciant. It is not allowable.

original: de ni rab tu byung bas bya ba ma yin no zhes rnam grangs du mar rnam par smad de /
analyzed: de ni rab tu byung bas bya ba ma yin no zhes rnam grangs du mar rnam par smad de /
translated: It is not to be done.”

original: bslab pa bca' ba'i phan yon bcu yang dag @29a * //
analyzed: bslab pa bca' ba'i phan yon bcu yang dag @29a * //
translated: The Blessed One rebuked them in many ways and, having given a talk on the Dharma, he addressed the monks:

original: par gzigs pas nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /
analyzed: par gzigs pas nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /
translated: The Blessed One saw this and said, “My disciples should recite this rule for training:

original: yang dge slong gang dge 'dun gyi khri'am khri'u la shing ba la bad la lam bdal du 'jug na bsdus nas ltung byed do zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
analyzed: yang dge slong gang dge 'dun gyi khri'am khri'u la shing ba la bad la lam bdal du 'jug na bsdus nas ltung byed do zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
translated: ‘If a monk spreads a woolen spread on a seat or bench belonging to the Sangha, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”

original: yul ni mnyan yod ;
analyzed: yul ni mnyan yod ;
translated: The location for this rule is in Śrāvastī.

original: / gang zag ni nye dga'/
analyzed: / gang zag ni nye dga'/
translated: The individual is the monk Udayin.

original: nyon mongs pa ni zhi gu /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ni zhi gu /
translated: The affliction is any of the three.

original: nyes pa ni dge 'dun gyi gnas mal la shing bal bdal ba'o //
analyzed: nyes pa ni dge 'dun gyi gnas mal la shing bal bdal ba'o //
translated: The action is spreading a woolen spread on a seat or bench belonging to the Sangha.

original: de la yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni sh'akya'i bu nye dga' 'am gzhan yang de lta bu gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni sh'akya'i bu nye dga' 'am gzhan yang de lta bu gang yin pa'o //
translated: As for “If a monk,” a monk is the Śākya Udayin or any other monk like him.

original: dge 'dun gyi zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyan thos kyi dge 'dun gyi'o //🔽khri'am zhes bya ba ni khri nyid do //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyan thos kyi dge 'dun gyi'o // khri'am zhes bya ba ni khri nyid do //
translated: As for “belonging to the Sangha,” it belongs to the Sangha of disciples of the Buddha.

original: khri'u la zhes bya ba yang khri'u nyid do //
analyzed: khri'u la zhes bya ba yang khri'u nyid do //
translated: As for “a seat or bench,” it is a bench or a seat.

original: shing bal zhes bya ba ni lnga po shal ma li'i dang / aarka'i dang / ka shi dang / sbra ba'i dang / ae ra ka'i shing bal dag las gang yang rung ba'o //
analyzed: shing bal zhes bya ba ni lnga po shal ma li'i dang / aarka'i dang / ka shi dang / sbra ba'i dang / ae ra ka'i shing bal dag las gang yang rung ba'o //
translated: Cotton” means any of the five kinds of cotton: silk-cotton, cotton-tree cotton, kaśa cotton, hemp, and flax.

original: bdal lam zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyis so //
analyzed: bdal lam zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyis so //
translated: “Spun” means by oneself.

original: bdal du 'jug na zhes bya ba ni gzhan no //
analyzed: bdal du 'jug na zhes bya ba ni gzhan no //
translated: “To spin” means to have another do it.

original: bsdus nas zhes bya ba ni dngos po de bsdus nas ltung byed kyi ltung ba de bshags par bya'o //
analyzed: bsdus nas zhes bya ba ni dngos po de bsdus nas ltung byed kyi ltung ba de bshags par bya'o //
translated: “Having collected” means having collected that thing, one should confess the offense of a downfall.

original: ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: “A downfall” is as explained above.

original: de la ltung bar ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de la ltung bar ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How does one come to have a downfall?

original: 'dir yang dngos gzhi dang / sbyor ba dang / sbyor ba'i sbyor bas ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa dang / ltung ba med pa dang / bslab par bya ba dang / phyir bcos pa rnams kyis 'di'i mtshan nyid shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang dngos gzhi dang / sbyor ba dang / sbyor ba'i sbyor bas ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa dang / ltung ba med pa dang / bslab par bya ba dang / phyir bcos pa rnams kyis 'di'i mtshan nyid shes par bya'o //
translated: Here, one should understand the characteristics of this downfall through the basic scenario, the preparatory action, the conclusion of the preparatory action, the downfall itself, the absence of a downfall, the training, and the restoration.

original: de la 'dir yang dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni dge slong gi dge 'dun gyi khri'am khri'u dag la gos dang lus ma rung bar 'gyur ba'i shing bal rnam pa lnga'o //
analyzed: de la 'dir yang dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni dge slong gi dge 'dun gyi khri'am khri'u dag la gos dang lus ma rung bar 'gyur ba'i shing bal rnam pa lnga'o //
translated: Here, the actual downfall is defined as follows: If a monk spreads out on the seats or benches of the community of monks any of the five types of cotton wool, his robes and body will be defiled.

original: shal ma li'am /🔽aarka'i 'am / ka shi'am /
analyzed: shal ma li'am / aarka'i 'am / ka shi'am /
translated: Cotton wool from the silk-cotton tree,🔽from the arjaka plant,🔽from the kaśa plant,

original: sbra ba'i 'am /
analyzed: sbra ba'i 'am /
translated: or from the arjaka plant.

original: aa ra ka'i shing bal dag las gang yang rung ba rang ngam bskos pas bdal na shing bal gyis gos par byas pa'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: aa ra ka'i shing bal dag las gang yang rung ba rang ngam bskos pas bdal na shing bal gyis gos par byas pa'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
translated: If he spreads out any of these on his own or has someone else spread them out, he commits an actual downfall of the monks’ code.

original: dge 'dun gyi khri'am khri'u 'am gnas mal gang yang rung ba la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi khri'am khri'u 'am gnas mal gang yang rung ba la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if the cotton wool is spread out on a seat or bench of the community of monks or on any other bedding.

original: shing bal rnam pa lnga po gang yang rung ba la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: shing bal rnam pa lnga po gang yang rung ba la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if any of the five types of cotton wool is used.

original: de dag ci tsam gyis gos dang lus ma rung bar 'gyur ba la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: de dag ci tsam gyis gos dang lus ma rung bar 'gyur ba la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if the cotton wool is used in a way that does not defile the robes and body.

original: rang ngam bskos pas bdal ba la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: rang ngam bskos pas bdal ba la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if the cotton wool is spread out on one’s own or by someone else.

original: 'di'i byed pa po ni dge 'dun gyi khri'am khri'u la sogs pa gnas mal gang yang rung ba nyid dang / @29b lus dang gos ma rung bar 'gyur ba'i shing bal gang yang rung ba nyid do //
analyzed: 'di'i byed pa po ni dge 'dun gyi khri'am khri'u la sogs pa gnas mal gang yang rung ba nyid dang / @29b lus dang gos ma rung bar 'gyur ba'i shing bal gang yang rung ba nyid do //
translated: The agent of this is any of the beds of the Saṅgha, such as a bed or a small bed, and any cotton wool that is suitable for making the body and robes unsuitable.

original: 'di la yan lag lngas dngos gzhal ltung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di la yan lag lngas dngos gzhal ltung bar 'gyur te /
translated: Here, the basis is the five limbs:

original: dge 'dun gyis gnas mal rung ba gang yang rung ba nyid dang / shing bal gang yang rung ba nyid dang / lus dang gos ma rung bar 'gyur ba nyid dang / zhi gu'i bsam pa nyid dang / rang ngam bskos pas bdal ba nyid do //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyis gnas mal rung ba gang yang rung ba nyid dang / shing bal gang yang rung ba nyid dang / lus dang gos ma rung bar 'gyur ba nyid dang / zhi gu'i bsam pa nyid dang / rang ngam bskos pas bdal ba nyid do //
translated: any of the beds of the Saṅgha that are suitable, any cotton wool, making the body and robes unsuitable, the intention of the monk, and spreading it by himself or by one appointed.

original: de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad pa med do //
analyzed: de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad pa med do //
translated: If any of these limbs is incomplete, then there is no downfall, as appropriate.

original: sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas te /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas te /
translated: The downfall of preparation is a minor offense.

original: ji srid du shing bal gyis gos par byas pa'i ltung byed kyi sbyor ba la brtsams nas dngos gzhi la ma thug gi bar du nyes byas so //
analyzed: ji srid du shing bal gyis gos par byas pa'i ltung byed kyi sbyor ba la brtsams nas dngos gzhi la ma thug gi bar du nyes byas so //
translated: As long as one begins the preparation for the offense of a downfall that is caused by cotton wool, but does not reach the actual basis, it is a minor offense.

original: dngos gzhi la sbyor ba tha dad pa ji snyed brtsams pa re re la nyes byas re re'o //
analyzed: dngos gzhi la sbyor ba tha dad pa ji snyed brtsams pa re re la nyes byas re re'o //
translated: For the actual basis, there is one offense of wrong conduct for each of the various preparations that are undertaken.

original: gang zag gi la nyes byas so //
analyzed: gang zag gi la nyes byas so //
translated: There is an offense of wrong conduct for the person.

original: lus dang gos la mi gnod pa la nyes byas so //
analyzed: lus dang gos la mi gnod pa la nyes byas so //
translated: There is an offense of wrong conduct for not harming the body or the clothes.

original: bsdus sam zhes ma dris par ltung ba 'chags pa dang du len na nyes byas so //
analyzed: bsdus sam zhes ma dris par ltung ba 'chags pa dang du len na nyes byas so //
translated: There is an offense of wrong conduct for accepting the confession of a downfall without asking, “Are you pure?”

original: sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas phra mo ste /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas phra mo ste /
translated: The downfall of preparation is a minor offense.🔽There are as many preparations as there are preparations for the downfall.

original: sbyor ba ji snyed pa la sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang de snyed de /
analyzed: sbyor ba ji snyed pa la sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang de snyed de /
translated: The preparation for the preparation is also as many as the preparations.

original: sbyor ba nyes byas kyi sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'ang nyes byas te nyes byas phra mo'o //🔽ltung ba med pa ni lus dang gos la mi gnod pa dang / zhi gu'i bsam pa med pa nyid la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: sbyor ba nyes byas kyi sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'ang nyes byas te nyes byas phra mo'o // ltung ba med pa ni lus dang gos la mi gnod pa dang / zhi gu'i bsam pa med pa nyid la ltung ba med do //
translated: The preparation for the minor offense is also a minor offense.🔽There is no downfall for not harming the body or the clothes, and for not having the intention to be lazy.

original: las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang / sems 'khrugs pa dang ; tshor ba dag gis nyen pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang / sems 'khrugs pa dang ; tshor ba dag gis nyen pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no downfall for a beginner, for one who is insane, for one who is deranged, and for one who is overwhelmed by pain.

original: bslab par bya ba ni dge slong gis yul thams cad la gnas skabs thams cad du shing bal gyis gos par byed pa'i ltung byed du 'gyur ba rnam pa thams cad mi bsten par bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: bslab par bya ba ni dge slong gis yul thams cad la gnas skabs thams cad du shing bal gyis gos par byed pa'i ltung byed du 'gyur ba rnam pa thams cad mi bsten par bslab par bya'o //
translated: The training rule is that a fully ordained monk should train in not using cotton wool to make a mattress for himself in any place and at any time, as this would constitute a downfall.

original: gang gis mdun du 'chags par byed pa des khyod kyis dngos po bsdus sam zhes dri bar bya'o //🔽bsdus pa nyid ma dris par 'chags pa blang bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: gang gis mdun du 'chags par byed pa des khyod kyis dngos po bsdus sam zhes dri bar bya'o // bsdus pa nyid ma dris par 'chags pa blang bar mi bya'o //
translated: The monk who confesses should be asked, “Have you gathered the materials?”🔽If he has not asked about gathering the materials, he should not accept the confession.

original: ma bsdus par 'chags na ltung bde bshags pa ma yin pas yang bshags par bya'o //
analyzed: ma bsdus par 'chags na ltung bde bshags pa ma yin pas yang bshags par bya'o //
translated: If he confesses without having gathered the materials, the confession is not valid and he must confess again.

original: phyir bcos pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: phyir bcos pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The amendment is the same as before.

original: shing bal gyis gos par byas pa'i ltung byed de brgyad cu drug pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: shing bal gyis gos par byas pa'i ltung byed de brgyad cu drug pa bshad zin to /
translated: This was the explanation of the eighty-sixth downfall: using cotton wool.

original: // / gding ba las gyur pa'i ltung byed kyi gleng gzhi ni bcas pa dang / gnang ba'i dbang gis rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: // / gding ba las gyur pa'i ltung byed kyi gleng gzhi ni bcas pa dang / gnang ba'i dbang gis rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The introduction to the downfalls related to the rainy-season retreat is twofold: the rules and the exceptions.

original: bcas pa'i gleng gzhi ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
analyzed: bcas pa'i gleng gzhi ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
translated: The introduction to the rules: The Blessed Buddha was staying in Śrāvastī, in Jeta’s Grove, in Anāthapiṇḍada’s park.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis @30a * //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis @30a * //
translated: The Blessed One

original: dge slong gi gding ba byed du gzhug go zhes bka' stsal nas /
analyzed: dge slong gi gding ba byed du gzhug go zhes bka' stsal nas /
translated: said, “Monks, you should make a sitting mat.”🔽The monks made them exceeding the right size, and monks who had few desires complained and criticized them,🔽“How can the monks make a sitting mat exceeding the right size, when the Blessed One has said, ‘Monks, you should make a sitting mat’?”🔽They reported the matter to the Blessed One.

original: dge slong dag tshad las ha cang lhag par byed du 'jug nas dge slong don nyung du dag bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong gis gding ba byed du gzhug go zhes bka' stsal nas /
analyzed: dge slong dag tshad las ha cang lhag par byed du 'jug nas dge slong don nyung du dag bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong gis gding ba byed du gzhug go zhes bka' stsal nas /
translated: The Blessed One said, “Monks, you should not make a sitting mat exceeding the right size.🔽If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”🔽The monks made them less than the right size, and monks who had few desires complained and criticized them,

original: ci'i phyir dge slong dag tshad las ha cang lhag par byed du 'jug ce smod par byed /
analyzed: ci'i phyir dge slong dag tshad las ha cang lhag par byed du 'jug ce smod par byed /
translated: “How can the monks make a sitting mat less than the right size, when the Blessed One has said, ‘Monks, you should make a sitting mat’?”🔽They reported the matter to the Blessed One.🔽The Blessed One said, “Monks, you should not make a sitting mat less than the right size.

original: phyar kha gtong bar byed /
analyzed: phyar kha gtong bar byed /
translated: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”🔽The monks did not know the right size.🔽They reported the matter to the Blessed One.

original: kha zer bar byed pa'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //
analyzed: kha zer bar byed pa'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //
translated: The Blessed One said, “The right size for a sitting mat is this: four standard handspans long and two wide.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byung ba 'di dang / gling gzhi 'di dang / skabs 'di la dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdu ba mdzad de /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byung ba 'di dang / gling gzhi 'di dang / skabs 'di la dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdu ba mdzad de /
translated: Then the Blessed One, in this situation, in this place, and on this occasion, gathered the saṅgha of monks.

original: dge slong dag la rmas nas /
analyzed: dge slong dag la rmas nas /
translated: Having asked the monks,

original: 'dod pa che ba dang / chog mi shes pa dang / gso dka' ba dang / dgang dka' ba rnam par smad cing /
analyzed: 'dod pa che ba dang / chog mi shes pa dang / gso dka' ba dang / dgang dka' ba rnam par smad cing /
translated: he condemned excessive desire, discontent, difficulty in maintaining, and difficulty in filling,

original: 'dod pa chung ba dang / chog shes pa dang / gso sla ba dang / dgang sla ba dang / phri ba dang / yo byad bsnyung ba dang / sbyangs pa'i yon tan dang / mdzes pa dang / drod rig pa nyid kyi bsngags pa brjod de /
analyzed: 'dod pa chung ba dang / chog shes pa dang / gso sla ba dang / dgang sla ba dang / phri ba dang / yo byad bsnyung ba dang / sbyangs pa'i yon tan dang / mdzes pa dang / drod rig pa nyid kyi bsngags pa brjod de /
translated: and praised having few desires, being content, being easy to maintain, being easy to fill, being austere, having few duties, being pure, and being warm-hearted.

original: bslab pa bca' ba'i phan yon bcu yang dag par gzigs pas nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /
analyzed: bslab pa bca' ba'i phan yon bcu yang dag par gzigs pas nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /
translated: Seeing the ten benefits of establishing the training rules, he said, “Therefore, the training rule should be recited like this:

original: dge slong gi gding ba byed du 'jug na tshad shin tu byed du chug shig / de la gding ba'i tshad ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: dge slong gi gding ba byed du 'jug na tshad shin tu byed du chug shig / de la gding ba'i tshad ni 'di yin te /
translated: ‘When a monk is having a sitting mat made, he should have it made the right size. This is the right size for a sitting mat:

original: srid du bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho'i mtho do zheng du mtho phyed dang do'o //
analyzed: srid du bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho'i mtho do zheng du mtho phyed dang do'o //
translated: In length it is one and a half of the Sugata's cubits, and in width it is three quarters of a cubit.

original: de las lhag par byed du 'jug na bcad nas ltung byed do zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
analyzed: de las lhag par byed du 'jug na bcad nas ltung byed do zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
translated: If one has it made larger than that, one commits an offense with acknowledgment.

original: yul ni mnyan yod /
analyzed: yul ni mnyan yod /
translated: The place is Śrāvastī.🔽The person is a large number of monks.

original: gang zag ni dge slong rab tu mang po dag / nyon mongs pa ni tshad mi shes pa /
analyzed: gang zag ni dge slong rab tu mang po dag / nyon mongs pa ni tshad mi shes pa /
translated: The affliction is any of the three.

original: nyes pa ni gding ba tshad las ha cang lhag par byed du 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: nyes pa ni gding ba tshad las ha cang lhag par byed du 'jug pa'o //
translated: The offense is having a mat made that exceeds the proper size.

original: gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
analyzed: gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
translated: The background story of the allowance is as follows: The Blessed Buddha was staying in Śrāvastī, in Jeta Grove, in the park of Anāthapiṇḍada.

original: tshe dang ldan pa 'char ka tshad las ha cang yang lhag pas de'i gding ba des mi chog nas des gnas mal srung ba'i phyir rkang pa'i mtha' logs su lo ma'i chun po dag bzhag go //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa 'char ka tshad las ha cang yang lhag pas de'i gding ba des mi chog nas des gnas mal srung ba'i phyir rkang pa'i mtha' logs su lo ma'i chun po dag bzhag go //
translated: The venerable Udayī had a mat that was too small, since it exceeded the proper size. He placed bundles of leaves at the edge of the mat to protect the bedding.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das 'tsho zhing bzhugs la gson cing gzhes pa rnams kyi chos nyid ni gdul bar gyur pa'i skye bo la rjes su thugs brtse bas dus dang dus su sems can dmyal bar rgyur gshegs pa dang / dud 'gror rgyu @30b ba dang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das 'tsho zhing bzhugs la gson cing gzhes pa rnams kyi chos nyid ni gdul bar gyur pa'i skye bo la rjes su thugs brtse bas dus dang dus su sems can dmyal bar rgyur gshegs pa dang / dud 'gror rgyu @30b ba dang /
translated: The nature of the Blessed Buddhas who are alive, living, and present is that, out of compassion for those who are ready to be trained, they go from time to time to the hells, to the animal realm,

original: yi dags su rgyu ba dang / lhar rgyu ba dang / ljongs rgyu ba dang / chu grang rgyu ba dang / ri rgyu ba dang / dur khrod rgyu ba dang / gtsug lag khang rgyur gshegs pas don 'dir ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gtsug lag khang rgyur gshegs par bzhed nas bcom ldan 'das che dang ldan pa 'char ka'i gtsug lag khang gal bder gshegs so //
analyzed: yi dags su rgyu ba dang / lhar rgyu ba dang / ljongs rgyu ba dang / chu grang rgyu ba dang / ri rgyu ba dang / dur khrod rgyu ba dang / gtsug lag khang rgyur gshegs pas don 'dir ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gtsug lag khang rgyur gshegs par bzhed nas bcom ldan 'das che dang ldan pa 'char ka'i gtsug lag khang gal bder gshegs so //
translated: to the world of Yama, to the gods, to the countryside, to the cool waters, to the mountains, to the charnel grounds, and to the monasteries. In this case, the Blessed Buddha, wishing to go to the monastery, went to the monastery of the venerable Udayin.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa 'char ka'i rkang pa'i mtha' logs su lo ma'i chun po dag bzhag pa gzigs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa 'char ka'i rkang pa'i mtha' logs su lo ma'i chun po dag bzhag pa gzigs so //
translated: The Blessed One saw that a bundle of leaves had been placed at the foot of the venerable Udayin’s bed.

original: gzigs nas kyang tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: gzigs nas kyang tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo la bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One saw this and asked the venerable Ānanda,

original: kun dga' bo 'di su'i mal /
analyzed: kun dga' bo 'di su'i mal /
translated: “Ānanda, whose bed is this?”

original: btsun pa tshe dang ldan pa 'char ka'i mal la lags so //
analyzed: btsun pa tshe dang ldan pa 'char ka'i mal la lags so //
translated: “Venerable, it is the bed of the venerable Udayin.”🔽“Well then, why are there bundles of leaves at the foot of the bed?”

original: 'o na ci'i phyir rkang pa'i mtha' logs su lo ma'i chun po dag bzhag / btsun pa bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong gi gding ba byed du 'jug na tshad bzhin du byed du chug shig / de la gding ba'i tshad ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'o na ci'i phyir rkang pa'i mtha' logs su lo ma'i chun po dag bzhag / btsun pa bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong gi gding ba byed du 'jug na tshad bzhin du byed du chug shig / de la gding ba'i tshad ni 'di yin te /
translated: “Venerable, the Blessed One has instructed the monks to make bedding, but they should make it to the proper size. The proper size for bedding is as follows:

original: srid du bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho'i mtho do //
analyzed: srid du bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho'i mtho do //
translated: In length it is the height of the Tathāgata plus one cubit.

original: zheng du mtho phyed dang do //
analyzed: zheng du mtho phyed dang do //
translated: In width it is half the height of the Tathāgata plus one cubit.🔽If you make it larger than that, it is to be cut down and a pāyattika offense is to be confessed.”

original: de las lhag par byed du 'jug na bcad nas ltung byed do zhes 'dul ba la nyan thos rnams kyis bslab pa'i gzhi de ltar bca' ba mdzad nas tshe dang ldan pa 'char ka tshad las ha cang lhag pas de'i gding ba des 'tshal nas des gnas mal
analyzed: de las lhag par byed du 'jug na bcad nas ltung byed do zhes 'dul ba la nyan thos rnams kyis bslab pa'i gzhi de ltar bca' ba mdzad nas tshe dang ldan pa 'char ka tshad las ha cang lhag pas de'i gding ba des 'tshal nas des gnas mal
translated: The venerable Udayin made his bedding larger than the proper size. He used it and then put it away.

original: bsrung ba'i slad du sug pa'i mtha' logs su lo ma'i chun po dag bzhag go //
analyzed: bsrung ba'i slad du sug pa'i mtha' logs su lo ma'i chun po dag bzhag go //
translated: In order to protect it, they placed bundles of leaves at the edges of the beds.🔽“Ānanda, therefore, the beds should be one cubit wide.

original: kun dga' bo de lta bas na srid du mtho gang gis sring sa shig / de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis bslab pa 'dod pa dang / bslab pa la gus pa dang / bslab pa la yo byad bsnyungs pa'i bsngags pa brjod nas dge slong rnams la de dang mthun pa dang /

translated: Then the Blessed One, having praised the desire for training, respect for training, and the austerity of training, spoke in a way that accorded with,

analyzed: de'i shas che ba dang / de dang 'tsham pa'i chos dang ldan pa'i bka' mchid mdzad nas /

analyzed: nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /

analyzed: zheng du mtho phyed dang do //
translated: in width, one cubit and four fingers.

original: srid du mtho gang gis srings shig / de las lhag par byas sam byed du 'jug na bcad nas ltung byed do zhes gnang ba mdzad de /🔽yul @31a * //
