translated: The rest is as before.

original: de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na 'dir yang dngos gzhi dang / sbyor ba dang / sbyor ba'i sbyor bas ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa dang / ltung ba med pa dang / bslab par bya ba dang / phyir bcos pa rnams kyis 'di'i mtshan nyid shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na 'dir yang dngos gzhi dang / sbyor ba dang / sbyor ba'i sbyor bas ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa dang / ltung ba med pa dang / bslab par bya ba dang / phyir bcos pa rnams kyis 'di'i mtshan nyid shes par bya'o //
translated: How does one come to have a downfall? Here one should understand the characteristics of downfalls through the presentation of the actual basis, the preparatory stage, and the preparation for the preparation, as well as through the absence of downfalls, the trainings, and the restoration of downfalls.

original: de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni dge slong gis gding ba srid du khru gsum /
analyzed: de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni dge slong gis gding ba srid du khru gsum /
translated: The actual basis of a downfall is as follows: A monk is not allowed to make a mat that exceeds three cubits in length

original: zheng du khru do dang sor drug pa des mi chog na srid du khru phyed dang do skyed de khru phyed dang lnga par bya'o zhes @31b gsungs las /
analyzed: zheng du khru do dang sor drug pa des mi chog na srid du khru phyed dang do skyed de khru phyed dang lnga par bya'o zhes @31b gsungs las /
translated: and two cubits and six finger-widths in width. If he needs a larger one, he may make one that is half a cubit and five finger-widths longer.

original: chu zheng gang yang rung bar tshad las lhag par byed dam byed du 'jug na gding ba las gyur pa'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chu zheng gang yang rung bar tshad las lhag par byed dam byed du 'jug na gding ba las gyur pa'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
translated: If he makes one or has one made that exceeds these measurements in either length or width, he commits an actual downfall of the downfalls related to the robes.

original: gding ba'i rgyu gdags su rung ba la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: gding ba'i rgyu gdags su rung ba la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no fault in making a mat from a suitable material for a mat.

original: gding ba'i srid kyi tshad ni bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho do las mtho gang gis skyed bar gnang ste /
analyzed: gding ba'i srid kyi tshad ni bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho do las mtho gang gis skyed bar gnang ste /
translated: The measure of the length of the mat is the length of the Tathagata, which is one cubit and four finger-widths.

original: bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho gang la ni tshad dang ldan pa'i khru phyed dang do yod pas des na gding ba'i srid kyi tshad ni tshad dang ldan pa'i khru phyed dang lnga'o //
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho gang la ni tshad dang ldan pa'i khru phyed dang do yod pas des na gding ba'i srid kyi tshad ni tshad dang ldan pa'i khru phyed dang lnga'o //
translated: Since the cubit of the Tathagata is one cubit and four finger-widths, the measure of the length of the mat is five cubits.

original: zheng gi tshad ni bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho phyed dang do ste /
analyzed: zheng gi tshad ni bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho phyed dang do ste /
translated: The measure of the width is half the length of the Tathagata,

original: de la ni tshad dang ldan pa'i khru do dang sor drug go //
analyzed: de la ni tshad dang ldan pa'i khru do dang sor drug go //
translated: which is one cubit and two finger-widths.

original: chu zheng gi tshad ni gang yang rung bde las lhag par byed na na smad pa med do //
analyzed: chu zheng gi tshad ni gang yang rung bde las lhag par byed na na smad pa med do //
translated: If one makes it larger than that, there is no fault.

original: byed dam byed du 'jug pa lan smad pa med do //
analyzed: byed dam byed du 'jug pa lan smad pa med do //
translated: There is no fault if one makes it or has it made.

original: 'di'i byed pa po ni rang gi gding ba nyid dang / tshad las lhag pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'di'i byed pa po ni rang gi gding ba nyid dang / tshad las lhag pa nyid do //
translated: The agent of this is the one who makes his own mat and makes it larger than the measure.

original: 'di la yan lag lngas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di la yan lag lngas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
translated: Here, there are five branches that constitute the actual downfall.

original: rang gi nyid dang / gding ba nyid dang / tshad las lhag ba nyid dang / rung ba nyid dang / rang ngam bskos pas byas pa nyid do //
analyzed: rang gi nyid dang / gding ba nyid dang / tshad las lhag ba nyid dang / rung ba nyid dang / rang ngam bskos pas byas pa nyid do //
translated: One’s own, a mat, exceeding the right size, suitable, and made by oneself or by one who has been appointed.

original: de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad do //
analyzed: de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad do //
translated: If any of these are incomplete, it is a downfall, as appropriate.

original: sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas te /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas te /
translated: The downfall of preparation is a minor offense.

original: ji srid du gding ba las gyur pa'i ltung byed kyi sbyor ba brtsams nas dngos gzhi la ma thug gi bar du nyes byas so //
analyzed: ji srid du gding ba las gyur pa'i ltung byed kyi sbyor ba brtsams nas dngos gzhi la ma thug gi bar du nyes byas so //
translated: As long as one has begun the preparation for the downfall of having an excess in the size of the mat, but has not yet reached the actual downfall, it is a minor offense.

original: dngos gzhi la sbyor ba tha dad pa ji snyed brtsams pa re re la nyes byas re re'o //
analyzed: dngos gzhi la sbyor ba tha dad pa ji snyed brtsams pa re re la nyes byas re re'o //
translated: For each of the preparations that are different from the actual downfall, there is a minor offense.

original: gding ba tshad las chung ngu la byin gyis rlob na nyes byas so //
analyzed: gding ba tshad las chung ngu la byin gyis rlob na nyes byas so //
translated: If one consecrates a mat that is smaller than the right size, it is a minor offense.

original: bcad dam zhes ma dris par ltung ba 'chags pa dang du len na nyes byas so //
analyzed: bcad dam zhes ma dris par ltung ba 'chags pa dang du len na nyes byas so //
translated: If one accepts the confession of a downfall without asking whether the mat has been cut, it is a minor offense.

original: sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas phra mo ste /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas phra mo ste /
translated: The downfall of preparation for preparation is a very minor offense.

original: sbyor ba ji snyed pa la sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'ang de snyed de /
analyzed: sbyor ba ji snyed pa la sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'ang de snyed de /
translated: There are as many preparations for preparation as there are preparations.

original: sbyor ba nyes byas kyi sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'ang nyes byas te nyes byas phra mo'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba nyes byas kyi sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'ang nyes byas te nyes byas phra mo'o //
translated: The preparation is a minor offense, and the application is also a minor offense.

original: ltung ba med pa ni rgyu rung ba ma yin pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: ltung ba med pa ni rgyu rung ba ma yin pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if the cause is not suitable.

original: las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang / sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor ba dag gis nyen pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang / sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor ba dag gis nyen pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense for a beginner, for one who is insane, for one whose mind is disturbed, or for one who is overwhelmed by pain.

original: bslab par bya ba ni dge slong gis yul thams cad la gnas skabs thams cad du gding ba las gyur ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur ba'i rnam pa thams cad mi bsten par bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: bslab par bya ba ni dge slong gis yul thams cad la gnas skabs thams cad du gding ba las gyur ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur ba'i rnam pa thams cad mi bsten par bslab par bya'o //
translated: The training is that a monk should train in not using any of the forms of a down- fall that are related to a sitting mat at any time and in any situation.

original: rgyu rung ba ma yin pa las gding ba mi bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu rung ba ma yin pa las gding ba mi bya'o //
translated: One should not use a sitting mat that is made from an unsuitable material.

original: gang gi mdun du 'chags par byed pa des khyod kyis dngos po de bcad dam zhes dri bar bya'o //
analyzed: gang gi mdun du 'chags par byed pa des khyod kyis dngos po de bcad dam zhes dri bar bya'o //
translated: The person to whom one confesses should ask, “Have you given up that object?”

original: bcad pa nyid ma dris par @32a * //
analyzed: bcad pa nyid ma dris par @32a * //
translated: If one has not asked whether it has been given up,

original: 'chags pa blang bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'chags pa blang bar mi bya'o //
translated: one should not accept the confession.

original: ma bcad par 'chags na ltung ba de bshags pa ma yin pas yang bshags par bya'o //
analyzed: ma bcad par 'chags na ltung ba de bshags pa ma yin pas yang bshags par bya'o //
translated: If one does not confess it, then since that downfall is not confessed, one must confess it again.

original: phyir bcos pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: phyir bcos pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The amendment is the same as before.

original: gding ba las gyur pa'i ltung byed de brgyad cu bdun pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: gding ba las gyur pa'i ltung byed de brgyad cu bdun pa bshad zin to /
translated: The eighty-seventh class of offense that is a downfall due to a lapse in the training rules concerning the sitting mat has been explained.

original: // / g-yan pa dgab pa las gyur ba'i ltung byed kyi gleng gzhi ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod ni rgyal bu rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' rab na bzhugs so //🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong gis g-yan pa dgab par byed du gzhug go zhes bka' stsal nas /
analyzed: // / g-yan pa dgab pa las gyur ba'i ltung byed kyi gleng gzhi ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod ni rgyal bu rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' rab na bzhugs so // bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong gis g-yan pa dgab par byed du gzhug go zhes bka' stsal nas /
translated: The introduction to the class of downfalls due to lapses in the training rules concerning the covering for the shoulders: The Blessed Buddha was staying in Śrāvastī, in Prince Jeta’s grove, in the grove given by Anāthapiṇḍada.🔽The Blessed One said, “Monks should make a covering for the shoulders.”🔽Monks made it too large, and monks who had few desires complained about this to the Blessed One.

original: dge slong dag ha cang tshad las lhag pa byed du 'jug nas dge slong don nyung du dag bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong gis g-yan pa dgab par byed du gzhug go zhes bka' stsal nas /
analyzed: dge slong dag ha cang tshad las lhag pa byed du 'jug nas dge slong don nyung du dag bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong gis g-yan pa dgab par byed du gzhug go zhes bka' stsal nas /
translated: The Blessed One said, “Monks should make a covering for the shoulders.”

original: dge slong dag ci'i phyir tshad las ha cang lhag par byed du 'jug ces smod par byed /
analyzed: dge slong dag ci'i phyir tshad las ha cang lhag par byed du 'jug ces smod par byed /
translated: They criticized,

original: phyar ka gtong bar byed /🔽la zer bar byed pa'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa dang / de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byung ba 'di dang gleng gzhi 'di dang / skabs 'di la dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdu ba mdzad de /
analyzed: phyar ka gtong bar byed / la zer bar byed pa'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa dang / de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byung ba 'di dang gleng gzhi 'di dang / skabs 'di la dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdu ba mdzad de /
translated: and disparaged them.🔽The monks reported to the Blessed One the criticism and disparagement of the brahmins and householders.🔽The Blessed One assembled the saṅgha of monks and asked them,

original: dge slong rnams la rmas nas /🔽'dod pa che pa dang / chog mi shes pa dang / gso dka' ba dang / dgang dka' ba rnam par smad cing /
analyzed: dge slong rnams la rmas nas / 'dod pa che pa dang / chog mi shes pa dang / gso dka' ba dang / dgang dka' ba rnam par smad cing /
translated: “Monks, is it true that you are acting like this?”🔽He criticized those who have great desires, are not content, are difficult to support, and are difficult to fill,

original: 'dod pa chung ba dang ; chog shes pa dang / gso sla ba dang / dgang sla ba dang / phri ba dang / yo byad bsnyungs pa dang / sbyangs pa'i yon tan dang / mdzes pa dang drod rig pa nyid kyis bsngags pa brjod pa mdzad de /
analyzed: 'dod pa chung ba dang ; chog shes pa dang / gso sla ba dang / dgang sla ba dang / phri ba dang / yo byad bsnyungs pa dang / sbyangs pa'i yon tan dang / mdzes pa dang drod rig pa nyid kyis bsngags pa brjod pa mdzad de /
translated: and praised those who have little desire, are content, are easy to support, are easy to fill, are frugal, are austere, and are beautiful and warm-hearted.

original: bslab pa bca' ba'i phan yon bcu yang dag par gzigs pas nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /
analyzed: bslab pa bca' ba'i phan yon bcu yang dag par gzigs pas nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /
translated: Having seen the ten benefits of establishing the training rules, I declare to my disciples that the basis of the training in the monastic code should be recited like this:

original: dge slong gis g-yan pa dgab pa byed du 'jug na tshad bzhin du byed du chug shig de la g-yan pa dgab pa'i tshad ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: dge slong gis g-yan pa dgab pa byed du 'jug na tshad bzhin du byed du chug shig de la g-yan pa dgab pa'i tshad ni 'di yin te /
translated: “If a monk has a scratch-covering cloth made, he should have it made according to the right measurements. This is the right measurement for a scratch-covering cloth:

original: srid du bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho'i mtho bzhi /🔽zheng du mtho do'i //
analyzed: srid du bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho'i mtho bzhi / zheng du mtho do'i //
translated: four standard handspans long and two wide.

original: de las lhag par byed du 'jug na bcad nas ltung byed do zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
analyzed: de las lhag par byed du 'jug na bcad nas ltung byed do zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
translated: If it exceeds that, it is to be cut down, and he commits an offense entailing confession.”

original: yul ni mnyan yod /
analyzed: yul ni mnyan yod /
translated: The location for this is Śrāvastī.

original: gang zag ni dge slong rab tu mang po //
analyzed: gang zag ni dge slong rab tu mang po //
translated: The individual is a large number of monks.

original: nyon mongs pa ni tshad mi shes pa /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ni tshad mi shes pa /
translated: The affliction is any one of the three.

original: nyes pa ni g-yan pa dgab pa tshad las lhag par byed du 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: nyes pa ni g-yan pa dgab pa tshad las lhag par byed du 'jug pa'o //
translated: The action is having a scratch-covering cloth made that exceeds the right measurements.

original: de la dge slong gis zhes bya ba ni chos 'di pas so //
analyzed: de la dge slong gis zhes bya ba ni chos 'di pas so //
translated: “If a monk” means if a monk belonging to this religion.

original: g-yan pa @32b dgab pa zhes bya ba ni na ba'i gsos so //
analyzed: g-yan pa @32b dgab pa zhes bya ba ni na ba'i gsos so //
translated: “Scratch-covering cloth” is a cloth for curing illness.

original: byed du 'jug na zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyis sam gzhan no //
analyzed: byed du 'jug na zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyis sam gzhan no //
translated: “If you have it made” means if you make it yourself or have someone else make it.

original: tshad bzhin du byed du chug shig ces bya ba ni g-yan pa dgab pa'i tshad gang yin pa de bzhin no //
analyzed: tshad bzhin du byed du chug shig ces bya ba ni g-yan pa dgab pa'i tshad gang yin pa de bzhin no //
translated: “You should have it made according to the right size” means that it should be made according to the size of the itch-covering cloth.

original: de la g-yan pa dgab pa'i tshad ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la g-yan pa dgab pa'i tshad ni 'di yin te /
translated: The size of the itch-covering cloth is as follows:

original: srid du bde bar gshegs mtho'i tho bzhi ;
analyzed: srid du bde bar gshegs mtho'i tho bzhi ;
translated: Four cubits long and two across.

original: zheng du mtho do'o zhes bya ba la srid du zhes bya ba ni chur ro //
analyzed: zheng du mtho do'o zhes bya ba la srid du zhes bya ba ni chur ro //
translated: “Long” means in length.

original: bde bar gshegs pa zhes bya ba ni ston pa'o //
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa zhes bya ba ni ston pa'o //
translated: “Well-gone” refers to the Teacher.

original: de'i mtho'i mtho ba zhi gang yin pa ded la ni tshad dang ldan pa'i khru drug go //
analyzed: de'i mtho'i mtho ba zhi gang yin pa ded la ni tshad dang ldan pa'i khru drug go //
translated: Four cubits of the Well-gone is the standard six cubits.

original: zheng du zhes bya ba ni rgyar ro //
analyzed: zheng du zhes bya ba ni rgyar ro //
translated: “Across” means in width.

original: mtho do zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mtho do zhes bya ba la /
translated: “Two” means

original: bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho do gang yin pa de la ni tshad dang ldan pa'i 'khru gsum mo //
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho do gang yin pa de la ni tshad dang ldan pa'i 'khru gsum mo //
translated: two cubits of the Well-gone is the standard three cubits.

original: de las lhag par byed du 'jug na zhes bya ba ni de las gong ma'o //
analyzed: de las lhag par byed du 'jug na zhes bya ba ni de las gong ma'o //
translated: “If you have it made larger than that” means larger than that.

original: bcad nas zhes bya ba ni dngos po de bcad nas ltung byed kyi ltung ba bshags par bya'o //
analyzed: bcad nas zhes bya ba ni dngos po de bcad nas ltung byed kyi ltung ba bshags par bya'o //
translated: “Having cut” means having cut that thing, one should confess the downfall of a partial defeat.

original: ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: “A partial defeat” is as explained above.

original: de la ltung bar ji ltar 'gyur zhe na 'dir yang dngos gzhi dang / sbyor ba dang ; sbyor ba'i sbyor bas ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa dang / ltung ba med pa dang / bslab par bya ba dang / phyir bcos pa rnams kyis 'di'i mtshan nyid shes par bya'o //🔽de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni dge slong gis g-yan pa dgab pa'i tshad srid du khru drug / zheng du khru gsum pa las chu zheng gang yang rung bar tshad las lhag par byed dam /
analyzed: de la ltung bar ji ltar 'gyur zhe na 'dir yang dngos gzhi dang / sbyor ba dang ; sbyor ba'i sbyor bas ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa dang / ltung ba med pa dang / bslab par bya ba dang / phyir bcos pa rnams kyis 'di'i mtshan nyid shes par bya'o // de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni dge slong gis g-yan pa dgab pa'i tshad srid du khru drug / zheng du khru gsum pa las chu zheng gang yang rung bar tshad las lhag par byed dam /
translated: Here, one should understand the characteristics of this [partial defeat] through the basic offense, the preparatory action, the preparatory action of the preparatory action, the presentation of the downfalls, the absence of downfalls, the training, and the amendment.

original: byed du 'jug na g-yan pa dgab pa las gyur pa'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byed du 'jug na g-yan pa dgab pa las gyur pa'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
translated: Here, the presentation of the basic offense is this: If a fully ordained monk makes or has made a shawl that exceeds the right size—six standard handspans long and three wide—then, regardless of whether it is longer or wider, he commits the basic downfall of the shawl.

original: g-yan pa dgab pa'i rgyu gdags su rung ba la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: g-yan pa dgab pa'i rgyu gdags su rung ba la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if the covering for the private parts is suitable for covering the private parts.

original: g-yan pa dgab pa'i srid kyi tshad ni bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho bzhi ste /
analyzed: g-yan pa dgab pa'i srid kyi tshad ni bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho bzhi ste /
translated: The measure of the covering for the private parts is four cubits of the Sugata.

original: bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho gang la ni tshad dang ldan pa'i khru phyed dang do yod pas des na g-yan pa dgab pa'i srid kyi tshad ni tshad dang ldan pa'i khru drug go //
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho gang la ni tshad dang ldan pa'i khru phyed dang do yod pas des na g-yan pa dgab pa'i srid kyi tshad ni tshad dang ldan pa'i khru drug go //
translated: Since one cubit of the Sugata is equal to one and a half cubits of an ordinary person, the measure of the covering for the private parts is six cubits of an ordinary person.

original: zheng gi tshad ni bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho do ste //
analyzed: zheng gi tshad ni bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho do ste //
translated: The width is two cubits of the Sugata.

original: de la ni tshad dang ldan pa'i 'khru gsum mo //
analyzed: de la ni tshad dang ldan pa'i 'khru gsum mo //
translated: That is three cubits of an ordinary person.

original: chu zhing gi tshad gang yang rung ba de las lhag ba lan smad pa med do //
analyzed: chu zhing gi tshad gang yang rung ba de las lhag ba lan smad pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if the covering for the private parts is less than the prescribed size.

original: byed dam byed du bcug pa la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: byed dam byed du bcug pa la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if one makes it or has it made for someone else.

original: 'di'i byed pa po ni rang gi g-yan pa dgab pa nyid dang / tshad las lhag pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'di'i byed pa po ni rang gi g-yan pa dgab pa nyid dang / tshad las lhag pa nyid do //
translated: The agent in this is oneself, or it is the excess size.

original: 'di la yan lag lngas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur ba ste rang gi nyid dang / g-yan pa dgab pa nyid dang / @33a * //
analyzed: 'di la yan lag lngas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur ba ste rang gi nyid dang / g-yan pa dgab pa nyid dang / @33a * //
translated: covering the knees;🔽exceeding the right size;🔽using the right material;

original: tshad las lhag pa nyid dang / rgyu rung ba nyid dang / rang ngam bskos pas byas pa nyid do //
analyzed: tshad las lhag pa nyid dang / rgyu rung ba nyid dang / rang ngam bskos pas byas pa nyid do //
translated: and making it by oneself or by one commissioned to do so.

original: de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad do //
analyzed: de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad do //
translated: If any of these factors is missing, a corresponding infraction is accrued.

original: sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas te /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas te /
translated: The infraction of preparation is a minor offense.

original: ji srid du g-yan pa dgab ba las gyur pa'i ltung byed kyi sbyor ba brtsams nas dngos gzhi la ma thug gi bar du nyes byas so //
analyzed: ji srid du g-yan pa dgab ba las gyur pa'i ltung byed kyi sbyor ba brtsams nas dngos gzhi la ma thug gi bar du nyes byas so //
translated: As long as one has begun the preparation for the downfall of not covering the knees but has not yet reached the actual downfall, one has a minor offense.

original: dngos gzhi la sbyor ba tha dad pa ji snyed brtsams pa re re la nyes byas re re'o //🔽g-yan pa dgab pa chad las chung du byin gyis rlob na nyes byas so //
analyzed: dngos gzhi la sbyor ba tha dad pa ji snyed brtsams pa re re la nyes byas re re'o // g-yan pa dgab pa chad las chung du byin gyis rlob na nyes byas so //
translated: For each of the preparations for the actual downfall that are distinct from one another, one has a minor offense.🔽If one renounces the training without having committed a downfall, one has a minor offense.

original: bcad dam zhes ma dris par ltung ba 'chags pa dang du len na nyes byas so //
analyzed: bcad dam zhes ma dris par ltung ba 'chags pa dang du len na nyes byas so //
translated: If one confesses a downfall without having asked whether one has committed one, one has a minor offense.

original: sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas phra mo ste /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas phra mo ste /
translated: The offense of preparation for the offense of preparation is a minor offense.

original: sbyor ba ji snyed pa la sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'ang de snyed de /
analyzed: sbyor ba ji snyed pa la sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'ang de snyed de /
translated: As many as there are preparations, there are also preparations for the preparations.

original: sbyor ba nyes byas kyi sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'ang nyes byas te nyes byas phra mo'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba nyes byas kyi sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'ang nyes byas te nyes byas phra mo'o //
translated: The preparation for the preparation is a minor offense.

original: ltung ba med pa ni rgyu rung ba ma yin pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: ltung ba med pa ni rgyu rung ba ma yin pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if the cause is not suitable.

original: las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang / sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor bdag gis nyan pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang / sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor bdag gis nyan pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense for a beginner, for one who is insane, for one whose mind is disturbed, or for one who is listening to the recitation of the scriptures.

original: bslab par bya ba ni dge slong gis yul thams cad la gnas skabs thams cad du g-yan pa dgab pa las gyur pa'i ltung byed du 'gyur ba rnam pa thams cad mi bsten par bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: bslab par bya ba ni dge slong gis yul thams cad la gnas skabs thams cad du g-yan pa dgab pa las gyur pa'i ltung byed du 'gyur ba rnam pa thams cad mi bsten par bslab par bya'o //
translated: The training is that a monk should train in not engaging in any way in the downfalls that occur by not covering the shoulders, in all places and at all times.

original: rgyu rung ba ma yin pa las g-yan pa dgab pa mi bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu rung ba ma yin pa las g-yan pa dgab pa mi bya'o //
translated: One should not not cover the shoulders with an unsuitable cause.

original: gang gi mdun du 'chags par byed pa des khyod kyi dngos po bcad dam zhes dri bar bya'o //
analyzed: gang gi mdun du 'chags par byed pa des khyod kyi dngos po bcad dam zhes dri bar bya'o //
translated: The one in front of whom one confesses should ask, “Have you cut off your penis?”

original: bcad pa nyid ma dris par 'chags pa blang bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: bcad pa nyid ma dris par 'chags pa blang bar mi bya'o //
translated: Without having been asked, one should not accept a confession that has not been relinquished.

original: ma bcad par 'chags na ltung bde bshags pa ma yin pas yang bshags par bya'o //
analyzed: ma bcad par 'chags na ltung bde bshags pa ma yin pas yang bshags par bya'o //
translated: If one accepts a confession without it having been relinquished, it is not a confession, and so it must be confessed again.

original: phyir bcos pa rnams ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: phyir bcos pa rnams ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The amendment is the same as before.

original: g-yan pa dgab pa las gyur pa'i ltung byed de brgyad cu brgyad pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: g-yan pa dgab pa las gyur pa'i ltung byed de brgyad cu brgyad pa bshad zin to /
translated: The eighty-eighth downfall is finished.🔽The Prelude to the Downfall on Great Summer Robes

original: // / dbyar gyi ras chen las gyur pa'i ltung byed kyi gleng gzhi ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' rab na bzhugs so //
analyzed: // / dbyar gyi ras chen las gyur pa'i ltung byed kyi gleng gzhi ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' rab na bzhugs so //
translated: The Blessed Buddha was staying in Śrāvastī, in Jeta’s Grove, in Anāthapiṇḍada’s park.

original: bcom lda 'das kyis dge slong dbyar gyi gos ras chen byed du gzhug go zhes bka' stsal nas /
analyzed: bcom lda 'das kyis dge slong dbyar gyi gos ras chen byed du gzhug go zhes bka' stsal nas /
translated: The Blessed One said, “Monks should make a great summer robe.”

original: dge slong dag ha cang tshad las lhag par byed du 'jug nas dge slong don nyung du dag bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong gis dbyar gyi gos ras chen byed du 'jug go zhes bka' stsal nas /
analyzed: dge slong dag ha cang tshad las lhag par byed du 'jug nas dge slong don nyung du dag bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong gis dbyar gyi gos ras chen byed du 'jug go zhes bka' stsal nas /
translated: “Monks, why do you have robes made that are beyond the right measure?🔽Monks with few desires complained and criticized them,

original: ci'i phyir dge slong dag ha cang tshad las lhag par byed du 'jug ces smod par byed /🔽phyar kha gtong bar byed /
analyzed: ci'i phyir dge slong dag ha cang tshad las lhag par byed du 'jug ces smod par byed / phyar kha gtong bar byed /
translated: “Why do monks have robes made that are beyond the right measure?”

original: kha zer bar @33b byed pa'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //
analyzed: kha zer bar @33b byed pa'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //
translated: They gossiped and complained and reported the matter to the Blessed One.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis 'byung pa 'di dang / gleng gzhi 'di dang / skabs 'di la dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdu ba mdzad de /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis 'byung pa 'di dang / gleng gzhi 'di dang / skabs 'di la dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdu ba mdzad de /
translated: Then the Blessed One, because of this event, because of this basis, because of this situation, convened a gathering of the saṅgha of monks.

original: dge slong dag la rmas nas 'dod pa che ba dang / chog mi shes pa dang / gsod dka' ba dang / dgang dka' ba rnam par smad cing /
analyzed: dge slong dag la rmas nas 'dod pa che ba dang / chog mi shes pa dang / gsod dka' ba dang / dgang dka' ba rnam par smad cing /
translated: He asked the monks, and then criticized those with desire, those with attachment, those difficult to fill, those difficult to satisfy,

original: 'dod pa chung ba dang / chog shes pa dang / gso sla ba dang / dgang sla ba dang / phri ba dang / yo byad bsnyungs pa dang / sbyangs pa'i yon tan dang / mdzes pa dang / drod rig pa nyid kyi bsngags pa brjod de /
analyzed: 'dod pa chung ba dang / chog shes pa dang / gso sla ba dang / dgang sla ba dang / phri ba dang / yo byad bsnyungs pa dang / sbyangs pa'i yon tan dang / mdzes pa dang / drod rig pa nyid kyi bsngags pa brjod de /
translated: He praised having few desires, contentment, being easy to support, being easy to please, being austere, having few possessions, the ascetic qualities, being attractive, and being aware of one’s own heat.

original: bslab pa bca' ba'i phan yon bcu yang dag par gzigs pas nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /
analyzed: bslab pa bca' ba'i phan yon bcu yang dag par gzigs pas nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /
translated: Seeing the ten benefits of establishing the training rules, he said, “My disciples, you should recite the following basis of the training for the monastic code:🔽‘If a monk has a rainy season robe made, he should have it made to the right size.

original: dge slong gis dbyar gyi gos ras chen byed du 'jug na tshad bzhin du byed du chug shig / de la dbyar gyi gos ras chen gyi tshad ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: dge slong gis dbyar gyi gos ras chen byed du 'jug na tshad bzhin du byed du chug shig / de la dbyar gyi gos ras chen gyi tshad ni 'di yin te /
translated: The right size for a rainy season robe is this:

original: srid du bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho'i mtho drug zheng du mtho phyed dang gsum mo //
analyzed: srid du bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho'i mtho drug zheng du mtho phyed dang gsum mo //
translated: six standard handspans long and three and a half wide.

original: de las lhag par byed du 'jug na bcad nas ltung byed do zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
analyzed: de las lhag par byed du 'jug na bcad nas ltung byed do zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
translated: If it is made larger than that, it is to be cut down, and one commits an offense entailing confession.’”

original: yul ni mnyan yod /
analyzed: yul ni mnyan yod /
translated: The place was Śrāvastī.

original: gang zag ni dge slong rab tu mang po /
analyzed: gang zag ni dge slong rab tu mang po /
translated: The person is a large number of monks.

original: nyon mongs pa ni tshad mi shes pa /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ni tshad mi shes pa /
translated: The affliction is not knowing the measure.

original: nyes pa ni dbyar gyi ras chen tshad las lhag par byed du 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: nyes pa ni dbyar gyi ras chen tshad las lhag par byed du 'jug pa'o //
translated: The offense is to have a rainy season robe made that exceeds the proper size.

original: de la dge slong gis zhes bya ba ni chos 'di pas so //
analyzed: de la dge slong gis zhes bya ba ni chos 'di pas so //
translated: In this case, “monk” refers to someone who is a member of this religion.

original: dbyar gyi gos ras chen zhes bya ba ni char pa skyob pa'i gos so //
analyzed: dbyar gyi gos ras chen zhes bya ba ni char pa skyob pa'i gos so //
translated: “Rainy season robe” means a robe that protects from the rain.

original: byed du 'jag na zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyis sam gzhan no //
analyzed: byed du 'jag na zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyis sam gzhan no //
translated: “To have made” means to have made it oneself or to have had another make it.

original: tshad bzhin du byed du chug shig ces bya ba ni dbyar gyi gos ras chen gyi tshad gang yin pa de bzhin du'o //
analyzed: tshad bzhin du byed du chug shig ces bya ba ni dbyar gyi gos ras chen gyi tshad gang yin pa de bzhin du'o //
translated: “Have it made to the proper size” means to make it the size of a rainy season robe.

original: de la dbyar gyi gos ras chen gyi tshad ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la dbyar gyi gos ras chen gyi tshad ni 'di yin te /
translated: This is the proper size for a rainy season robe:🔽six standard hand-widths in length and three and a half in width.

original: srid du bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho'i mtho drug / zheng du mtho phyed dang gsum mo zhes bya ba la ni srid du zhes bya ba ni chur ro //
analyzed: srid du bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho'i mtho drug / zheng du mtho phyed dang gsum mo zhes bya ba la ni srid du zhes bya ba ni chur ro //
translated: “In length” means in the direction of the length of the body.🔽“Standard hand-width” means the distance between the tip of the thumb and the tip of the middle finger when the hand is extended.

original: bde bar gshegs pa zhes bya ba ni ston pa'o //
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa zhes bya ba ni ston pa'o //
translated: “Well-gone” refers to the Teacher.

original: de'i mtho'i mtho drug gang yin pa de la ni tshad dang ldan pa'i khru dgu'o //
analyzed: de'i mtho'i mtho drug gang yin pa de la ni tshad dang ldan pa'i khru dgu'o //
translated: The height of the upper part of the door should be nine cubits.

original: zheng du zhes bya ba ni rgyar ro //
analyzed: zheng du zhes bya ba ni rgyar ro //
translated: “Width” means across.

original: chur mtho phyed dang gsum zhes bya ba la /🔽bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho phyed dang gsum gang yin pa de la ni /
analyzed: chur mtho phyed dang gsum zhes bya ba la / bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho phyed dang gsum gang yin pa de la ni /
translated: “Depth” means three and a half cubits.🔽The cubit of the Sugata is the cubit of the Buddha.

original: tshad dang ldan pa'i khru gsum dang sor bco brgyad do //
analyzed: tshad dang ldan pa'i khru gsum dang sor bco brgyad do //
translated: The depth of the door should be three and a half cubits of the Buddha.

original: de las lhag par byed du 'jug na zhes bya ba ni de las gong ma'o //
analyzed: de las lhag par byed du 'jug na zhes bya ba ni de las gong ma'o //
translated: “If one has it made more than that” means more than that.

original: bcad nas zhes bya ba ni dngos po des bcad nas ltung byed kyi ltung ba @34a * //🔽bshags par bya'o //
analyzed: bcad nas zhes bya ba ni dngos po des bcad nas ltung byed kyi ltung ba @34a * // bshags par bya'o //
translated: “Having cut it off” means having cut it off with that thing.🔽“One should confess a Pāyantika downfall” means that one should confess a Pāyantika downfall.

original: ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: “Pāyantika” is as explained above.

original: de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is a downfall there?

original: 'dir yang dngos gzhi dang / sbyor ba dang / sbyor ba'i sbyor bas ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa dang / ltung ba med pa dang / bslab par bya pa dang / phyir bcos pa rnams kyis 'di'i mtshan nyid shes par bya'o //🔽de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni dge slong gis dbyar gyi gos ngas chen gyi tshad srid du khru dgu zheng du khru gsum dang sor bco brgyad pa las chu zheng gang yang rung bar tshad las lhag par byed dam byed du 'jug
analyzed: 'dir yang dngos gzhi dang / sbyor ba dang / sbyor ba'i sbyor bas ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa dang / ltung ba med pa dang / bslab par bya pa dang / phyir bcos pa rnams kyis 'di'i mtshan nyid shes par bya'o // de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni dge slong gis dbyar gyi gos ngas chen gyi tshad srid du khru dgu zheng du khru gsum dang sor bco brgyad pa las chu zheng gang yang rung bar tshad las lhag par byed dam byed du 'jug
translated: Here, the characteristics of this should be understood through the basic transgression, the preparatory act, the preparatory act of the preparatory act, the downfalls, the absence of downfalls, the training, and the restoration.

original: na dbyar gyi gos ras chen las gyur pa'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: na dbyar gyi gos ras chen las gyur pa'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
translated: Here, the basic transgression is that if a fully ordained monk makes or has made a rainy season robe that exceeds the right size—nine standard handspans in length and three and a half in width—then he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession for the rainy season robe.

original: dbyar gyi gos ras chen gyi rgyu gdags su rung ba la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: dbyar gyi gos ras chen gyi rgyu gdags su rung ba la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if the rainy season robe is made from suitable material.

original: dbyar gyi gos ras chen gyi srid kyi tshad ni bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho drug ste /
analyzed: dbyar gyi gos ras chen gyi srid kyi tshad ni bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho drug ste /
translated: The standard length of a rainy season robe is six standard handspans of the Buddha.

original: bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho'i mtho gang la ni tshad dang ldan pa'i khru phyed dang do yod pas de ni dbyar gyi gos ras chen gyi srid kyi tshad dang ldan pa'i khru dgu'o //
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho'i mtho gang la ni tshad dang ldan pa'i khru phyed dang do yod pas de ni dbyar gyi gos ras chen gyi srid kyi tshad dang ldan pa'i khru dgu'o //
translated: The height of a Sugata is one cubit and two-thirds, so the length of the rainy season robe is nine cubits.

original: zheng gi tshad ni bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho phyed dang gsum ste /
analyzed: zheng gi tshad ni bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho phyed dang gsum ste /
translated: The width is one cubit and three-quarters of a Sugata.

original: de la ni tshad dang ldan pa'i khru gsum dang sor bco brgyad do //
analyzed: de la ni tshad dang ldan pa'i khru gsum dang sor bco brgyad do //
translated: That is three cubits and eighteen finger-widths.

original: chu zhing gi tshad gang yang rung pa de las lhag pa la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: chu zhing gi tshad gang yang rung pa de las lhag pa la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no fault in making it larger than the prescribed size of the rainy season robe.

original: byed dam byed du 'jug pa la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: byed dam byed du 'jug pa la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no fault in making it or having it made.

original: 'di'i byed ba po ni rang gi dbyar gyi gos ras chen nyid dang / tshad las lhag pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'di'i byed ba po ni rang gi dbyar gyi gos ras chen nyid dang / tshad las lhag pa nyid do //
translated: The agent of this is the rainy season robe itself, and the excess of the prescribed size.

original: 'di la yan lag lngas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar gyur te /
analyzed: 'di la yan lag lngas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar gyur te /
translated: Here, the basic downfall is committed by five factors.

original: rang gi nyid dang / dbyar gyi gos ras chen nyid dang / tshad las lhag pa nyid dang / rgyu rung ba nyid dang / rang ngam bskos pas byas pa nyid do //
analyzed: rang gi nyid dang / dbyar gyi gos ras chen nyid dang / tshad las lhag pa nyid dang / rgyu rung ba nyid dang / rang ngam bskos pas byas pa nyid do //
translated: and it is made by oneself or by a monk who has been appointed.

original: de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad do //
analyzed: de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad do //
translated: If any of these aspects is incomplete, the downfall is a partial defeat or a serious violation, depending on the circumstances.🔽The downfall of preparation is a minor infraction.

original: sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas te ji srid du dbyar gyi gos ras chen las gyur pa'i ltung byed kyi sbyor ba brtsams nas dngos gzhi la ma thug gi bar du nyes byas so //🔽dngos gzhi la sbyor ba tha dad pa ji snyed brtsams pa re re la nyes byas re ra'o ;
analyzed: sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas te ji srid du dbyar gyi gos ras chen las gyur pa'i ltung byed kyi sbyor ba brtsams nas dngos gzhi la ma thug gi bar du nyes byas so // dngos gzhi la sbyor ba tha dad pa ji snyed brtsams pa re re la nyes byas re ra'o ;
translated: As long as one has not reached the actual basis of the downfall of the rainy season robe, one commits a minor infraction for each action that is part of the preparation for the downfall.

original: / dbyar gyi gos ras chen tshad las chung du la byin gyis rlob na nyes byas so //
analyzed: / dbyar gyi gos ras chen tshad las chung du la byin gyis rlob na nyes byas so //
translated: If one consecrates a rainy season robe that is smaller than the right size, one commits a minor infraction.

original: bcad dam zhes ma dris par ltung ba 'chags pa dang du len ni nyes byas so //
analyzed: bcad dam zhes ma dris par ltung ba 'chags pa dang du len ni nyes byas so //
translated: If one accepts a confession of a downfall without asking whether the article has been relinquished, one commits a minor infraction.

original: sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas phra mo ste /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas phra mo ste /
translated: The downfall of preparation for a downfall of preparation is a minor infraction.

original: sbyor ba ji snyed pa la sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'ang de snyed de /
analyzed: sbyor ba ji snyed pa la sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'ang de snyed de /
translated: And the application of the application is the same as the application.

original: sbyor ba nyes byas kyi sbyor @34b ba'i sbyor ba'ang nyes byas te nyes byas phra mo'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba nyes byas kyi sbyor @34b ba'i sbyor ba'ang nyes byas te nyes byas phra mo'o //
translated: The application of the application of a minor offense is also a minor offense.

original: ltung ba med pa ni rgyu rung ba ma yin pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: ltung ba med pa ni rgyu rung ba ma yin pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if the cause is not suitable.

original: las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang / sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor ba dag gis nyen pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang / sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor ba dag gis nyen pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense for a beginner, for one who is insane, for one whose mind is disturbed, or for one who is overwhelmed by pain.

original: bslab par bya ba ni dge slong gis yul thams cad la gnas skabs thams cad du dbyar gyi gos ras chen las gyur pa'i ltung byed du gyur pa rnam pa thams cad mi bsten par bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: bslab par bya ba ni dge slong gis yul thams cad la gnas skabs thams cad du dbyar gyi gos ras chen las gyur pa'i ltung byed du gyur pa rnam pa thams cad mi bsten par bslab par bya'o //
translated: The training is that a monk should train in not using in any way the rainy season robe made of coarse cloth, in any country, at any time.

original: rgyu rung ba ma yin pa la dbyar gyi gos ras chen mi bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu rung ba ma yin pa la dbyar gyi gos ras chen mi bya'o //
translated: One should not make a rainy season robe of coarse cloth from an unsuitable cause.

original: gang gi mdun du 'chags par byed pa des khyod kyis dngos po de bcad dam zhes dri bar bya'o //
analyzed: gang gi mdun du 'chags par byed pa des khyod kyis dngos po de bcad dam zhes dri bar bya'o //
translated: The one in front of whom one confesses should ask, “Have you given up that thing?”

original: bcad pa nyid ma dris par 'chags pa blang bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: bcad pa nyid ma dris par 'chags pa blang bar mi bya'o //
translated: Without having been cut, one should not accept the confession.

original: ma bcad par 'chags na ltung ba de bshags pa ma yin pas yang bshags par bya'o //

translated: How does one come to have a downfall? Here one should understand the characteristics of downfalls through the presentation of the actual basis of a downfall, the preparatory stage, and the preparatory stage of the preparatory stage; through the presentation of the absence of downfalls; through the presentation of the trainings; and through the presentation of the restoration of the vows.

analyzed: tshad dang ldan pa'i khru bco lnga'o //

analyzed: zheng du ston pa rang gi khru gsum / tshad dang ldan pa'i khru dgu pa nyid dam ;

original: de las lhag par byed dam byed du 'jug na bde bar gshegs pa'i chos gos kyi srid kyi tshad las gyur pa'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de las lhag par byed dam byed du 'jug na bde bar gshegs pa'i chos gos kyi srid kyi tshad las gyur pa'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
translated: If a monk makes robes that are larger than that, or has them made, he commits an actual basis downfall of the class of downfalls that require confession alone and that originate from a great deal of the basis, the class of downfalls that are similar to a partially concordant factor, and the class of downfalls that are similar to a root downfall.

original: bde bar gshegs pa'i chos gos kyi tshad kyi chos gos kyi rgyu gdags su rung ba la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa'i chos gos kyi tshad kyi chos gos kyi rgyu gdags su rung ba la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if the robe is made from cloth that is the size of the Sugata's robe, or from cloth that is the size of the Sugata's robe in length but not in width.

original: bde bar gshegs pa'i chos gos kyi srid kyi tshad ni bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho bcu ste /
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa'i chos gos kyi srid kyi tshad ni bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho bcu ste /
translated: The Sugata's robe is one cubit in length.

original: bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho gang la ni bde bar gshegs pa nyid kyi khru phyed yod pas des na bde bar gshegs pa'i chos gos kyi tshad kyi tshad ni bde bar gshegs pa nyid kyi khru lnga'o //
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho gang la ni bde bar gshegs pa nyid kyi khru phyed yod pas des na bde bar gshegs pa'i chos gos kyi tshad kyi tshad ni bde bar gshegs pa nyid kyi khru lnga'o //
translated: The Sugata's cubit is half a cubit of an ordinary person. Therefore, the Sugata's robe is five cubits in length.

original: de la tshad dang ldan pa'i khru ni bco lnga'o //
analyzed: de la tshad dang ldan pa'i khru ni bco lnga'o //
translated: In this case, the cubit is the standard cubit.

original: zheng gi tshad ni bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho drug ste /
analyzed: zheng gi tshad ni bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho drug ste /
translated: The width of the Sugata's robe is six cubits.

original: bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho gang la ni bde bar gshegs pa nyid kyi khru phyed yod pas des na bde bar gshegs pa'i chos gos kyi zheng gi tshad ni bde bar gshegs pa nyid kyi khru gsum mo //
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho gang la ni bde bar gshegs pa nyid kyi khru phyed yod pas des na bde bar gshegs pa'i chos gos kyi zheng gi tshad ni bde bar gshegs pa nyid kyi khru gsum mo //
translated: The Sugata's cubit is half a cubit of an ordinary person. Therefore, the Sugata's robe is three cubits wide.

original: de la tshad dang ldan pa'i khru dgu'o //
analyzed: de la tshad dang ldan pa'i khru dgu'o //
translated: In this case, the cubit is the standard cubit.

original: chu zheng gi tshad gang yang rung ba de tsam ma ma de las lhag pa la ni smad pa med do //
analyzed: chu zheng gi tshad gang yang rung ba de tsam ma ma de las lhag pa la ni smad pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if the size is no more than that of the mother’s own body.

original: dge slong rang gi lus bde bar gshegs pa'i sku'i tshad tsam ma ma de bas lhag pa med pa la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: dge slong rang gi lus bde bar gshegs pa'i sku'i tshad tsam ma ma de bas lhag pa med pa la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if the monk is not making a bed for himself, but one for the body of the Tathāgata, and it is no larger than that.

original: byed dam byed du 'jug pa la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: byed dam byed du 'jug pa la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if the monk is not making the bed himself, but is having someone else make it.

original: bde bar gshegs pa'i sku'i tshad tsam gyi lus yod pa dang / de bas lhag pa'i lus yod pa rang gi khru lnga dang gsum gyis lhag pa'i @36b chos gos sum 'gyur dang / bzhi 'gyur la sogs pa byed dam byed du 'jug pa la na smad pa med do //🔽'di'i byed pa po ni bde bar gshegs pa'i sku'i tshad tsam mam /
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa'i sku'i tshad tsam gyi lus yod pa dang / de bas lhag pa'i lus yod pa rang gi khru lnga dang gsum gyis lhag pa'i @36b chos gos sum 'gyur dang / bzhi 'gyur la sogs pa byed dam byed du 'jug pa la na smad pa med do // 'di'i byed pa po ni bde bar gshegs pa'i sku'i tshad tsam mam /
translated: There is no offense if the monk is making a bed for someone else, and it is no larger than the body of the Tathāgata or the robe of the Tathāgata.

original: de bas lhag pa'i lus med pa nyid dang / bde bar gshegs pa'i chos gos kyi tshad dam de bas lhag pa'i chos gos byed dam byed du 'jug pa nyid do //

translated: The agent in this case is someone who is making a bed for himself that is larger than the body of the Tathāgata or the robe of the Tathāgata, or who is having someone else make it.

original: 'di la yan lag lngas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /🔽rang gi nyid dang bde bar gshegs pa'i sku'i tshad dam /
analyzed: 'di la yan lag lngas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te / rang gi nyid dang bde bar gshegs pa'i sku'i tshad dam /
translated: There are five branches to the downfall of making a robe that exceeds the right measure:🔽one’s own body is the right size of the Sugata’s body or larger;🔽the robe is the right size of the Sugata’s robe or larger;🔽the material is suitable;

original: de bas lhag pa'i lus med pa nyid dang / bde bar gshegs pa'i chos gos kyi tshad dam de bas lhag pa'i chos gos nyid dang / rgyu rung ba nyid dang / rang ngam bskos pas byed pa nyid do //
analyzed: de bas lhag pa'i lus med pa nyid dang / bde bar gshegs pa'i chos gos kyi tshad dam de bas lhag pa'i chos gos nyid dang / rgyu rung ba nyid dang / rang ngam bskos pas byed pa nyid do //
translated: and one makes it oneself or has someone do it.

original: de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad do //
analyzed: de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad do //
translated: If any of these branches is missing, the downfall is a serious transgression.

original: sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas te /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas te /
translated: The downfall of preparation is a minor infraction.

original: ji srid du bde bar gshegs pa'i chos gos kyi tshad las lhag par gyur pa'i ltung byed kyi sbyor ba brtsams nas dngos gzhi la ma thug gi bar du nyes byas so //
analyzed: ji srid du bde bar gshegs pa'i chos gos kyi tshad las lhag par gyur pa'i ltung byed kyi sbyor ba brtsams nas dngos gzhi la ma thug gi bar du nyes byas so //
translated: As long as one has not reached the actual downfall of making a robe that exceeds the right measure of the Sugata’s robe, it is a minor infraction.

analyzed: dngos gzhi la sbyor ba tha dad pa ji snyed pa brtsams pa re re la nyes byas re re'o //
translated: For each preparation that is different from the actual downfall, there is a minor infraction.

analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa'i chos gos kyi tshad dam /
translated: The right measure of the Sugata’s robe is

analyzed: de bas lhag pa la byin gyis brlabs na mi 'chags te nyes byas so //

translated: If one makes or has one made a robe that is three times the size of the robe of the Sugata, or the size of one’s own body, which is larger than that, and that is more than one’s own five or three cubits, but less than the three times the size of the robe of the Sugata, it is a minor offense.

translated: In the country of Mathurā there lived a householder who was rich and had great wealth and many possessions, with vast and abundant holdings, with wealth like Vaiśravaṇa’s,
