analyzed: rnam thos kyi bu la nor gyis 'gran pa zhig 'dug pa des rigs mnyam pa las chung ma blangs nas / de de dang lhan cig rtse bar byed /
translated: rivaling Vaiśravaṇa’s wealth. He took a wife from a family of equal rank,🔽and he enjoyed himself,

original: dga' bar byed /🔽dga' mgur spyod par byed do //
analyzed: dga' bar byed / dga' mgur spyod par byed do //
translated: took pleasure, and coupled with her.

original: de'i chung ma la dus gzhan zhig na sems can zhugs par gyur nas de zla ba brgyad dam dgu 'das te bcas pa na /
analyzed: de'i chung ma la dus gzhan zhig na sems can zhugs par gyur nas de zla ba brgyad dam dgu 'das te bcas pa na /
translated: After some time, his wife became pregnant, and after eight or nine months

original: bu mo gzugs bzang ba blta na sdug pa /
analyzed: bu mo gzugs bzang ba blta na sdug pa /
translated: a girl was born who was well proportioned, pleasing to the eye,

original: mdzes pa / mig autpa la 'dra ba /
analyzed: mdzes pa / mig autpa la 'dra ba /
translated: beautiful, with eyes like lotus flowers,

original: autpa la'i dri dang ldan pa /
analyzed: autpa la'i dri dang ldan pa /
translated: and with the scent of a blue lotus.

original: autpa la'i ze 'bru'i mdog 'dra ba cig byung ngo //
analyzed: autpa la'i ze 'bru'i mdog 'dra ba cig byung ngo //
translated: She was born with eyes like a blue lotus, with the fragrance of a blue lotus, and the color of a blue lotus.

original: de'i nyid du dag 'dus shing lhags nas zhag bdun gsum nyi shu rtsa gcig tu bcas pa'i btsas ston rgya cher byas nas bu mo 'di'i ming cir gdags zhes de'i ming 'dogs par byed do //
analyzed: de'i nyid du dag 'dus shing lhags nas zhag bdun gsum nyi shu rtsa gcig tu bcas pa'i btsas ston rgya cher byas nas bu mo 'di'i ming cir gdags zhes de'i ming 'dogs par byed do //
translated: When she was born, her relatives gathered and for twenty-one days celebrated her birth with a great feast. Then they asked, “What name should we give this girl?”

original: nye du dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: nye du dag gis smras pa /
translated: Her relatives said, “

original: gang gi phyir bu mo 'di'i mig autpa la 'dra ba autpa la'i dri dang ldan pa /
analyzed: gang gi phyir bu mo 'di'i mig autpa la 'dra ba autpa la'i dri dang ldan pa /
translated: Since this girl has eyes like a blue lotus, the fragrance of a blue lotus,

original: autpa la'i ze'u 'bru'i mdog 'dra ba de'i phyir bu mo 'di'i ming autpa la'i mdog ces bya bar gdags so zhes de'i ming autpa la'i mdog ces bya bar btags so //
analyzed: autpa la'i ze'u 'bru'i mdog 'dra ba de'i phyir bu mo 'di'i ming autpa la'i mdog ces bya bar gdags so zhes de'i ming autpa la'i mdog ces bya bar btags so //
translated: and the color of a blue lotus, we should name this girl Utpalavarṇā.”🔽They raised her, and she grew up. When she was old enough, she married and had children.

original: de bsrings shing bskyed nas chen mor gyur te khyim so bzung ba'i rim gyis dus gzhan zhig na tshe dang ldan pa mood gal gyi bu chen pos btul te rgyun du zhugs pa'i @38a * //
analyzed: de bsrings shing bskyed nas chen mor gyur te khyim so bzung ba'i rim gyis dus gzhan zhig na tshe dang ldan pa mood gal gyi bu chen pos btul te rgyun du zhugs pa'i @38a * //
translated: Later, the venerable Mahāmaudgalyāyana tamed her, and she became a stream enterer.

original: 'bras bu thob par byas nas bcom ldan 'das la phul ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis skye dgu'i bdag mo chen po goo ta mi la gtad de des de rab tu byung zhing bsnyen par rdzog par byas te /
analyzed: 'bras bu thob par byas nas bcom ldan 'das la phul ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis skye dgu'i bdag mo chen po goo ta mi la gtad de des de rab tu byung zhing bsnyen par rdzog par byas te /
translated: After she had attained the fruit, she offered it to the Blessed One, and the Blessed One entrusted it to Mahāprajāpatī Gautamī, who gave her the going forth and the full ordination.

original: gdams ngag byin nas de gcig pu bden pa bag yod pa brtun pa dang ldan pas bdag nyid gtang bar gnas pa na dgra bcom pa nyid mngon sum du byas so //
analyzed: gdams ngag byin nas de gcig pu bden pa bag yod pa brtun pa dang ldan pas bdag nyid gtang bar gnas pa na dgra bcom pa nyid mngon sum du byas so //
translated: She gave her instructions, and she alone, heedful, ardent, and resolute, lived in ease, having attained the deathless.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /
translated: Then the Blessed One said to the monks,

original: dge slong dag nga'i nyan thos ma rdzu 'phrul che ba mthu che ba rnams kyi nang na 'di lta ste /
analyzed: dge slong dag nga'i nyan thos ma rdzu 'phrul che ba mthu che ba rnams kyi nang na 'di lta ste /
translated: “Monks, among my female disciples who are powerful and mighty,

original: dge slong ma autpa la'i mdog 'di mchog yin no //
analyzed: dge slong ma autpa la'i mdog 'di mchog yin no //
translated: this nun Utpalavarṇā is foremost.

original: autpa la'i mdog gi kun du spyod pa ni bsod snyoms brgyus nas bsod snyoms kyi phud dang por dge 'dun la 'bul zhing /
analyzed: autpa la'i mdog gi kun du spyod pa ni bsod snyoms brgyus nas bsod snyoms kyi phud dang por dge 'dun la 'bul zhing /
translated: Utpalavarṇā’s practice was that after she had gone on alms round, she would offer the first portion of the alms to the Saṅgha.

original: phyis gzhan du brgyus te bdag nyid za bar byed do //
analyzed: phyis gzhan du brgyus te bdag nyid za bar byed do //
translated: Later, he would untie it and eat it himself.🔽One day, after he had gone out for alms, he offered the first portion of his alms to the Saṅgha, and then tied up the rest to eat later.

original: ci tsam dus gzhan zhig na de bsod snyoms la zhugs nas des bsod snyoms kyi phud de dge 'dun la phul nas de'i 'og tu bdag nyid kyi don du brgyus pa dang / dge slong glo bur du 'ongs pa zhig bsod snyoms la zhugs pa na de spyod yul mi mkhas pas ci yang ma rnyed pa de /
analyzed: ci tsam dus gzhan zhig na de bsod snyoms la zhugs nas des bsod snyoms kyi phud de dge 'dun la phul nas de'i 'og tu bdag nyid kyi don du brgyus pa dang / dge slong glo bur du 'ongs pa zhig bsod snyoms la zhugs pa na de spyod yul mi mkhas pas ci yang ma rnyed pa de /
translated: A newly arrived monk, who was unfamiliar with the area, went out for alms and received nothing.

original: autpa la'i mdog gis mthong nas smras pa /
analyzed: autpa la'i mdog gis mthong nas smras pa /
translated: Utpalavarṇā saw him and asked,

original: 'phags pa ci yang ma rnyed dam /
analyzed: 'phags pa ci yang ma rnyed dam /
translated: “Noble one, did you receive anything?”

original: 'phags pa ci yang ma rnyed do //
analyzed: 'phags pa ci yang ma rnyed do //
translated: “Noble one, I received nothing.”

original: des bdag nyid kyi bsod snyoms bsod snyoms pa de la phul nas de'i zan chad par gyur to //
analyzed: des bdag nyid kyi bsod snyoms bsod snyoms pa de la phul nas de'i zan chad par gyur to //
translated: She offered her own alms to him, and so she went without food.

original: nye dgas de mthong nas des bsams pa /
analyzed: nye dgas de mthong nas des bsams pa /
translated: Upasena saw this and thought,

original: sring mo 'di ni dge 'dun la mngon par dad pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi gang zag la yang mngon par dang pa 'dra na 'di bag ma par bya'o snyam nas /
analyzed: sring mo 'di ni dge 'dun la mngon par dad pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi gang zag la yang mngon par dang pa 'dra na 'di bag ma par bya'o snyam nas /
translated: “My sister is not only devoted to the Saṅgha, she is also devoted to individuals. I will marry her.”

original: phyi de nyin par autpa la'i mdog bsod snyoms la zhugs nas des /
analyzed: phyi de nyin par autpa la'i mdog bsod snyoms la zhugs nas des /
translated: The next day, Utpalavarnā went for alms.🔽She offered the first portion of her alms to the Saṅgha and the second portion to herself.

original: bsod snyoms kyi phud de dge 'dun la phul nas bdag nyid kyi don du gnyis pa bsgrub pa dang / nye dgas yang 'ongs nas smras pa /
analyzed: bsod snyoms kyi phud de dge 'dun la phul nas bdag nyid kyi don du gnyis pa bsgrub pa dang / nye dgas yang 'ongs nas smras pa /
translated: Upasena came again and said,

original: 'phags ma rnyed pa cung zad yod dam /
analyzed: 'phags ma rnyed pa cung zad yod dam /
translated: “Noble lady, do you have any alms?”

original: des smras pa /
analyzed: des smras pa /
translated: She said,

original: 'phags pa mchis na gsol bzhed dam //🔽lha'i gnas kyi lhag ma ji lta ba bzhin no //
analyzed: 'phags pa mchis na gsol bzhed dam // lha'i gnas kyi lhag ma ji lta ba bzhin no //
translated: “Noble one, if you have need, I will give you some.”

original: 'phags pa gal te de ltan lhung bzed bzed du gsol /
analyzed: 'phags pa gal te de ltan lhung bzed bzed du gsol /
translated: “Noble one, if that is so, please hold out your alms bowl.”

original: des lhung bzed bzed pa dang / des bsod snyoms de de'i lhung bzed du phul lo //
analyzed: des lhung bzed bzed pa dang / des bsod snyoms de de'i lhung bzed du phul lo //
translated: She held out her alms bowl, and he poured the alms into it.🔽Utpalavarnā, who had gone without food for two days, fainted from weakness and fell to the ground.

original: autpa la'i mdog nyi ma gnyis su zan chad pas nyam chung ba'i sbyor bas brgyal te sa la 'gyel ba dar ma dad pa dag gis glags rnyed nas shes ldan dag autpa la'i mdog 'di 'dod chags dang bral @38b lo zhes grags na sh'akya gzhan nu gzugs bzang
analyzed: autpa la'i mdog nyi ma gnyis su zan chad pas nyam chung ba'i sbyor bas brgyal te sa la 'gyel ba dar ma dad pa dag gis glags rnyed nas shes ldan dag autpa la'i mdog 'di 'dod chags dang bral @38b lo zhes grags na sh'akya gzhan nu gzugs bzang
translated: “Sirs, this Utpalavarnā is said to be free from desire, but she is a woman of passion.

original: ba 'di mthong nas 'dod chags kyis brgyal te sa la 'gyel bar gyur pa ji lta zhes smod pa la zhugs pa'i skabs de dge slang rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //
analyzed: ba 'di mthong nas 'dod chags kyis brgyal te sa la 'gyel bar gyur pa ji lta zhes smod pa la zhugs pa'i skabs de dge slang rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //
translated: The monks reported this to the Blessed One.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byung ba 'di dang / gleng gzhi 'di dang skabs 'di la dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdu ba mdzad de /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byung ba 'di dang / gleng gzhi 'di dang skabs 'di la dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdu ba mdzad de /
translated: Then the Blessed One, with this situation, this basis, and this occasion, gathered the saṅgha of monks

original: nye dga' la rmas nas /
analyzed: nye dga' la rmas nas /
translated: and questioned Upāli:🔽“This is not in accordance with the Dharma, it is not in accordance with the monastic code,

original: dge sbyong gi tshul ma yin pa rjes su mthun pa ma yin pa rung ba ma yin pa /
analyzed: dge sbyong gi tshul ma yin pa rjes su mthun pa ma yin pa rung ba ma yin pa /
translated: it is not a training, and it is not suitable for renunciants.

original: tshul dang mthun pa ma yin pa de ni rab tu byung bas bya ba ma yin no zhes rnam grangs du mar rnam par smad de /
analyzed: tshul dang mthun pa ma yin pa de ni rab tu byung bas bya ba ma yin no zhes rnam grangs du mar rnam par smad de /
translated: This is not to be done by renunciants.”

original: bslab pa bca' ba'i phan yon bcu yang dag par gzigs pas nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul bal bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /
analyzed: bslab pa bca' ba'i phan yon bcu yang dag par gzigs pas nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul bal bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /
translated: Having seen the ten benefits of establishing training rules, he said, “Therefore, the training should be recited like this:

original: yang dge slong gang dge slong ma nye du ma yin pa lam po chen 'dug pa bsod snyoms kyi phyir grong du 'gro ba las bca' ba dang bza' ba rang gi lag gis blangs te 'cha' 'am za na dge slong des phyi rol kun dga' ra bar song
analyzed: yang dge slong gang dge slong ma nye du ma yin pa lam po chen 'dug pa bsod snyoms kyi phyir grong du 'gro ba las bca' ba dang bza' ba rang gi lag gis blangs te 'cha' 'am za na dge slong des phyi rol kun dga' ra bar song
translated: “If any monk, not a relative, receives with his own hands fresh or cooked food from a non-relative nun who is standing in the street and then eats it, that monk should go outside the monastery zone

original: ste dge slong rnams la tshe dang ldan pa dag bdag la smad pa'i gnas mi rigs pa so sor bshags par bya ba byung gis chos de so sor 'chags so zhes so sor bshags par bya ste /
analyzed: ste dge slong rnams la tshe dang ldan pa dag bdag la smad pa'i gnas mi rigs pa so sor bshags par bya ba byung gis chos de so sor 'chags so zhes so sor bshags par bya ste /
translated: and confess his downfall, saying, ‘Venerables, I have done a bad thing that should be confessed. I confess it.’

original: chos 'di ni so sor bshags par bya'o zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
analyzed: chos 'di ni so sor bshags par bya'o zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
translated: This is how the rule should be set forth.

original: yul ni rgyal po'i khab ;
analyzed: yul ni rgyal po'i khab ;
translated: The place was Rājagṛha.

original: gang zag ni nye dga'/
analyzed: gang zag ni nye dga'/
translated: The person was Upacelā.

original: nyon mongs pa ni bag ma gzhug gis tho 'tshams pa /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ni bag ma gzhug gis tho 'tshams pa /
translated: The affliction was disrespect.

original: nyes pa ni dge slong ma nye du ma yin pa lam po chen 'dug pa bsod snyoms kyi phyir grong du 'gro ba las bca' ba dang / bza' ba rang gi lag gis blang ste za ba'o //
analyzed: nyes pa ni dge slong ma nye du ma yin pa lam po chen 'dug pa bsod snyoms kyi phyir grong du 'gro ba las bca' ba dang / bza' ba rang gi lag gis blang ste za ba'o //
translated: The offense is that a monk who is not a relative of a nun, who is sitting on the road, eats food that he himself has received for alms and taken from a village.

original: de la yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni sh'akya'i bu nye dga' 'am gzhan yang de lta bu gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni sh'akya'i bu nye dga' 'am gzhan yang de lta bu gang yin pa'o //
translated: Here, the one who is called a monk is the son of the Śākyas, Upāli, or anyone else who is like him.

original: dge slong ma la zhes bya ba ni chos 'di pa'o //
analyzed: dge slong ma la zhes bya ba ni chos 'di pa'o //
translated: The one who is called a nun is a follower of this Dharma.

original: nye du ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni phyi mo dang mes po phrug la brten pa'i bdun pa tshun chad ni nye du yin la de phan chad ni nye du ma yin no //
analyzed: nye du ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni phyi mo dang mes po phrug la brten pa'i bdun pa tshun chad ni nye du yin la de phan chad ni nye du ma yin no //
translated: One who is not a relative is one who is not a relative up to seven times on the mother's side or the father's side, or one who is not a relative by marriage.

original: lam po che na 'dug ba zhes bya ba ni srad du song ba'o /
analyzed: lam po che na 'dug ba zhes bya ba ni srad du song ba'o /
translated: One who is sitting on the road is one who has gone a distance.

original: bsod snyoms kyi phyir grong du 'gro ba zhes bya ba la grong zhes bya ba ni gang la lam po che dang / srang dang / bzhi mdo dang / sum mdo dag yod pa'o //
analyzed: bsod snyoms kyi phyir grong du 'gro ba zhes bya ba la grong zhes bya ba ni gang la lam po che dang / srang dang / bzhi mdo dang / sum mdo dag yod pa'o //
translated: A village is one in which there are roads, streets, crossroads, and intersections.

original: lam po che zhes bya ba ni gnas nas so //
analyzed: lam po che zhes bya ba ni gnas nas so //
translated: “On the road” means: in a place.

original: bca' ba dang bza' ba zhes bya ba ni bca' ba lnga dang bza' ba lnga'o //
analyzed: bca' ba dang bza' ba zhes bya ba ni bca' ba lnga dang bza' ba lnga'o //
translated: “Food and drink” means: the five foods and the five drinks.

original: rang gi lag gis zhes bya ba ni lag gis lag tu'o //
analyzed: rang gi lag gis zhes bya ba ni lag gis lag tu'o //
translated: “With his own hands” means: from hand to hand.

original: @39a * // blangs te zhes bya ba ni byin len stobs su bcug ste'o //
analyzed: @39a * // blangs te zhes bya ba ni byin len stobs su bcug ste'o //
translated: “Having accepted” means: having received the gift.

original: bca' 'am zan zhes bya ba ni mgul du mid na'o //
analyzed: bca' 'am zan zhes bya ba ni mgul du mid na'o //
translated: “Food and drink” means: having swallowed it into the throat.

original: dge slong des zhes bya ba ni dge slong gang yin pa des so //
analyzed: dge slong des zhes bya ba ni dge slong gang yin pa des so //
translated: “That monk” means: the one who is a monk.

original: phyi rol kun dga' rang ra song ste zhes bya ba ni grong gi phyi rol gtsug lag khang du song ste'o //
analyzed: phyi rol kun dga' rang ra song ste zhes bya ba ni grong gi phyi rol gtsug lag khang du song ste'o //
translated: “Having gone outside to a temple” means: having gone outside the village to a monastery.

original: dge slong rnams la zhes bya ba ni de na dge slong gang dag 'khod pa la'o //
analyzed: dge slong rnams la zhes bya ba ni de na dge slong gang dag 'khod pa la'o //
translated: “To the monks” means: to those monks who are staying there.

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag bdag la smad pa'i gnas zhes bya ba ni smad par byas pa'o //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag bdag la smad pa'i gnas zhes bya ba ni smad par byas pa'o //
translated: “Venerable ones, I have committed a blameworthy act” means: I have done what is blameworthy.

original: mi rigs par zhes bya ba ni tshul dang mi mthun pa'o //
analyzed: mi rigs par zhes bya ba ni tshul dang mi mthun pa'o //
translated: “Unseemly” means: not in accordance with the rules.

original: so sor bshags par bya ba zhes bya ba ni smre sngags 'don pa'i rnam pas mthol bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: so sor bshags par bya ba zhes bya ba ni smre sngags 'don pa'i rnam pas mthol bar bya ba'o //
translated: The phrase should be confessed individually means that one should confess with a sense of regret.

original: byung gis zhes bya ba ni ltung ba byung gis so //
analyzed: byung gis zhes bya ba ni ltung ba byung gis so //
translated: The phrase having occurred means that a downfall has occurred.

original: chos de zhes bya ba ni chos ma yin pa chos kyi sgrar gsungs pa de'o //
analyzed: chos de zhes bya ba ni chos ma yin pa chos kyi sgrar gsungs pa de'o //
translated: The phrase this Dharma refers to the Dharma that is taught under the guise of the Dharma.

original: so sor 'chags so zhes bya ba ni mthol lo zhes so //
analyzed: so sor 'chags so zhes bya ba ni mthol lo zhes so //
translated: The phrase confess individually means that one should confess.

original: so sor bshags par bya ste zhes bya ba ni mthol bar bya ste'o //
analyzed: so sor bshags par bya ste zhes bya ba ni mthol bar bya ste'o //
translated: The phrase should be confessed individually means that one should confess.

original: chos 'di ni so sor bshags par bya'o zhes bya ba ni chos 'di ni mthol bar bya ba ste /
analyzed: chos 'di ni so sor bshags par bya'o zhes bya ba ni chos 'di ni mthol bar bya ba ste /
translated: The phrase this Dharma should be confessed individually means that this Dharma should be confessed.

original: des na so sor bshags par bya ba'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: des na so sor bshags par bya ba'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is called confession.

original: so sor bshags par bya ba'i rnam par gzhag pa ni gtsug lag khang de na dge slong ji snyed 'khod pa la yang rung ji tsam mig sngar snang ba dang thos pa'i nyen kor na 'dug pa dag la yang rung ste /
analyzed: so sor bshags par bya ba'i rnam par gzhag pa ni gtsug lag khang de na dge slong ji snyed 'khod pa la yang rung ji tsam mig sngar snang ba dang thos pa'i nyen kor na 'dug pa dag la yang rung ste /
translated: The presentation of confession is as follows: In this monastery, to all the monks who are present, and to those who are within the range of one's sight and hearing, and who are nearby.

original: de dag la tshe dang ldan pa dag bdag la smad pa'i gnas mi rigs pa so sor bshags par bya ba dge slong ma las zas len pa'am /
analyzed: de dag la tshe dang ldan pa dag bdag la smad pa'i gnas mi rigs pa so sor bshags par bya ba dge slong ma las zas len pa'am /
translated: They should confess that in the presence of a fully ordained monk, saying: Venerable ones, I confess a downfall that is unbecoming and should be confessed individually: accepting food from a fully ordained nun.

original: gzhan yang che ge mo zhig byung gis chos de so sor bshags so zhes smre sngags 'don pa'i rnam pas lan cig de skad ces mthol bar bya zhing de'i 'og tu bshags pa ni dge slong gi mdun du ltung byed bshags par bya ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang che ge mo zhig byung gis chos de so sor bshags so zhes smre sngags 'don pa'i rnam pas lan cig de skad ces mthol bar bya zhing de'i 'og tu bshags pa ni dge slong gi mdun du ltung byed bshags par bya ste /
translated: Or, if it is something else, I confess that downfall.

original: 'di ni ltung byed pas kha na ma thob yang bar bshad do //
analyzed: 'di ni ltung byed pas kha na ma thob yang bar bshad do //
translated: This is explained as a downfall that is a serious violation.

original: de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How does one commit a downfall?

original: 'dir yang dngos gzhi dang / sbyor ba dang / sbyor ba'i sbyor bas ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa dang / ltung ba med pa dang / bslab par bya ba dang / phyir bcos pa rnams kyis 'di'i mtshan nyid shes bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang dngos gzhi dang / sbyor ba dang / sbyor ba'i sbyor bas ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa dang / ltung ba med pa dang / bslab par bya ba dang / phyir bcos pa rnams kyis 'di'i mtshan nyid shes bar bya'o //
translated: Here, one should understand the characteristics of this downfall through the main part, the preparation, the preparation for the preparation, the classification of downfalls, the absence of downfalls, the trainings, and the restoration of vows.

original: de la 'dir yang dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni dge slong bdag nyid grong dam lam po chen 'dug pas dge slong ma nye du ma yin pa de la der 'du shes pas dge slong ma nye du ma yin pa de grong ngam gzhan gang
analyzed: de la 'dir yang dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni dge slong bdag nyid grong dam lam po chen 'dug pas dge slong ma nye du ma yin pa de la der 'du shes pas dge slong ma nye du ma yin pa de grong ngam gzhan gang
translated: Here, the actual basis of a downfall is defined as a monk who, while sitting in a village or at a crossroads, perceives a nonrelative nun to be a nonrelative nun and she offers him food with her own hands.🔽

original: yang rung ba na 'dug pa rang gi lag gis mi 'dri ma pa'i rnam pas bsgrubs shing phul @39b ba'i bca' ba 'am /
analyzed: yang rung ba na 'dug pa rang gi lag gis mi 'dri ma pa'i rnam pas bsgrubs shing phul @39b ba'i bca' ba 'am /
translated: Here, the actual basis of the downfall is defined as follows: A monk who is sitting in a village or on the main road, who perceives a nun who is not a relative as such, and who, with the intention of eating, receives with his own hands food—either cooked or raw—that has been prepared by that nun who is not a relative and that has not been given to her by anyone else, and then eats it in any place other than the nun’s dwelling or on the road.

original: bza' ba dge slong des rang gi lag gis blangs te gnas gang yang rung bar zos na dge slong ma las zas len pa'i so sor bshags par bya ba'i dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bza' ba dge slong des rang gi lag gis blangs te gnas gang yang rung bar zos na dge slong ma las zas len pa'i so sor bshags par bya ba'i dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
translated: If the monk eats the food, he commits an actual downfall.

original: dge slong bdag nyid grong ngam lam po che gang yang rung ba lan 'dug pa la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: dge slong bdag nyid grong ngam lam po che gang yang rung ba lan 'dug pa la na smad pa med do //
translated: If the monk is sitting in a village or on the main road, there is no fault.

original: dge slong ma nye du ma yin pa la der 'du shes pa dang yid gnyis za ba la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: dge slong ma nye du ma yin pa la der 'du shes pa dang yid gnyis za ba la na smad pa med do //
translated: If the nun is a relative, or if the monk perceives her as such, or if he is unsure of this, there is no fault.

original: dge slong ma nye du ma yin pa des /
analyzed: dge slong ma nye du ma yin pa des /
translated: That nun who is not a relative

original: grong ngam gzhan gang yang rung ba na 'dug pa la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: grong ngam gzhan gang yang rung ba na 'dug pa la na smad pa med do //
translated: is not faulted if she is in a village or elsewhere.

original: dge slong ma de rang gi lag gis mi 'dri ma pa'i rnam pas bsgrubs shing phul ba la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: dge slong ma de rang gi lag gis mi 'dri ma pa'i rnam pas bsgrubs shing phul ba la na smad pa med do //
translated: That nun is not faulted if she prepares it with her own hands and offers it without a motive of disrespect.

original: bca' ba lda dang bza' ba lnga gang yang rung ba la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: bca' ba lda dang bza' ba lnga gang yang rung ba la na smad pa med do //
translated: She is not faulted if she offers any of the five kinds of food that are to be chewed or consumed.

original: dge slong des rang gi lag gis blangs pa la na smad pa med do /
analyzed: dge slong des rang gi lag gis blangs pa la na smad pa med do /
translated: That monk is not faulted if he receives it with his own hands.

original: gnas gang yang rung bar thos pa la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: gnas gang yang rung bar thos pa la na smad pa med do //
translated: He is not faulted if he hears it in any place.

original: 'di'i byed pa po ni dge slong ma nye du ma yin pa nyid la 'du shes gtso cher byed pa po nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'di'i byed pa po ni dge slong ma nye du ma yin pa nyid la 'du shes gtso cher byed pa po nyid yin no //
translated: The principal factor in this downfall is that the nun is not a relative.

original: 'di la yan lag lngas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di la yan lag lngas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
translated: There are five factors in the actual downfall:

original: dge slong ma nye du ma yin pa nyid dang / der 'du shes pa nyid dang / gnyis ka lam po che'am grong na 'dug pa nyid dang / bza' ba dang bca' ba'i zas gang yang rung nyid dang / rang gi lag gis blangs te zos pa nyid do //
analyzed: dge slong ma nye du ma yin pa nyid dang / der 'du shes pa nyid dang / gnyis ka lam po che'am grong na 'dug pa nyid dang / bza' ba dang bca' ba'i zas gang yang rung nyid dang / rang gi lag gis blangs te zos pa nyid do //
translated: The four parts are: the nun is not a relative, she is perceived as such, both are seated on a road or in a town, and any food, either to eat or chew, is received with one’s own hand.

original: de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad do //
analyzed: de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad do //
translated: If any of these parts is missing, the downfall is a serious transgression, a minor infraction, or a wrong action, depending on the circumstances.

original: sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas te /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas te /
translated: The downfall of preparation is a minor infraction.

original: ji srid du dge slong ma las zas len pa'i so sor bshags par bya ba'i sbyor ba brtsams nas dngos gzhi la ma thug gi bar du nyes byas te /
analyzed: ji srid du dge slong ma las zas len pa'i so sor bshags par bya ba'i sbyor ba brtsams nas dngos gzhi la ma thug gi bar du nyes byas te /
translated: As long as one has not yet begun to receive food from a nun, one has a minor infraction.

original: dngos gzhi la sbyor ba tha dad pa ji snyed brtsams pa re re la nyes byas re re'o //
analyzed: dngos gzhi la sbyor ba tha dad pa ji snyed brtsams pa re re la nyes byas re re'o //
translated: For each time one begins a different preparation for the actual act, one has a minor infraction.

original: dge slong ma nye du la nye du ma yin par 'du shes pa dang yid gnyis za ba la nyes byas so //
analyzed: dge slong ma nye du la nye du ma yin par 'du shes pa dang yid gnyis za ba la nyes byas so //
translated: If the nun is a relative, but one perceives her as not being a relative, or one is unsure of it, one has a minor infraction.

original: dge slong grong dang lam po chen 'dug pa ma yin pas dge slong ma grong ngam lam po chen 'dug pa las bca' ba dang bza' ba len cing za ba la nyes byas so //
analyzed: dge slong grong dang lam po chen 'dug pa ma yin pas dge slong ma grong ngam lam po chen 'dug pa las bca' ba dang bza' ba len cing za ba la nyes byas so //
translated: If a monk is not in a town or on a highway, and a nun is in a town or on a highway, and he receives and eats fresh or cooked food from her, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: dge slong nam mkha' la 'dug pas blangs te za na nyes byas so //
analyzed: dge slong nam mkha' la 'dug pas blangs te za na nyes byas so //
translated: If a monk receives and eats food while in the sky, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas phra mo ste /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas phra mo ste /
translated: An offense that is a downfall due to a transgression is a minor offense.

original: sbyor ba ji snyed pa la sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'ang de snyed de /
analyzed: sbyor ba ji snyed pa la sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'ang de snyed de /
translated: As many as there are preparations, there are that many preparations that are downfalls due to a transgression.

original: sbyor ba nyes byas kyi sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang nyes byas te nyes byas phra mo'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba nyes byas kyi sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang nyes byas te nyes byas phra mo'o //
translated: A preparation that is a minor offense is also a preparation that is a downfall due to a transgression.

original: ltung ba med pa ni dge slong gtsug lag khang na 'dug pas dge slong ma grong ngam lam po chen 'dug pa las bca' ba dang bza' ba len cing za ba la ltung ba med do //🔽gnyi ga gtsug lag khang na @40a * //
analyzed: ltung ba med pa ni dge slong gtsug lag khang na 'dug pas dge slong ma grong ngam lam po chen 'dug pa las bca' ba dang bza' ba len cing za ba la ltung ba med do // gnyi ga gtsug lag khang na @40a * //
translated: There is no offense if the monk is in a monastery and the nun is in a town or on a highway, and he receives and eats fresh or cooked food from her.

original: 'dug pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: 'dug pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if both are in a monastery.🔽There is no offense if both are in a town or on a highway.

original: dge slong dbyar khang na 'dug pas dge slong ma grong ngam lam po chen 'dug pa las bca' ba dang bza' ba len cing za ba la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: dge slong dbyar khang na 'dug pas dge slong ma grong ngam lam po chen 'dug pa las bca' ba dang bza' ba len cing za ba la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if the monk is staying in a rainy season retreat hut and the nun is staying in a village or on the main road, and he receives and eats fresh or cooked food from her.

original: gnyi ga dbyar khang na 'dug pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: gnyi ga dbyar khang na 'dug pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if both are staying in a rainy season retreat hut.

original: dge slong gnas na 'dug pas dge slong ma grong ngam lam po chen 'dug pa las bca' ba'am bza' ba len cing za ba la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: dge slong gnas na 'dug pas dge slong ma grong ngam lam po chen 'dug pa las bca' ba'am bza' ba len cing za ba la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if the monk is staying in a monastery and the nun is staying in a village or on the main road, and he receives and eats fresh or cooked food from her.

original: gnyi ga gnas na 'dug pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: gnyi ga gnas na 'dug pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if both are staying in a monastery.

original: dge slong mas grong ngam lam po cher zas bzhag nas 'jog par byed pa'i dge slong ma de nyid gung du song ste nye bar mi gnas na dge slong grong ngam lam po chen 'dug pa des yid gcugs pas zas de len cing za ba la ltung ba
analyzed: dge slong mas grong ngam lam po cher zas bzhag nas 'jog par byed pa'i dge slong ma de nyid gung du song ste nye bar mi gnas na dge slong grong ngam lam po chen 'dug pa des yid gcugs pas zas de len cing za ba la ltung ba
translated: If a nun has left food in a village or on the main road and the monk who is to stay near it has gone elsewhere, then there is no offense if a monk staying in a village or on the main road receives and eats that food if he has confidence in it.

original: med do // las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang / sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor ba dag gis nyen pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: med do // las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang / sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor ba dag gis nyen pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if one is a beginner, or insane, or deranged, or in pain due to mental disturbance.

original: bslab par bya ba ni dge slong gis yul thams cad la gnas skabs thams cad du dge slong ma las zan len pa'i so sor bshags par bya bar 'gyur ba rnam pa thams cad mi bsten par bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: bslab par bya ba ni dge slong gis yul thams cad la gnas skabs thams cad du dge slong ma las zan len pa'i so sor bshags par bya bar 'gyur ba rnam pa thams cad mi bsten par bslab par bya'o //
translated: The training rule is that a monk should not accept food from a nun at any time or in any situation, and should train in not doing so.

original: dge slong mas bsod snyoms kyi phud phul ba blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong mas bsod snyoms kyi phud phul ba blang bar bya'o //
translated: A monk should accept the first portion of alms offered by a nun.

original: phyir bcos pa ni so sor bshags par bya ba'i rnam par gzhag pa las shes par bya ste /
analyzed: phyir bcos pa ni so sor bshags par bya ba'i rnam par gzhag pa las shes par bya ste /
translated: The amendment is to be understood from the presentation of the individual confessions.

original: so sor bshags par bya ba ni smre sngags 'don pa'i rnam pas mthol bar bya ba dang / dge slong la bshags par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: so sor bshags par bya ba ni smre sngags 'don pa'i rnam pas mthol bar bya ba dang / dge slong la bshags par bya ba yin no //
translated: The individual confession is to be confessed with the expression of regret and confessed to a monk.

original: de la smre sngags 'don pas mthol bar bya ba ni so sor bshags par bya'o //
analyzed: de la smre sngags 'don pas mthol bar bya ba ni so sor bshags par bya'o //
translated: Among them, the individual confession is to be confessed with the expression of regret.

original: dge 'dun la rig par bya ba'i cho ga dang / sngags kyis bya ste so sor bshags par bya ba dge 'dun la rig par bya ba'i cho ga dang sngags ni 'di ltar bya ste /🔽dge slong la so sor bshags par bya ba byung na de bca' ba'i sems bag tsam yang mi bskyed par gtsug lag khang du song ste gtsug lag khang de na dge slong ji snyed 'khod pa la yang rung ji tsam mig sngar snang ba dang /
analyzed: dge 'dun la rig par bya ba'i cho ga dang / sngags kyis bya ste so sor bshags par bya ba dge 'dun la rig par bya ba'i cho ga dang sngags ni 'di ltar bya ste / dge slong la so sor bshags par bya ba byung na de bca' ba'i sems bag tsam yang mi bskyed par gtsug lag khang du song ste gtsug lag khang de na dge slong ji snyed 'khod pa la yang rung ji tsam mig sngar snang ba dang /
translated: The ritual and mantra for confessing to the Saṅgha is as follows.🔽If a monk has committed an offense that must be confessed to another monk, he should not even entertain the thought of concealing it. He should go to the temple and confess his offense to all the monks who are present in the temple, or to as many as are visible to him, or to those who are staying in the vicinity of the temple.

original: thos pa'i nye 'khor na 'dug pa la yang rung bas mtshams kyi nang na dge slong ji snyed 'khod pa thams cad bsdu ni mi dgos te /
analyzed: thos pa'i nye 'khor na 'dug pa la yang rung bas mtshams kyi nang na dge slong ji snyed 'khod pa thams cad bsdu ni mi dgos te /
translated: He does not need to include all the monks who are within the same boundary.

original: gnas kyi nang du song bas dge slong gang dag mthong ba de dag gi drung du phyin nas kyang gnas khang la sogs pa na 'khod pa dag la yang grags par 'gyur ba de ltar dge slong de dag la phyag 'tshal te rgan pa'i mtha' logs su cog
analyzed: gnas kyi nang du song bas dge slong gang dag mthong ba de dag gi drung du phyin nas kyang gnas khang la sogs pa na 'khod pa dag la yang grags par 'gyur ba de ltar dge slong de dag la phyag 'tshal te rgan pa'i mtha' logs su cog
translated: Even if they are staying in a dwelling place, etc., he should pay homage to those monks, and then sit down in front of the seniormost monk, in a place that is not crowded.

original: pur 'dug nas thal mo sbyar te 'di skad ces brjod par bya'o //🔽tshe dang ldan pa dag bdag la smad pa'i gnas mi @40b rigs pa so sor bshags par bya ba dge slong ma les zas lan pa 'am /
analyzed: pur 'dug nas thal mo sbyar te 'di skad ces brjod par bya'o // tshe dang ldan pa dag bdag la smad pa'i gnas mi @40b rigs pa so sor bshags par bya ba dge slong ma les zas lan pa 'am /
translated: With palms joined, he should say this:🔽“Venerable ones, I have committed an offense that is to be confessed individually, a blameworthy act that should be confessed.🔽I ate food that a nun had requested,🔽or I ate food that a nun had carried to me,

original: gral rims su ma phebs par 'drim du 'jug pa ma bzlog par za ba'am /
analyzed: gral rims su ma phebs par 'drim du 'jug pa ma bzlog par za ba'am /
translated: or I entered a village out of sequence,

original: bslab pa dral te khyim du 'jug pa'am /🔽nags brtags pa las gyur pa'i so sor bshags par bya ba ming dang rigs che ge mo zhig byung gis chos de so sor 'chags so zhes lan cig brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: bslab pa dral te khyim du 'jug pa'am /🔽nags brtags pa las gyur pa'i so sor bshags par bya ba ming dang rigs che ge mo zhig byung gis chos de so sor 'chags so zhes lan cig brjod par bya'o //
translated: or I entered a house out of sequence.🔽I confess that offense.”

original: 'di ni smre sngags 'don pa'i rnam pa brjod pas so sor bshags par bya ba nyid du gsungs pa yin gyis bshags par bya ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni smre sngags 'don pa'i rnam pa brjod pas so sor bshags par bya ba nyid du gsungs pa yin gyis bshags par bya ba ni ma yin no //
translated: This is said to be a confession of regret, not a confession of a downfall.

original: de'i 'og tu bshags pa ni dge slong gi mdun du ltung byed bshags pa bzhin du bshags par bya ste ;
analyzed: de'i 'og tu bshags pa ni dge slong gi mdun du ltung byed bshags pa bzhin du bshags par bya ste ;
translated: After that, the confession is like the confession of a downfall in the presence of a fully ordained monk.

original: de ltar ltung byed kyi ltung ba byung bas gcig gi mdun du bshags par bya bar gsungs pa dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: de ltar ltung byed kyi ltung ba byung bas gcig gi mdun du bshags par bya bar gsungs pa dang 'dra ste /
translated: It is like the statement that when a downfall of a novice monk occurs, it should be confessed in the presence of one [monk].

original: so sor bshags par bya ba'i phyir bcos pa ni de lta bu yin no //
analyzed: so sor bshags par bya ba'i phyir bcos pa ni de lta bu yin no //
translated: This is the way to amend a downfall that is to be confessed.

original: dge slong ma la zas len pa'i so sor bshags par bya ba ste dang po bshad zin to /
analyzed: dge slong ma la zas len pa'i so sor bshags par bya ba ste dang po bshad zin to /
translated: The confession of receiving food from a fully ordained nun has already been explained.

original: // / gral rims su ma phebs par 'drim du 'jug pa la bzlog par za ba'i so sor bshags par bya ba'i gleng gzhi ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
analyzed: // / gral rims su ma phebs par 'drim du 'jug pa la bzlog par za ba'i so sor bshags par bya ba'i gleng gzhi ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
translated: The origin story of the confession of eating while turning away from the server who is not in the proper order of seniority is this. The Blessed Buddha was staying in Śrāvastī, in Jeta’s Grove, in the park of Anāthapiṇḍada.

original: de'i tshe mu ge nyam nga ba chen po dgon pa'i slong mo bas zas rnyed par dka' zhing pha ma dag kyang rang gi bu dag la zas sbyin pa dang bya bar sems par dka' na slong mo ba dag la lta smos kyang ci dgos pa byung ngo
analyzed: de'i tshe mu ge nyam nga ba chen po dgon pa'i slong mo bas zas rnyed par dka' zhing pha ma dag kyang rang gi bu dag la zas sbyin pa dang bya bar sems par dka' na slong mo ba dag la lta smos kyang ci dgos pa byung ngo
translated: At that time, there was a great famine, and it was difficult for beggars in the wilderness to find food. It was difficult for parents to think about giving food to their own children, let alone to beggars.

original: // drug sde dag nga dro sham thabs bgos /
analyzed: // drug sde dag nga dro sham thabs bgos /
translated: The group of six put on their lower robes,🔽took their alms bowls and Dharma robes, and entered Śrāvastī for alms. Some received, some did not. Suffering from hunger, they went to the group of twelve.

original: lhung bzed dang chos gos thogs te mnyan yod du bsod snyoms la zhugs pa dang / la las ni thob la las ni ma thob nas de dag bkres pas nyen nas bcu gnyis sde dag gi gan du song ba dang / de dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: lhung bzed dang chos gos thogs te mnyan yod du bsod snyoms la zhugs pa dang / la las ni thob la las ni ma thob nas de dag bkres pas nyen nas bcu gnyis sde dag gi gan du song ba dang / de dag gis smras pa /
translated: They said,

original: 'phags pa dag 'tsho 'am /
analyzed: 'phags pa dag 'tsho 'am /
translated: “Noble ones, are you living well?”

original: sring mo dag 'di na ci ltar 'tsho //
analyzed: sring mo dag 'di na ci ltar 'tsho //
translated: “Sisters, how can we live here?”

original: kho bo dag bkres pas nyen to //
analyzed: kho bo dag bkres pas nyen to //
translated: “Noble ones, we are suffering from hunger.”

original: 'phags pa dag gal te de lta na sang spyon cig dang zhal sus gsol lo //
analyzed: 'phags pa dag gal te de lta na sang spyon cig dang zhal sus gsol lo //
translated: “Noble ones, if that is so, come tomorrow. Whoever has food will give it.”

original: sring mo dag sang khyed kyis sbyin na gnang sus sbyin /
analyzed: sring mo dag sang khyed kyis sbyin na gnang sus sbyin /
translated: “Sisters, if you give tomorrow, who will give today?”

original: 'phags pa dag bdag cag nyid kyis gsol lo //
analyzed: 'phags pa dag bdag cag nyid kyis gsol lo //
translated: Noble ones, we will do it ourselves.

original: sring mo dag de ltar 'tsho bar mi nus kyis 'di ltar sangs rgyas la sogs pa dge slong gi dge 'dun gang du spyan drangs pa der khyed cag gi zhal ta gyis la kho bo cag la yang dang yang du byin cig dang de lta na kho bo
analyzed: sring mo dag de ltar 'tsho bar mi nus kyis 'di ltar sangs rgyas la sogs pa dge slong gi dge 'dun gang du spyan drangs pa der khyed cag gi zhal ta gyis la kho bo cag la yang dang yang du byin cig dang de lta na kho bo
translated: Sisters, we cannot live like that. So, wherever you invite the Buddha and the rest of the saṅgha of monks, you must serve them and give to us again and again. In that way

original: cag 'tsho bar 'gyur ro //🔽sbom dga' @41a * //
analyzed: cag 'tsho bar 'gyur ro // sbom dga' @41a * //
translated: we will live.

original: mos smras pa /
analyzed: mos smras pa /
translated: Pramudita said,

original: gal te rung na ma nongs kyis de bzhin du bgyi'o //
analyzed: gal te rung na ma nongs kyis de bzhin du bgyi'o //
translated: If it is suitable, there is no fault. We will do it that way.

original: ci tsam na khyim bdag cig gis sangs rgyas la sogs pa dge slong gi dge 'dun khyim gzhan du gdugs tshod la spyan drangs pa dang dge slong gi dge 'dun ni zhugs so //
analyzed: ci tsam na khyim bdag cig gis sangs rgyas la sogs pa dge slong gi dge 'dun khyim gzhan du gdugs tshod la spyan drangs pa dang dge slong gi dge 'dun ni zhugs so //
translated: Then a certain householder invited the Buddha and the rest of the saṅgha of monks to a meal in his house. The saṅgha of monks departed,

original: bcom ldan 'das ni 'dul ba la nyan thos rnams kyi bslab pa'i gzhi 'cha' bar bzhed pas gtsug lag khang na bzhugs shing mnos te gsol to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni 'dul ba la nyan thos rnams kyi bslab pa'i gzhi 'cha' bar bzhed pas gtsug lag khang na bzhugs shing mnos te gsol to //
translated: but the Blessed One, wishing to lay down a basis for training the disciples in the Vinaya, remained in the monastery and accepted the invitation.

original: khyim bdag de nang mi dang bcas pas dge slong gi dge 'dun la brim par brtsams pa dang sbom dga' mo rgan pa'i mtha' logs su 'dug nas smras pa /
analyzed: khyim bdag de nang mi dang bcas pas dge slong gi dge 'dun la brim par brtsams pa dang sbom dga' mo rgan pa'i mtha' logs su 'dug nas smras pa /
translated: Pramudita sat at the end of the row of elders and said,

original: khyim bdag 'di ni 'phags pa dga' bo ste /
analyzed: khyim bdag 'di ni 'phags pa dga' bo ste /
translated: “Householder, this is the noble Nanda.

original: sh'akya rab tu byung ba sde snod gsum dang ldan pa chos sgrogs pa rigs pa dang grol ba'i spobs pa can yin gyis 'di la yang gsol cig /'di ni 'phags pa nye dga' bo //
analyzed: sh'akya rab tu byung ba sde snod gsum dang ldan pa chos sgrogs pa rigs pa dang grol ba'i spobs pa can yin gyis 'di la yang gsol cig /'di ni 'phags pa nye dga' bo //
translated: He is a Sakyan who went forth and possesses the three scriptural collections. He is a Dharma teacher with the eloquence of knowledge and freedom. Serve him too. This is the noble Upandaka.

original: 'di ni 'phags pa 'gro mgyogs so //🔽'di ni na ba so'o //
analyzed: 'di ni 'phags pa 'gro mgyogs so // 'di ni na ba so'o //
translated: This is the noble Gavampati.🔽This is the sick one.

original: 'di ni 'dun pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ni 'dun pa ste /
translated: This is Chunda.

original: 'di dag kyang sh'akya rab tu byung ba sde snod gsum dang ldan pa chos sgrogs pa rigs pa dang grol ba'i spobs pa can yin gyis /
analyzed: 'di dag kyang sh'akya rab tu byung ba sde snod gsum dang ldan pa chos sgrogs pa rigs pa dang grol ba'i spobs pa can yin gyis /
translated: These are Sakyans who went forth and possess the three scriptural collections. They are Dharma teachers with the eloquence of knowledge and freedom.

original: 'di dag la yang yang gsol cig /'di ni 'phags pa 'char ka ste /
analyzed: 'di dag la yang yang gsol cig /'di ni 'phags pa 'char ka ste /
translated: Serve them too. This is the noble Udayi.

original: bram ze mdun na 'don gyi bu rab tu byung ba sde snod gsum dang ldan pa /
analyzed: bram ze mdun na 'don gyi bu rab tu byung ba sde snod gsum dang ldan pa /
translated: He is the son of the brahmin chief minister who went forth and possesses the three scriptural collections.

original: chos sgrogs pa /
analyzed: chos sgrogs pa /
translated: He is a Dharma teacher with the eloquence of knowledge and freedom.

original: rigs pa dang grol ba'i spobs pa can yin gyis /
analyzed: rigs pa dang grol ba'i spobs pa can yin gyis /
translated: He is endowed with the eloquence of reasoning and liberation.🔽Again and again, ask him for this.”

original: 'di la yang yang gsol cig / khyim bdag nges de bzhin du de dag la yang dang yang du byin no //
analyzed: 'di la yang yang gsol cig / khyim bdag nges de bzhin du de dag la yang dang yang du byin no //
translated: The householder did just as he was told and again and again gave to them.

original: de bzhin du sbom dga' mos 'dri ma mkhan dag la smras nas /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbom dga' mos 'dri ma mkhan dag la smras nas /
translated: In the same way, Abhaya told the bath attendants,

original: de dag gis kyang de bzhin du de dag la yang dang yang du byin no //
analyzed: de dag gis kyang de bzhin du de dag la yang dang yang du byin no //
translated: and they too gave to them again and again.

original: de na dge slong kha cig la ni 'bras chan chad /🔽kha cig la ni tshod ma chad /
analyzed: de na dge slong kha cig la ni 'bras chan chad / kha cig la ni tshod ma chad /
translated: Then some monks ran out of rice,🔽some ran out of vegetables,

original: kha cig la ni bca' ba chad /
analyzed: kha cig la ni bca' ba chad /
translated: some ran out of flour,

original: kha cig la ni bza' ba chad /🔽kha cig gis ni zas cung zad thob nas zan chad par gyur /
analyzed: kha cig la ni bza' ba chad / kha cig gis ni zas cung zad thob nas zan chad par gyur /
translated: some ran out of food,🔽and some, having obtained a little food, ran out of food.

original: kha cig gis ni zan ma thob par zan chad par gyur to //
analyzed: kha cig gis ni zan ma thob par zan chad par gyur to //
translated: Some, having not obtained any food, ran out of food.🔽Then some monks who had all the fetters,

original: de na dge slong gang dag 'ching ba mtha' dag yod pa de dag gis khyim bdag de la tho 'tshams pa /
analyzed: de na dge slong gang dag 'ching ba mtha' dag yod pa de dag gis khyim bdag de la tho 'tshams pa /
translated: harassed that householder,🔽saying, “Householder, give us food.”

original: khyim bdag gal te khyod la 'byor ba med na ci'i phyir sangs rgyas la sogs pa dge slong gi dge 'dun spyan drang bar byed /
analyzed: khyim bdag gal te khyod la 'byor ba med na ci'i phyir sangs rgyas la sogs pa dge slong gi dge 'dun spyan drang bar byed /
translated: “Householder, if you have no wealth, why do you invite the Buddha and the rest of the saṅgha of monks?”

original: des smras pa /
analyzed: des smras pa /
translated: He said,

original: 'phags pa dag bdag gis zhal zas mang po sta gon bgyis na sbom dga' mo bgres pa'i mtha' logs su mchis pas @41b bgres pa'i mtha' logs su 'ba' zhig tu yang dang yang du stobs su stsal nas de la bdag gis ji ltar bgyi zhes zer ba'i skabs
analyzed: 'phags pa dag bdag gis zhal zas mang po sta gon bgyis na sbom dga' mo bgres pa'i mtha' logs su mchis pas @41b bgres pa'i mtha' logs su 'ba' zhig tu yang dang yang du stobs su stsal nas de la bdag gis ji ltar bgyi zhes zer ba'i skabs
translated: “Noble ones, I have prepared a lot of food, but because Thullanandā is at the head of the row, she has repeatedly demanded that I serve only her. What should I do about this?”

original: de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //🔽de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byung ba 'di dang / gleng gzhi 'di dang / skabs 'di la dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdu ba mdzad de /
analyzed: de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to // de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byung ba 'di dang / gleng gzhi 'di dang / skabs 'di la dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdu ba mdzad de /
translated: The monks reported this matter to the Blessed One.🔽Then the Blessed One, having gathered the saṅgha of monks, asked the group of six,

original: drug sde dag la rmas nas /
analyzed: drug sde dag la rmas nas /
translated: “Is it true that you did this?”

original: dge sbyong gi tshul ma yin pa /🔽rjes su mthun pa ma yin pa /
analyzed: dge sbyong gi tshul ma yin pa / rjes su mthun pa ma yin pa /
translated: “It is not the way of the virtuous.🔽It is not suitable.

original: rung ba ma yin pa /
analyzed: rung ba ma yin pa /
translated: It is not proper.

original: tshul dang mthun pa ma yin pa de ni rab tu byung bas bya ba ma yin no zhes rnam grangs du mar rnam bar smad de /
analyzed: tshul dang mthun pa ma yin pa de ni rab tu byung bas bya ba ma yin no zhes rnam grangs du mar rnam bar smad de /
translated: That is not proper for one gone forth.

original: bslab pa bca' ba'i phan yon bcu yang dag par gzigs pas nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /🔽dge slong rab tu mang po khyim rnams su mgron du bos nas zan za ba'i tshe de na gal te dge slong ma zhig 'di la ni bca' ba byin cig 'di la ni 'bras chan byin cig /'di la ni sran tshod byin cig 'di la ni yang byin
analyzed: bslab pa bca' ba'i phan yon bcu yang dag par gzigs pas nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste / dge slong rab tu mang po khyim rnams su mgron du bos nas zan za ba'i tshe de na gal te dge slong ma zhig 'di la ni bca' ba byin cig 'di la ni 'bras chan byin cig /'di la ni sran tshod byin cig 'di la ni yang byin
translated: Having seen the ten benefits, the Blessed One laid down rules for training the monks:

original: cig ces bsgo zhing 'dug na dge slong ma de la dge slong de rnams kyis 'di skad ces srid mo khyod dge slong rnams zan za ba'i bar du re zhig sdod cig ces bsgo bar bya'o //
analyzed: cig ces bsgo zhing 'dug na dge slong ma de la dge slong de rnams kyis 'di skad ces srid mo khyod dge slong rnams zan za ba'i bar du re zhig sdod cig ces bsgo bar bya'o //
translated: “If many monks are invited to a house to eat and a nun is there saying, ‘Give this to them, give that to them,’ then the monks should say to that nun, ‘Sister, please wait until the monks have finished eating.’

original: gal te dge slong gcig gis kyang dge slong ma de la de skad smra bar ma spobs na dge slong de dag thams cad kyis phyi rol du kun dga' ra bar song ste /
analyzed: gal te dge slong gcig gis kyang dge slong ma de la de skad smra bar ma spobs na dge slong de dag thams cad kyis phyi rol du kun dga' ra bar song ste /
translated: If not a single monk has the courage to say that to the nun, then all those monks should go outside the monastery

original: dge slong rnams la tshe dang ldan pa dag bdag cag la smad pa'i gnas mi rigs pa so sor bshags pa bya ba byung gis chos de so sor 'chags so zhes so sor bshags par bya ste /
analyzed: dge slong rnams la tshe dang ldan pa dag bdag cag la smad pa'i gnas mi rigs pa so sor bshags pa bya ba byung gis chos de so sor 'chags so zhes so sor bshags par bya ste /
translated: and confess their fault to the other monks, saying, ‘Venerables, we have committed an act of censure, an act that should be confessed individually. We confess that fault.’🔽This is the rule that should be confessed.

original: chos 'di yang so sor bshags par bya'o zhes bca' ba mdzad de yul ni mnyan yod /
analyzed: chos 'di yang so sor bshags par bya'o zhes bca' ba mdzad de yul ni mnyan yod /
translated: The place was Śrāvastī.🔽The person was a large number of monks.

original: gang zag ni dge slong rab tu mang po dag / nyon mongs pa ni ngo bzlog mi phod pa /
analyzed: gang zag ni dge slong rab tu mang po dag / nyon mongs pa ni ngo bzlog mi phod pa /
translated: The affliction was not being able to withstand criticism.

original: nyes pa ni gral rims su ma phebs par 'drim du 'jug pa'i dge slong ma ma bzlog par za ba'o //
analyzed: nyes pa ni gral rims su ma phebs par 'drim du 'jug pa'i dge slong ma ma bzlog par za ba'o //
translated: The offense was eating without having stopped a nun from serving food out of turn.

original: de la dge slong rab tu mang po zhes bya ba ni gnyis las lhag pa zhes bya ba mang pa'o //
analyzed: de la dge slong rab tu mang po zhes bya ba ni gnyis las lhag pa zhes bya ba mang pa'o //
translated: A large number of monks is two or more.

original: khyim rnams su zhes bya ba ni bram ze dang khyim bdag gi khyim rnams su'o //
analyzed: khyim rnams su zhes bya ba ni bram ze dang khyim bdag gi khyim rnams su'o //
translated: “In the houses” means in the houses of brahmins and householders.

original: mgron du bos nas zhes bya ba ni zan gyi phyir ro //
analyzed: mgron du bos nas zhes bya ba ni zan gyi phyir ro //
translated: “Having been invited” means for the sake of food.

original: zan za ba'i tshe zhes bya ba ni bza' ba lnga dang bca' ba lnga po dag go //
analyzed: zan za ba'i tshe zhes bya ba ni bza' ba lnga dang bca' ba lnga po dag go //
translated: “When they are eating” means the five foods and the five edibles.

original: de na gal te dge slong ma zhig ces bya ba ni sbom dga' mo 'am gzhan yang de lta bu gang @42a * //
analyzed: de na gal te dge slong ma zhig ces bya ba ni sbom dga' mo 'am gzhan yang de lta bu gang @42a * //
translated: “If a nun” means Thullanandā or anyone else like her.

original: yin pa'o // dge slong ma de la zhes bya ba ni spom dga' mo 'am gzhan yang de lta bu gang yin pa de la'o //
analyzed: yin pa'o // dge slong ma de la zhes bya ba ni spom dga' mo 'am gzhan yang de lta bu gang yin pa de la'o //
translated: “To that nun” means to Thullanandā or anyone else like her.

original: dge slong de rnams kyis zhes bya ba ni de na dge slong gang dag 'khod pa rnams kyis so //
analyzed: dge slong de rnams kyis zhes bya ba ni de na dge slong gang dag 'khod pa rnams kyis so //
translated: “Those monks” means those monks who are present there.

original: 'di skad ces zhes bya ba ni 'di skad ces bsgo bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'di skad ces zhes bya ba ni 'di skad ces bsgo bar bya'o //
translated: “They should say” means they should say this.

original: sring mo khyed dge slong rnams zan za ba'i bar du re zhig cig sdod cig ces bsgo bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sring mo khyed dge slong rnams zan za ba'i bar du re zhig cig sdod cig ces bsgo bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Sister, please wait until the monks have finished eating” means

original: srid mo khyod dge slong rnams zan za ba'i bar du re zhig yud tsam cig kha rog par sdod cig ces brjod par bya ba'o //
analyzed: srid mo khyod dge slong rnams zan za ba'i bar du re zhig yud tsam cig kha rog par sdod cig ces brjod par bya ba'o //
translated: “Elder sister, you should remain silent for a while until the monks have finished eating.”

original: gal te dge slong gcig gis kyang dge slong ma de la de skad smra bar ma spobs na zhes bya ba ni gal te dge slong gcig gis kyang dge slong ma de la de skad ma smras na'o //
analyzed: gal te dge slong gcig gis kyang dge slong ma de la de skad smra bar ma spobs na zhes bya ba ni gal te dge slong gcig gis kyang dge slong ma de la de skad ma smras na'o //
translated: If not a single monk has the courage to say this to that nun,

original: dge slong de dag thams cad kyis zhes bya ba ni de na dge slong gang dag 'khod pa de dag thams cad kyis so //
analyzed: dge slong de dag thams cad kyis zhes bya ba ni de na dge slong gang dag 'khod pa de dag thams cad kyis so //
translated: then all those monks

original: phyi rol kun dga' ra bar song ste zhes bya ba ni grong gi phyi rol gtsug lag khang du song ste'o ;
analyzed: phyi rol kun dga' ra bar song ste zhes bya ba ni grong gi phyi rol gtsug lag khang du song ste'o ;
translated: should go outside the monastery grounds🔽and confess their offense to the other monks, saying,

original: / dge slong rnams la tshe dang ldan pa dag bdag cag la smad pa'i gnas mi rigs pa so sor bshags par bya ba byung gis chos de so sor 'chags so zhes so sor bshags par bya ste /
analyzed: / dge slong rnams la tshe dang ldan pa dag bdag cag la smad pa'i gnas mi rigs pa so sor bshags par bya ba byung gis chos de so sor 'chags so zhes so sor bshags par bya ste /
translated: “Venerables, we have committed an offense that is to be individually confessed. We confess this offense.”

original: chos 'di yang so sor bshags par bya'o zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: chos 'di yang so sor bshags par bya'o zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: This Dharma should be confessed individually.

original: de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is the downfall here?

original: 'dir yang dngos gzhi dang / sbyor ba dang / sbyor ba'i sbyor bas ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa dang / ltung ba med pa dang / bslab par bya ba dang / phyir bcos pa rnams kyis 'di'i mtshan nyid shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang dngos gzhi dang / sbyor ba dang / sbyor ba'i sbyor bas ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa dang / ltung ba med pa dang / bslab par bya ba dang / phyir bcos pa rnams kyis 'di'i mtshan nyid shes par bya'o //
translated: Here, the downfall should be understood by the characteristics of the basic downfall, the preparatory action, the action of preparation, the non-downfalls, the trainings, and the restoration.

original: de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni khyim mam dgon pa dang gtsug lag khang la sogs par sbyin bdag khyim mi thams cad 'dus pa'am /
analyzed: de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni khyim mam dgon pa dang gtsug lag khang la sogs par sbyin bdag khyim mi thams cad 'dus pa'am /
translated: Here, the basic downfall is as follows: whether in a house, a forest, a temple, and so on, if all the lay people who are benefactors gather, or if the monks gather, and if one does not go to them,

original: des bskos pa la sogs pas zan sbyar bar dge slong gsum la sogs par mgron du bos te zan za ba'i tshe de na dge slong ma de'i tshig gis sam de'i nye dus mgron du bos pa ma yin pa byug ris ston pa dang / ma byin pa la sbyin du 'jug pa ma gtogs pa zhig dge slong ltung ba 'byin pa po de'am /
analyzed: des bskos pa la sogs pas zan sbyar bar dge slong gsum la sogs par mgron du bos te zan za ba'i tshe de na dge slong ma de'i tshig gis sam de'i nye dus mgron du bos pa ma yin pa byug ris ston pa dang / ma byin pa la sbyin du 'jug pa ma gtogs pa zhig dge slong ltung ba 'byin pa po de'am /
translated: A monk who is invited to a meal prepared by a nun, or by someone appointed by her, and so on, and who, except for showing a painting or making someone give what is not given,

original: dge slong gzhan la 'di la bca' ba'am /
analyzed: dge slong gzhan la 'di la bca' ba'am /
translated: encourages a monk who has committed a downfall,🔽saying, “Give this to him to eat,

original: btung ba'am / sran tshod dam bza' ba'am /
analyzed: btung ba'am / sran tshod dam bza' ba'am /
translated: drink, or to eat soup or rice,🔽again and again,”

original: yang dang yang byin cig bya ba la sogs pas bsko sham byed pa la zhugs pa de la dge slong gang yang rung ba zan gcig pa @42b nyid yin la /
analyzed: yang dang yang byin cig bya ba la sogs pas bsko sham byed pa la zhugs pa de la dge slong gang yang rung ba zan gcig pa @42b nyid yin la /
translated: and who, whether he eats together with the nun

original: lhan cig za ba 'am /🔽lhan cig mi za bas kyang rung ste /
analyzed: lhan cig za ba 'am /🔽lhan cig mi za bas kyang rung ste /
translated: or not,

original: rang ngam gzhan gang yang rung bas srid mo khyod dge slong rnams zan zos kyi bar du re zhig sdod cig ces ma bsgo bar dge slong gsum la sogs pa mgron du bos pas zos na bsgo ba'i tshig de nye bar gdags su mi rung ba tsam du
analyzed: rang ngam gzhan gang yang rung bas srid mo khyod dge slong rnams zan zos kyi bar du re zhig sdod cig ces ma bsgo bar dge slong gsum la sogs pa mgron du bos pas zos na bsgo ba'i tshig de nye bar gdags su mi rung ba tsam du
translated: Whether oneself or another, if one invites three or more monks to eat, without the announcement, “Elder sister, please wait until the monks have eaten,” then

original: thag ring ba ma gtogs pa dang / bsgo ba nyid 'du shes med na gral rims su ma phebs par 'drim du bcug ba ma bzlog par za ba'i so sor bshags par bya ba'i dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thag ring ba ma gtogs pa dang / bsgo ba nyid 'du shes med na gral rims su ma phebs par 'drim du bcug ba ma bzlog par za ba'i so sor bshags par bya ba'i dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
translated: except for the case of a great distance, it is a downfall to eat without stopping the invitation.

original: bram ze dang khyim bdag gi khyim du mgron du bos pa dang / dgon pa dang gtsug lag khang la sogs par sbyin bdag khyim gyi mi thams cad 'dus pa 'am /
analyzed: bram ze dang khyim bdag gi khyim du mgron du bos pa dang / dgon pa dang gtsug lag khang la sogs par sbyin bdag khyim gyi mi thams cad 'dus pa 'am /
translated: If one eats in a house of a brahman or householder who has invited one, or in a temple or monastery where all the householders appointed as benefactors have gathered,

original: des bskos pa la sogs pa'i zan sbyar ba'i gnas gang yang rung ba la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: des bskos pa la sogs pa'i zan sbyar ba'i gnas gang yang rung ba la na smad pa med do //
translated: or in any place where food is prepared by the benefactors themselves, there is no fault.

original: dge slong gsum la sogs pa mgron du bos pas zos pa la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: dge slong gsum la sogs pa mgron du bos pas zos pa la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if the monk is invited to eat by three or more fully ordained monks.

original: dge slong ma de'i tshig gis sam de'i nye dus mgron du bos pa ma yin pa la na smad pa med do //🔽dge slong ma de dge slong gi gral 'dir je rims shig de'i 'og tu 'dir rims shig ces bya ba la sogs pas gral rims bzhin du gral gyi mgo dang mdun du dkyil 'khor gyis byug ris ston pa dang / gral thod rgal du 'das shing gong ma ma byin pa la byin du 'jug pa ma gtogs pa la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: dge slong ma de'i tshig gis sam de'i nye dus mgron du bos pa ma yin pa la na smad pa med do // dge slong ma de dge slong gi gral 'dir je rims shig de'i 'og tu 'dir rims shig ces bya ba la sogs pas gral rims bzhin du gral gyi mgo dang mdun du dkyil 'khor gyis byug ris ston pa dang / gral thod rgal du 'das shing gong ma ma byin pa la byin du 'jug pa ma gtogs pa la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if the monk is not invited by the words of that fully ordained nun or by the words of her relatives.🔽There is no offense if the fully ordained nun is seated in the order of the monks, either in the order of seniority or in the order of the day of ordination, and if the monk is seated in the order of the fully ordained nuns, either in the order of seniority or in the order of the day of ordination.

original: dge slong ltung ba byung ba 'byin pa po de 'am dge slong mang bo gzhan gang yang rung ba la bsgo sham med pa la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: dge slong ltung ba byung ba 'byin pa po de 'am dge slong mang bo gzhan gang yang rung ba la bsgo sham med pa la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if the monk is not a monk who has committed a defeating offense, and if he is not a monk who is expelling a monk who has committed a defeating offense.

original: 'di la bca' ba 'am btung ba'am sran tshod dam bza' ba byin cig ces bya ba la sogs pas bsko sham byed pa la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: 'di la bca' ba 'am btung ba'am sran tshod dam bza' ba byin cig ces bya ba la sogs pas bsko sham byed pa la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if she is invited to a meal of staple or non-staple food, or to a meal of porridge or a meal of mung-bean soup, etc.

original: dge slong ma de la der tshogs ba'i dge slong gang yang rung ba dang / ston mo gcig la lhan cig za ba dang / lhan cig mi za bar rung ngam gzhan gang yang rung bas ma bsgo ba la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: dge slong ma de la der tshogs ba'i dge slong gang yang rung ba dang / ston mo gcig la lhan cig za ba dang / lhan cig mi za bar rung ngam gzhan gang yang rung bas ma bsgo ba la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if she is not invited by any of the monks who are present there, or by any other monk, whether they are eating together or not.

original: dge slong ma de la srid mo khyod dge slong rnams zan zos kyi bar du re zhig sdong cig ces bya ba la sogs pa bzlog par bya ba'i tshig gang yang rung bas ma bzlog pa la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: dge slong ma de la srid mo khyod dge slong rnams zan zos kyi bar du re zhig sdong cig ces bya ba la sogs pa bzlog par bya ba'i tshig gang yang rung bas ma bzlog pa la na smad pa med do //
