translated: When children beg from him, he should not give them whole pieces of food, but should give them after breaking them into pieces.

original: ga gon dang la phug la sogs pa 'bras bu dang rtsa ba dag dang ldam ldum la sogs pa tshod ma khyim nas byung ba blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: ga gon dang la phug la sogs pa 'bras bu dang rtsa ba dag dang ldam ldum la sogs pa tshod ma khyim nas byung ba blang bar bya'o //
translated: He should accept fruits and roots such as eggplant and lotus root, and vegetables such as nettles that have been brought from the home.

original: de ni slob pa la khyim gyi bslab pa'i sdom pa sbyin pa'i cho ga dang las so //
analyzed: de ni slob pa la khyim gyi bslab pa'i sdom pa sbyin pa'i cho ga dang las so //
translated: This is the ritual and the rite for giving the lay vows of training to a householder.

original: dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das kyi bka' bzhin du de la bslab pa'i sdom pa byin nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu dang / mood gal gyi bu gnyis sngar mgron du bos pa yang de'i khyim du ma dong ba dang / de nas dmag dpon seng ges kha zas sta gon du byas nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu dang mood gal gyi bu chen po gnyis gal bder song ste phyin nas rkang pa gnyis la spyi bos phyag 'tshal te 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das kyi bka' bzhin du de la bslab pa'i sdom pa byin nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu dang / mood gal gyi bu gnyis sngar mgron du bos pa yang de'i khyim du ma dong ba dang / de nas dmag dpon seng ges kha zas sta gon du byas nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu dang mood gal gyi bu chen po gnyis gal bder song ste phyin nas rkang pa gnyis la spyi bos phyag 'tshal te 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: The monks, in accordance with the Buddha’s instructions, gave him the precepts of the novice monk.🔽The venerable Śāriputra and Maudgalyāyana, who had been invited to eat there before, did not go to his house.🔽Then the general Siṃha, having prepared the food, went to where the venerable Śāriputra and the great Maudgalyāyana were. When he arrived, he bowed his head at their two feet and said this:

original: 'phags pa gnyis gdugs tshod g-yar dgongs 'tshal na /
analyzed: 'phags pa gnyis gdugs tshod g-yar dgongs 'tshal na /
translated: “Noble ones, please remember your promise to eat at my house.

original: da de'i dus la bab par dgongs su gsol /
analyzed: da de'i dus la bab par dgongs su gsol /
translated: Please consider that the time has come.”

original: de gnyis kyis smras pa /
analyzed: de gnyis kyis smras pa /
translated: Those two said,

original: khyim bdag khyod la dge 'dun gyi bslab pa'i sdom pa byin gyis mi 'gro'o ;
analyzed: khyim bdag khyod la dge 'dun gyi bslab pa'i sdom pa byin gyis mi 'gro'o ;
translated: “Householder, we will not go to give the Saṅgha’s precepts of training to you.”

original: / des smras pa 'phags pa gnyis bdag gis khyad gnyis spyan drangs kyis gshegs su gsol /
analyzed: / des smras pa 'phags pa gnyis bdag gis khyad gnyis spyan drangs kyis gshegs su gsol /
translated: He said, “Noble ones, I have invited two special guests. Please come.”

original: de gnyis kyis smras pa /
analyzed: de gnyis kyis smras pa /
translated: The two said,

original: khyim bdag 'on bcom ldan 'das la zhu'o zhes de gnyis kyis skabs de bcom ldan 'das la rgyas par gsol ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: khyim bdag 'on bcom ldan 'das la zhu'o zhes de gnyis kyis skabs de bcom ldan 'das la rgyas par gsol ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: “Householder, we will ask the Blessed One.” They went to the Blessed One and told him what had happened. The Blessed One said,

original: sngar mgron du bos pa gang yin pa des bza' bar bya ste 'di la 'gyod par mi bya'o //
analyzed: sngar mgron du bos pa gang yin pa des bza' bar bya ste 'di la 'gyod par mi bya'o //
translated: “The one who invited them first should serve them. There is no need to regret this.”

original: de gnyis bcom ldan 'das kyis gnang ste dmag dpon seng ge'i khyim du 'phags pa dang drug sde dag gis de gnyis mthong nas de dag gis smras pa khyed gnyis gar bzhud /
analyzed: de gnyis bcom ldan 'das kyis gnang ste dmag dpon seng ge'i khyim du 'phags pa dang drug sde dag gis de gnyis mthong nas de dag gis smras pa khyed gnyis gar bzhud /
translated: The Blessed One having given his permission, the two went to the house of the general Siṃha. The group of six saw them and asked, “Where are you going?”

original: dmag dpon seng ge'i khyim du'o ;
analyzed: dmag dpon seng ge'i khyim du'o ;
translated: “To the house of the general Siṃha.”

original: / de la dge 'dun gyis bslab pa'i sdom pa ma byin nam /
analyzed: / de la dge 'dun gyis bslab pa'i sdom pa ma byin nam /
translated: “Did the saṅgha give you the precepts?”

original: gang la byin pa de la byin gyi kho bo cag gnyis sngar mgron du bos so //
analyzed: gang la byin pa de la byin gyi kho bo cag gnyis sngar mgron du bos so //
translated: “We were invited by the householder before.”

original: drug sde dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: drug sde dag gis smras pa /
translated: The group of six said,🔽“Householder, you are not a Buddhist.”

original: gal te de ltar na kho bo cag gang gi tshe dmag dpon seng ges bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan snga nas bden pa dag mthong ba de'i tshe na ches sngar @45a * //
analyzed: gal te de ltar na kho bo cag gang gi tshe dmag dpon seng ges bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan snga nas bden pa dag mthong ba de'i tshe na ches sngar @45a * //
translated: If that is so, then when the general Siṃha saw the truths in the presence of the Bhagavat, at that time he was a human.🔽

original: mgron du bos so //
analyzed: mgron du bos so //
translated: If that is so, then when Siṅgha, the general, saw the truths in the presence of the Blessed One, he invited the Blessed One to be the first guest.

original: de gnyis cang mi smra bar dong ba dang / de dag kyang de gnyis kyi phyi bzhin phyi bzhin rjes su 'brang ba na dmag dpon seng ges dge slong rab tu mang po 'ong ba mthong nas mchog tu dga' ba bskyed de /
analyzed: de gnyis cang mi smra bar dong ba dang / de dag kyang de gnyis kyi phyi bzhin phyi bzhin rjes su 'brang ba na dmag dpon seng ges dge slong rab tu mang po 'ong ba mthong nas mchog tu dga' ba bskyed de /
translated: Those two went without saying anything, and since those two were followed by many monks, when Siṅgha, the general, saw the many monks coming, he generated supreme joy.

original: khyim mi la dgos pa gang dag yin pa de dag kyang dge slong rnams la brims so //
analyzed: khyim mi la dgos pa gang dag yin pa de dag kyang dge slong rnams la brims so //
translated: He gave to the monks whatever was needed for the household.

original: de dag gis zos te dong ba dang / de'i bu dag gis zas blang bar brtsams pa na /
analyzed: de dag gis zos te dong ba dang / de'i bu dag gis zas blang bar brtsams pa na /
translated: After they had eaten and left, his sons began to take the food.

original: des smras pa /
analyzed: des smras pa /
translated: He said,

original: bu dag khyim mi la dgos pa gang dag yin pa de dag kyang dge slong rnams la brims kyis gzhan ma grub kyi bar du re zhig sdod cig de dag gis du bar brtsams pa mthong nas /
analyzed: bu dag khyim mi la dgos pa gang dag yin pa de dag kyang dge slong rnams la brims kyis gzhan ma grub kyi bar du re zhig sdod cig de dag gis du bar brtsams pa mthong nas /
translated: “Sons, whatever is needed for the household, give it to the monks. Stay for a while until the others return.” They began to eat.🔽The monks with few desires complained and criticized them,

original: dge slong don nyung ngu dag ci'i phyir dge slong dag slob pa dag gis khyim gang dag dge 'dun gyi bslab pa'i sdom pas bsdams pa dag tu sngar mgron du ma bos par dong ste /
analyzed: dge slong don nyung ngu dag ci'i phyir dge slong dag slob pa dag gis khyim gang dag dge 'dun gyi bslab pa'i sdom pas bsdams pa dag tu sngar mgron du ma bos par dong ste /
translated: “Why do monks who are students go to the houses of those who are bound by the Saṅgha’s rule of training,

original: rang gi lag gis bca' ba dang bza' ba blangs nas 'cha' bar byed /
analyzed: rang gi lag gis bca' ba dang bza' ba blangs nas 'cha' bar byed /
translated: eat with their own hands the food that has not been invited beforehand,🔽and eat it?”

original: za bar byed ces smod par byed /
analyzed: za bar byed ces smod par byed /
translated: They disparaged them,

original: phyar kha gtong bar byed /
analyzed: phyar kha gtong bar byed /
translated: and spread it about.

original: kha zer bar byed pa'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //
analyzed: kha zer bar byed pa'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //
translated: The monks reported this matter to the Blessed One.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byung ba 'di dang / gleng gzhi 'di dang / skabs 'di la dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdu ba mdzad de /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byung ba 'di dang / gleng gzhi 'di dang / skabs 'di la dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdu ba mdzad de /
translated: Then the Blessed One, having assembled the saṅgha of monks with this account and this basis and this incident,

original: drug sde dag la rmas nas /
analyzed: drug sde dag la rmas nas /
translated: asked the group of six,

original: dge sbyong gi tshul ma yin pa /🔽rjes su mthun pa ma yin pa /🔽rung ba ma yin pa /
analyzed: dge sbyong gi tshul ma yin pa / rjes su mthun pa ma yin pa / rung ba ma yin pa /
translated: It is not the way of mendicants.🔽It is not suitable.🔽It is not proper.

original: tshul dang mthun pa ma yin pa /
analyzed: tshul dang mthun pa ma yin pa /
translated: It is not fitting.

original: de ni rab tu byung bas bya ba ma yin no zhes rnam grangs du mar rnam par smad de /
analyzed: de ni rab tu byung bas bya ba ma yin no zhes rnam grangs du mar rnam par smad de /
translated: It is not something that should be done by those gone forth.”

original: bslab pa bca' pa'i phan yon bcu yang dag par gzigs pas nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /🔽slob pa dag gi khyim gang dag dge 'dun gyi bslab pa'i sdom pas bsdams par gyur la /
analyzed: bslab pa bca' pa'i phan yon bcu yang dag par gzigs pas nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste / slob pa dag gi khyim gang dag dge 'dun gyi bslab pa'i sdom pas bsdams par gyur la /
translated: “Seeing the ten benefits, I, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One, will establish a training rule for my disciples, such that the disciples should recite it in this way:🔽‘Those in training should not eat in the houses of families that are bound by the Saṅgha’s training rule.

original: yang dge slong gang slob pa dag gi khyim gang dag dge 'dun gyi bslab pa'i sdom pas bsdams pa de lta bu dag sngar mgron du ma bos par song ste /
analyzed: yang dge slong gang slob pa dag gi khyim gang dag dge 'dun gyi bslab pa'i sdom pas bsdams pa de lta bu dag sngar mgron du ma bos par song ste /
translated: If a monk, without first being invited, should go to the houses of families that are bound by the Saṅgha’s training rule and eat there,

original: rang gi lag gis bca' ba dang / bza' ba blangs nas 'cha' 'am za na dge slong des phyi rol kun dga' ra bar song ste dge slong rnams la tshe dang ldan pa dag bdag la smad pa'i gnas mi rigs par so sor bshags par bya ba byung gis chos de so sor 'chags so zhes
analyzed: rang gi lag gis bca' ba dang / bza' ba blangs nas 'cha' 'am za na dge slong des phyi rol kun dga' ra bar song ste dge slong rnams la tshe dang ldan pa dag bdag la smad pa'i gnas mi rigs par so sor bshags par bya ba byung gis chos de so sor 'chags so zhes
translated: If a monk takes food or drink with his own hands and then eats or drinks it, he should go outside the monastery and confess his downfall to the other monks, saying, ‘Venerable ones, I have committed an act of self-abasement that is to be confessed individually. I confess this act.’

original: so sor bshags par byas te chos 'di yang so sor bshags @45b par bya'o zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
analyzed: so sor bshags par byas te chos 'di yang so sor bshags @45b par bya'o zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
translated: This is the rule that he should confess.

original: yul ni yangs pa can /
analyzed: yul ni yangs pa can /
translated: The place was Śrāvastī.

original: gang zag ni drug sde /
analyzed: gang zag ni drug sde /
translated: The people were the group of six monks.

original: nyon mongs pa ni 'gran zla tshol ba /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ni 'gran zla tshol ba /
translated: The affliction was seeking rivals.

original: nyes pa ni bslab pa dral te khyim du 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: nyes pa ni bslab pa dral te khyim du 'jug pa'o //
translated: The misdeed was entering a house after breaking the training.

original: de'i tshe na yangs pa can gyi litstsha b'i dag dpong sa'i khang pa nas gtam 'dri zhing 'khod pa de dag gis dge slong de dag dmag dpon seng ge'i khyim nas byung ba mthong nas de na gang dag ma dad pa de dag gis smas pa /
analyzed: de'i tshe na yangs pa can gyi litstsha b'i dag dpong sa'i khang pa nas gtam 'dri zhing 'khod pa de dag gis dge slong de dag dmag dpon seng ge'i khyim nas byung ba mthong nas de na gang dag ma dad pa de dag gis smas pa /
translated: At that time, the Licchavi people of Śrāvastī were sitting in a pavilion, discussing various topics. When they saw the monks coming out of the house of the general Siṃha, those who had no faith said,🔽“The monks are not pure.

original: shes ldan dag gang gi tshe dmag dpon seng ge dge sbyong goo ta ma la dad par gyur pa de tshun chad nas de'i longs spyod dag bsrabs pa dang / yongs su zad pa dang / yongs su gtugs par gyur to //
analyzed: shes ldan dag gang gi tshe dmag dpon seng ge dge sbyong goo ta ma la dad par gyur pa de tshun chad nas de'i longs spyod dag bsrabs pa dang / yongs su zad pa dang / yongs su gtugs par gyur to //
translated: “Sirs, ever since General Siṃha came to have faith in the ascetic Gautama, his wealth has been depleted, exhausted, and lost.”

original: dad pa can dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: dad pa can dag gis smras pa /
translated: The faithful said,

original: shes ldan dag gang bcom ldan 'das la mngon par dad pa de'i longs spyod dag bsrabs pa dang yongs su zad pa dang yongs su gtugs par gal 'gyur /🔽'di ltar dmag dpon seng ges ni bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan snga nas /
analyzed: shes ldan dag gang bcom ldan 'das la mngon par dad pa de'i longs spyod dag bsrabs pa dang yongs su zad pa dang yongs su gtugs par gal 'gyur / 'di ltar dmag dpon seng ges ni bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan snga nas /
translated: “Sirs, how could the wealth of one who has faith in the Blessed One be depleted, exhausted, and lost?”🔽“Sirs, General Siṃha,

original: bden bdag mthong nas /
analyzed: bden bdag mthong nas /
translated: having seen the truth in the presence of the Blessed One,

original: des zhing las kyi mtha' dag kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa yin no zhes rgyun bcad pas des na de'i longs spyod dag bsrabs pa dang / yongs su zad pa dang yongs su gtugs par gyur to //
analyzed: des zhing las kyi mtha' dag kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa yin no zhes rgyun bcad pas des na de'i longs spyod dag bsrabs pa dang / yongs su zad pa dang yongs su gtugs par gyur to //
translated: stopped farming, saying, ‘Farming is accompanied by wrongdoing.’ Therefore his wealth has been depleted, exhausted, and lost.”

original: yangs pa can gyi litstsha b'i dag gis gros byas nas dmag dpon seng ge'i zhing ba dag la smras pa /
analyzed: yangs pa can gyi litstsha b'i dag gis gros byas nas dmag dpon seng ge'i zhing ba dag la smras pa /
translated: The Licchavis of Vaiśālī discussed this and said to the farmers of Siṃha, the general:

original: shes ldan dag khyed ci'i phyir dmag dpon seng ge'i zhing las kyi mtha' dag mi byed gla ma thob bam ci /
analyzed: shes ldan dag khyed ci'i phyir dmag dpon seng ge'i zhing las kyi mtha' dag mi byed gla ma thob bam ci /
translated: “Sirs, why don’t you do all the farming of Siṃha, the general? Have you not been paid?”

original: de dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: de dag gis smras pa /
translated: They said,

original: shes ldan dag gla ma thob pa ma yin te /
analyzed: shes ldan dag gla ma thob pa ma yin te /
translated: “Sirs, we have not been paid.

original: dmag dpon gyis bdag cag bkag na ji ltar bya khyed cag la tshogs kyi bsko'i /
analyzed: dmag dpon gyis bdag cag bkag na ji ltar bya khyed cag la tshogs kyi bsko'i /
translated: What can we do if the general forbids us? You must give us a guarantee.”

original: deng la dmag dpon gyi zhing las kyi mtha' dag gyis shig /
analyzed: deng la dmag dpon gyi zhing las kyi mtha' dag gyis shig /
translated: “Go and do all the farming of Siṃha, the general.”

original: de nas yangs pa can gyi litstsha b'i dag gi tshig las dmag dpon seng ge'i zhing las kyi mtha' dag bya bar brtsams pa dang / lhas dus su char gyi rgyun dag legs par phab nas lo tog gi 'byor pa chen po skyes par gyur to //
analyzed: de nas yangs pa can gyi litstsha b'i dag gi tshig las dmag dpon seng ge'i zhing las kyi mtha' dag bya bar brtsams pa dang / lhas dus su char gyi rgyun dag legs par phab nas lo tog gi 'byor pa chen po skyes par gyur to //
translated: Then, because of the word of the Licchavis of Vaiśālī, they began to do all the farming of Siṃha, the general. The gods caused the rain to fall in a timely manner, and a great abundance of crops was produced.

original: dmag dpon seng ge longs spyod dag gis mthos par gyur nas bcom ldan 'das gal ba der song ste phyin nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs gnyis la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te mtha' gcig tu 'dug go //
analyzed: dmag dpon seng ge longs spyod dag gis mthos par gyur nas bcom ldan 'das gal ba der song ste phyin nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs gnyis la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te mtha' gcig tu 'dug go //
translated: Having become wealthy, he went to the Blessed One. When he arrived, he touched his head to the Blessed One’s feet and sat to one side.

original: mtha' gcig tu 'dug nas bcom ldan 'das la dmag dpon seng ges 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: mtha' gcig tu 'dug nas bcom ldan 'das la dmag dpon seng ges 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: When he had sat to one side, General Siṃha said this to the Blessed One:

original: btsun pa sngon bdag gis longs spyod dag bsrabs @46a * //
analyzed: btsun pa sngon bdag gis longs spyod dag bsrabs @46a * //
translated: “Lord, previously, when my wealth had become depleted,

original: pa dang ; yongs su bas pa dang / yongs su gtugs par gyur nas dge 'dun don bzhed pa dang / phan pa bzhed pas bdag la bslab pa'i sdom pa stsal na /
analyzed: pa dang ; yongs su bas pa dang / yongs su gtugs par gyur nas dge 'dun don bzhed pa dang / phan pa bzhed pas bdag la bslab pa'i sdom pa stsal na /
translated: exhausted, and used up, the saṅgha, wishing to benefit me, gave me the vows of training.

original: da ni yangs pa can gyi li tstsha b'i'i tshogs kyis bdag gi longs spyod bsgrubs nas longs spyod dag 'phel bar gyur na bcom ldan 'das kyis thugs brtse ba'i slad du bdag la bslab pa'i sdom pa gzhig pa mdzad na legs so //
analyzed: da ni yangs pa can gyi li tstsha b'i'i tshogs kyis bdag gi longs spyod bsgrubs nas longs spyod dag 'phel bar gyur na bcom ldan 'das kyis thugs brtse ba'i slad du bdag la bslab pa'i sdom pa gzhig pa mdzad na legs so //
translated: Now, since the assembly of Licchavis of Vaiśālī has provided for my wealth, and my wealth has increased, it would be good if the Blessed One, out of compassion, were to destroy the vows of training for me.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis dmag dpon seng ge la cang mi gsung bas gnang ngo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis dmag dpon seng ge la cang mi gsung bas gnang ngo //
translated: The Blessed One assented to General Siṃha by remaining silent.

original: de nas dmag dpon seng ges bcom ldan 'das kyis cang mi gsung bas gnang bar rig nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs gnyis la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan snga nas song ngo //
analyzed: de nas dmag dpon seng ges bcom ldan 'das kyis cang mi gsung bas gnang bar rig nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs gnyis la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan snga nas song ngo //
translated: Then General Siṃha, knowing that the Blessed One had assented by remaining silent, bowed low until his forehead touched the Blessed One’s feet, and then departed from the Blessed One’s presence.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /
translated: Then the Blessed One said to the monks,

original: dge slong dag dmag dpon seng ge dang gzhan yang de lta bu gang yin pa'i bslab pa'i sdom pa gzhig par bya zhing /
analyzed: dge slong dag dmag dpon seng ge dang gzhan yang de lta bu gang yin pa'i bslab pa'i sdom pa gzhig par bya zhing /
translated: “Monks, the training should be lifted for General Siṃha and anyone else like him.

original: der dge slong rnams ji ltar kun du spyod pa'i chos rnams kyang yang dag par blangs te gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: der dge slong rnams ji ltar kun du spyod pa'i chos rnams kyang yang dag par blangs te gnas par bya'o //
translated: And there, the monks should take up and follow the rules of customary behavior.”
